87001.name: Glee CD Board Game
87001.description: It's time to "free your Glee". Show your friends how much you know about the show. Ask questions of your teammates so you can guess the glee character. Then your teammates act, sing, dance, do whatever they must to get you to guess what that character does. All the time you're holding the "Glee-full" holder with the answer card over your head. Hurry, before time runs out and the school bell rings.

87002.name: Wallace & Gromit's Grand Adventures - Episode 3: Muzzled!
87002.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Monty Muzzle, a newcomer in town, is holding a grand fundraiser to rebuild the local dog shelter. Gromit soon realizes that Muzzle's intentions aren't exactly charitable and he must foil the huckster's plot to save the town's investment and rescue his canine friends.

87003.name: Wallace & Gromit's Grand Adventures - Episode 4: The Bogey Man
87003.description:
Source: The Developer Website.

Wallace has been admitted to Prickly Thicket, the oldest country club in Lancashire. Wallace and his faithful caddie Gromit get wrapped up in a decades-old club dispute that threatens to destroy their peaceful West Wallaby lifestyle, and the duo must fight to save the neighborhood they hold dear!

87004.name: Grizimilak
87004.description:
From Overview:

Establishing a settlement in or near swamplands is a difficult task at best. Settlers have to contend with disease, vermin, flooding, predators, and a host of other conditions. While many of these can be overcome through perseverance, some obstacles are insurmountable. Grizimilaks are one such case. More than one settlement has been abandoned because of these well-meaning nuisances, often spreading the problem to other regions.

Grizimilaks are overly friendly swamp dwellers that believe they are of gnomish descent (a claim refuted by any sane gnome). Their short, almost goblinoid appearance, gnomish affinity, and constant trails of grime have earned this prolific race many derogatory names. They may be called sludge imps, grimekin, or hundreds of other names. They are most commonly called gnomblin, to the chagrin of both gnomes and goblins. Of course, high-spirited grizimilaks are oblivious to the insult.

Grizimilaks breed at an alarming rate, and have a surprisingly long lifespan. A single grizimilak, whether offering assistance or devising pranks, is a nuisance. In large numbers, the race reaches the levels of natural disaster. The race is very hardy, making an infestation nearly impossible to get rid of. Once a grizimilak adopts a person or a settlement, the end quickly follows.

87005.name: Ith Wra
87005.description:
From Overview:

The secretive IthWra are a testament to the variety of the KaNgrej. This branch of the KaNgrej line is only spoken of in hushed whispers by other KaNgrej, bogeymen used to scare the young, vessels of terror and violence. The truth of the IthWra is far less sinister. Though gifted in martial skill, IthWra are, at heart, philosophers, continually in pursuit of personal enlightenment.

87006.name: Chasm: The Rift
87006.description:
The player takes on the role of an unnamed Marine whose mission is to stop the so-called Time Strikers, mutant beings invading different time epochs, from taking over the earth. On this mission, he visits places ranging from military bases in the present to Pharaonic tombs in ancient Egypt. All of the levels involve dark corridors, often like that of catacombs and crypts.

One of the most notable features of the game was the ability to remove limbs from enemies. Still of interest are the bosses which can't be killed by mere firepower but instead have to be brought down using special tactics.

Source: Wikipedia, "Chasm: The Rift", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87007.name: Jhardwyn
87007.description:
From Overview:

A fractured people, the jhardwyn are both much less and much more than other races. The jhardwyn are an amalgamation of myriad races, possessed of matchless potential. They have lost the cultural building abilities available to most races, forced to constantly wander.

The jhardwyn are the result of a cataclysmic fusion of a wide range of planar races. This event imbued the jhardwyn with a deep well of untapped potential, while consuming their civilization. So great is this power that the close proximity of jhardwyn to one another quickly consumes them. Even the countless worlds yearn for the power within the jhardwyn, consuming the essence of any jhardwyn who ceases to travel. Unable to plant the seeds of a new culture, the jhardwyn are perpetual travelers, forever visitors among other races.

Yet, the jhardwyn are an optimistic people, viewing their current misfortune as a step on the path to becoming something greater.

87008.name: Ka Ngrej
87008.description:
From Overview:

The term KaNgrej serves a dual purpose, referring to a formal race and a constantly expanding menagerie of sub-races. The prime race is the oldest, most commonly encountered archetype, referred to simply as the KaNgrej. The vast array of sub-races possesses formal racial names, such as VaeRdin, IthWra, and TaZoel, seldom referred to simply as KaNgrej.

KaNgrej as a species is similar to humanity, with an ability to thrive in virtually any environment. Where humanity commonly reshapes the environment for comfort, the KaNgrej readily evolve, adapting to new environments over several generations. Rapid adaptability accounts for the great diversity among KaNgrej sub-races, being well adapted to their native environments. However, the prime KaNgrej are more often inclined to follow the approach of humanity, sculpting the environment into habitable settlements, harvesting precious resources, forging powerful nations.

87009.name: Friendly Fire Pack 6
87009.description:
Friendly Fire Pack 6 contains eight scenarios featured in the Friendly Fire 2010 ASL tournament, and a new "ASLSK-style" mapboard.

Scenarios included:

FrF 45 - Totensonntag (Janowice, Poland, 10 September 1939)
FrF 46 - Dutch Courage (Outskirts of Dordrecht, Netherlands, 10 May 1940)
FrF 47 - Cutting off the Hydra's Head (Outskirts of Riga, Latvia, 29 June 1941)
FrF 48 - Bad Moon Rising (Kodorov, Ukraine, 29 August 1941)
FrF 49 - One Last Mighty Hew (West of Sevsk, Russia, 30 September 1941)
FrF 50 - Pavlov's Dogs (Northern Rzhev, Russia, 27 September 1942)
FrF 51 - Bite of the Bassotto (Near San Casciano, Italy, 27 July 1944)
FrF 52 - Dying for Danzig (Olivaer Tor, Gdansk, Poland, 27 March 1945)

87010.name: Diggers
87010.description:
User Summary

A strategy game where the player controls a team of diggers and goes through various levels trying to uncover and collect a certain amount of treasure buried in the ground. The player competes against a computer controlled team through many levels and gains several tools to aid in digging.

87011.name: Diggers 2: Extraction
87011.description:
User Summary

Diggers 2 uses a similar mechanic to Diggers 1 where the player controls a team of creatures who can mine into the ground. The object of Diggers 2 is to find fuel within the earth so the player can move onto the next level. Gone are the different clans from Diggers 1 where in Diggers 2 the player selects a team consisting of varied races with different strengths.

87012.name: Lidaem
87012.description:
From Overview:

The subtle touch of their political guidance is all but undetectable in desert cities. They mix freely with the social elite, the true extent of their influence going undetected by their peers. The exotic lidaem are both dependent on and separate from other desert cultures.

The lidaem are a race of female humanoids that become ingrained fixtures of desert cultures. An obvious comparison of the lidaem is made with amazons. Beyond the fact that both groups are composed entirely of females, there is little similarity between the two. Amazons are sub-races of other races. The lidaem are a proper race. Lidaem require males from other humanoid races to propagate the species, but always produce pureblooded lidaem. Lidaem shy away from the physical pursuits preferred by amazons, preferring to develop their psionic and social skills.

Yet, like amazons, lidaem possess a distinct culture. The home of the lidaem, Acobil, exists on a plane separate from the cultures they adopt. Acobil and the lidaem race are the priorities of the race, not allegiances to adopted cultures. Lidaem closely guard the secrets of their culture and Acobil. This hidden culture is maintained in small covens of traveling lidaem. Wherever one lidaem treads, so to does their culture.

87013.name: Das Super Mario Spiel
87013.description:
The game's theme is based on the GameBoy Version of Nintendo's "Super Mario Land" from 1989.

Story
Princess Daisy of Sarasaland was kidnapped by the monster Tatanga. Super Mario and Luigi travel through the kingdoms of Birabuto, Muda and Easton to reach the kingdom of Tschai where the princess is held. The first player who reaches Tschai and beats the evil Tatanga and the other players frees the princess and wins the game.

Contents:

1 Board
8 Figures in 4 different Colors
1 Dice
60 Cards




Flow of Play
Each player has two figures (Mario and Luigi). Players roll a die to determine how far one of their figures can move. The board has some special places like traps and questionmarks. Traps cast the figure some spaces back. Questionmarks let the player draw one of the cards. On these player may find enemies which can be fought by a die roll or special items which let them avoid traps or enemies. The player who reaches the final place with both figures has to defeat the last enemy and the other players by rolling the dice.

87014.name: Mneumra
87014.description:
From Overview:

The mneumra are living vessels for the essence of those ravaged by plague. Drawn to sorrow and loss, they are precursors to the coming of disease and death.

The first mneumra was a true construct, though the process of its creation has been lost to time. The events directly preceding and following it creation are passed down to each new generation of mneumrae. In the distant past, a great artificer remembered simply as Father lived in a realm beset by an unnatural plague. His family succumbed to the ravages of the spreading disease. The last of his children, his youngest child, was the last, fading fast. In a desperate gambit to save his child, Father made a pact with powerful nature spirits. The essence of the rapidly fading son was bound with potent arcane and natural energies, funneled into a waiting vessel. This construct was Father's greatest work, a piece of unrivaled craftsmanship. The memory of the child was preserved as the body failed.

As a condition of the pact, Father was obligated to preserve the essences of as many other sufferers of the plague as possible. Over the following months, Father traveled the crumbling kingdom, fulfilling his pledge. Father’s vessels were limited, however, only able to aid the youngest sufferers. During this time the term mneumra was coined by the parents of the young whose essences were preserved. The name was a combination of the words for “memory” and “urn”. Father saved many before being forced into seclusion, being afflicted by the plague. As the disease scoured all life from the land, only the mneumra were spared, left to rebuild.

Since that time, the mneumra have wandered, drawn to the first signs of plague. They continue to honor the memory of Father, preserving the essences of plague stricken young, final remembrances of their passing.

87015.name: Pergothi
87015.description:
From Overview:

Once a lighthearted race, the pergothi are now a jaded people. Their ability to create artistic masterworks is overshadowed by their rigorous military skill. The pergothi have a solemn duty to protect all aquatic creatures from those who dwell beyond the waves.

The pergothi once existed in far greater numbers. They were a race of artists responsible for wondrous pieces of aquatic art. Their creations joined worked items seamlessly with the natural world. These masterpieces were sought by those from both below and above the waves.

But the appetites of air-breathers are well known for their ravenousness. They demanded greater works. Over the course of a single century, their frenetic quest looted the treasures of the pergothi. But this was not the worst blow to the pergothi. Many airbreathing races viewed the exotic pergothi with the same avarice as their art. Those pergothi who did not flee were stripped from their home below the waves, becoming little more than pets. Most of these pergothi quickly withered in captivity.

Pergothi went unseen beneath the waves for centuries. When they finally returned, they were no longer the genteel artisans of old. They were a force to be reckoned with, possessing a divine mandate to drive air-breathers from beneath the oceans.

87016.name: Rin
87016.description:
From Overview:

Appearances can be deceiving. Most people know this, but still fall into the trap of not questioning too deeply. In some cases, this failure can have a high cost, such as when dealing with the rin.

Rin are fully aware of what others believe. It is easy to see the massive frame and assume it belongs to a hulking brute of limited intelligence. Rin do nothing to dissuade this misconception. In fact, rin intentionally perpetuate the stereotype that they are ignorant, solitary, short-lived beasts.

In truth, rin are cunning trappers who may live for centuries hidden under swampy waters. The cultural xenophobia of the rin is the only thing keeping these intelligent, powerful creatures from pursuing conquest.

87017.name: Ryonth
87017.description:
From Overview:

They fall from the desert depths in ones and twos. As with the first drops of a monsoon, they herald a mighty storm on the horizon. And, once the waters have passed, all that once stood will have been washed away.

The ryonth are a plague upon all races. A parasitic race of desert-born slavers, they view themselves as the rightful rulers of all. The ryonth hold none as allies, only tools. They ravage and consume all things they encounter, leaving desolate wastes in their wake. The race’s ability to bond with other creatures, draining these mounts in the process, fuels the fears of ryonth infestation.

Sages do not know the origin of the race. But it is easy to see their place in the nightmares of any culture. Many are the forgotten civilizations buried by the desert sands, le

87018.name: Ta Zoel
87018.description:
From Overview:

The TaZoel are perhaps the most frightening variant of the KaNgrej. Though not the most numerous or martially adept, the zealousness of the TaZoel sets them apart from their kin. This zealousness has not gone unnoticed by higher powers, as the race wields frightening divine might. The arrogance bred by this divine favor is readily apparent to other races, an arrogance displayed by even the meekest of TaZoel in excess of that seen among most other KaNgrej. Every TaZoel knows that the race was created superior to all other creatures.

87019.name: Thozeran
87019.description:
From Overview:

Mistaken for aquatic elementals, thozeran are creatures of myth and legend. Universally, aquatic races share stories of the reefs that walk. These benign aquatic shepherds are the guiding hands in stories of the young, voices of wisdom in fables woven through the fabric of aquatic tales. Yet few creatures have ever encountered these legendary humanoids.

Native to tropical waters, thozerans are a race of amble aquatic coral found throughout the seas. In their youth, they are perpetual wanderers, in constant journeys of exploration to the far reaches both below and above the waves.

Though their numbers are small, the impact of their existence is great. Their bodies form the hearts of coral reefs throughout the oceans. They are the shepherds of ocean creatures, the scales of the natural balance beneath the waves.

87020.name: Vae Rdin
87020.description:
From Overview:

VaeRdin are one of the many species of KaNgrej, aquatic quadrupeds found throughout the oceans. VaeRdin are one of the smaller, more hospitable species. They range throughout tropical waters, spending their short lives in chaotic pursuit of everchanging quests. These natural diplomats serve as intermediaries between KaNgrej and other races, exchanging their skills for interesting pieces of lore.

87021.name: Xeshaal
87021.description:
From Overview:

Eyeless they see. Earless they hear. Their hunger feeds the growing emptiness that is Vahhsh.

Superficially, xeshaals resemble exotic humanoids. From a distance, their tattooed bodies resemble alabaster-skinned humans. Their primitive garb makes them easily mistakable for albino barbarians with white hair that sways without wind.

Once close enough to make out their physical features, however, all illusions fall aside. What was mistaken for hair coalesces into tendrils of flesh. The facial features are painted on in a crude mockery of eyes, ears, nose and mouth. Hidden underneath is featureless flesh.

The eyes do not linger on the empty face, instead drawn to the gaping maws on their palms. Black liquid drips between the teeth, quickly dissipating.

Xeshaals are a truly alien race. They have no shared ancestry with any other race or creature, aliens among the races of the multi-verse. They are living portals to the plane of Vahhsh. Neither good nor evil, their only purpose is to experience and
feed the plane.

87022.name: Zure
87022.description:
From Overview:

The desert is a ravenous beast, consuming countless realms beneath its sands. The shells beneath the dunes are tombstones to myths and legends. It is these barren halls that the zure call home.

Zure are naturally drawn to the buried remains of ancient cultures, possessing an instinctual compulsion to find lost relics. Novice treasure hunters are often perplexed to discover catacombs buried for centuries bearing extensive signs of exploration. Veteran explorers, however, have come to expect the telltale signs of the zure. These experienced searchers view the absence of a zure presence as an ominous sign.

Sages and adventurers routinely seek out zure for their journeys into desert regions. The race’s natural relic hunting skills and good nature are a boon to any expedition.

87023.name: Naerwyn Bramblebee's Lexicon of Wordbinding
87023.description:
From Contents & Special Qualities:

Perusing through Naerwyn Bramblebee’s Lexicon of Wordbinding reveals a complete lexicon from a single language. Editions of the lexicon have been reported for a wide range of languages. The linguistic components in the lexicon are dynamic, automatically being updated as words are added to the language. As a purely linguistic tool, the lexicon is a wondrous creation. This makes the lexicon an update-to-date reference for a single language. Any creature attempting to access the lexicon must be able to read the language unaided. If any attempt is made to use external means, such as a tongues spell to access the contents of the lexicon, the pages appear filled with meaningless runes.

87024.name: Kobur's Encyclopedia of Exotic Ores
87024.description:
From Contents & Special Qualities:

Kobur’s Encyclopedia of Exotic Ores is an incredibly powerful research tome for anyone interested in the study of ores. The book contains well-organized, detailed notes and alchemical formulae on a vast range of materials. Though primarily concerned with ores, notes on other types of materials, such as papers and woods, can be found throughout the book.

87025.name: Longshot
87025.description:
User Summary: Submission for the Game Chef 2010 Competition.

Author's Blurb:

You’re a colonist four light years away from home.

Now the Sheriff has been murdered. And when he is found dead, you discover that Earth has gone silent. No radio communication for the last four years. Which means that the most recent supply ship was the last one. No more help or supplies are coming your way. How will you survive on this inhospitable desert planet?

87026.name: Brachininae
87026.description:
User Summary: Submission for the Game Chef 2010 Competition.

Subtitle: A Game about Human Heroes

Author Blurb:
Forty brave men of Skin have been trained for a mission never attempted before. They will fly in the sky with some old bombers that have been kept in Skin for all this time, some B-25 Mitchell of the second world war, and they will bomb the main generator of The City.

This mission will almost surely mean death for all of the people that will take part in it. Their bodies will explode in thousands of pieces, will be vaporized, and nothing of them will remain so that someone will be able to celebrate a funeral, a last farewell.

Anyway, they are right now flying to the core of the City. Through their memories, we will find out what makes them to take part in their last mission.

The story created with this game will explore the weeks before the mission, while the characters were training. In these moments they all were near each other, so in every scene there will be a conflict between two of the characters

87027.name: Walkers in the Witchery Way
87027.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Author Blurb:
You are a Skinwalker. Why is up to you- maybe you were raised by Skinwalkers out in the desert, say by a small tribe or a lone Skinwalker. Maybe you were born into an ordinary family in the City and you discovered the secret in the catacomb-libraries there, or have known instinctually since birth, or were taught the art by a Skinwalker you once knew. Whatever the reason, you have the ability to steal the shape from others.

What the journey is should be up to its players and GM, but there are three main stories. One, the story of those who adhere to the City going out into the desert to hunt the demons there. Two, the story of those who adhere to the desert, sneaking into the City in an attempt to sabotage their efforts and to destroy them if they can. Three, the story of the journey outward to escape both places and to discover the Empire.

87028.name: Memoir
87028.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Subtitle: What Will Your Life Story Be?

Author Blurb:
So what is this game all about?
Well its a story game about life.

With a group of friends you get to make up a set of stories about people. These won’t be detailed sagas. Instead we’ll dip into the lives of these characters at key points in their lives and find out a little about who they are and how they think. Some of the stories might be amusing, some sad, but they should all tell us something about the characters.

The most important part of the game though is seeing what these people leave behind:

How does the world change as a result of their actions?
How are they remembered?
How did they make a difference?

87029.name: Orcs
87029.description:
From publisher blurb:

Is your gaming group tired of facing the same old Villians? Are you feeling burned out and looking for a little help coming up with a fresh challenge for your players?

Well look no further!

"A Touch of Evil: Antagonists in your game," is a series of short pdfs devoted to providing fresh antagonists which are ready to drop into your campaign with minimal effort!

Volume 1: Orcs takes a look at the most widely used antagonist in the game, the Orc.This product provides you with npcs that are fresh,inventive, and most importantly,are ready to give your characters a run for their money! Each Orc npc is illustrated and comes with a detailed background and suggestions for using them in your campaign.

87030.name: World Riddle
87030.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Author Blurb:
Starting the game. If you have a group of 4 or more players (3 will do in a pinch, and more than 6-7 may feel unsatisfying), a copy of these rules, the various Question Cards, and a couple of hours of free time, great, you have everything you need to play this game. If you have the role requirements printed out and spread between the players as play aids, even better. Additionally a positive attitude and enthusiasm will help the game immensely!

World Riddle should be a koan - the answer to the question is neither important nor fixed, nor does it need to make any sense. The important part of the game is how the players reach the answer and what it reveals to them about the characters they create and about themselves.

87031.name: Hobgoblins
87031.description:
From publisher blurb:

“A Touch of Evil volume 2: Hobgoblins” greatly expands on the concepts introduced in A Touch of Evil, Vol. 1: Orcs. This PDF presents 6 NPC’s, each with additional level advancements for each charactermaking the GMs job easier. Additionally, a fully detailed hobgoblin mercenary army – The Broken Tooth Legion – has been provided with stat blocks for hobgoblin soldiers, officers and even Goblin Warg riders!

Each NPC is this PDF is formatted as a series of forms that make it so that the GM can print -- and customize -- only the pages that he needs. Note: These are not form-fillable pages, you must print and write on the forms to use them.

87032.name: International Soccer
87032.description:
User Summary:

International Soccer features 11-player teams, choice of pitch conditions, weather, team formation, match length, floodlight evening games and team colors.
Users control one soccer player at a time via joystick in the usual manner.
Up to four users may play, using a special joystick adapter.

87033.name: Gnolls
87033.description:
From publisher blurb:

What do demon-worshiping ghouls, vile sorcerers and werehyenas have in common? They are all found in A Touch of Evil Volume 3: Gnolls.

Inside this 70 page PDF you'll find two fully detailed gnoll tribes; the insidious Bloodfangs and the shape-shifting Moonwolves. Immerse yourself in the machinations of characters such as Ejark Demon-Talker, a cleric of the demon god Yathoggni who is obsessed with immortality and the creation of ghouls, or Chief Gathrote, a werehyena who leads the Moonwolf tribe in the frigid northlands.

Each of the 10 NPCs has 3 levels advancement, suggestions for using them in your campaign and information for using each one as a Player Character! A ghoul template, rules for playing younger gnolls and statistics for lesser members of the tribes are also included.

87034.name: Dwarves
87034.description:
From publisher blurb:

Looking for a few dwarf antagonists to spice up your game? Look no further!

The fourth volume of Reality Deviant Publication's "A Touch of Evil" line of game accessories focuses on one of the most beloved races in all of fantasy; The Dwarf.
Inside this PDF you will find seven dwarf antagonists including Durrigan Black heart, a Dwarven half fiend sorcerer who searches for a powerful artifact, the Amulet of Ghistarri, created by the dreaded sorcerer Ghistarri; Lord of Shapes.

Also included are two new magic items and a slew of stats for dwarven clan members, including warriors, cxraftsmen, Priests and scouts.

rpg: The Hand of Gulliver the Man-Mountain
87035.name: The Hand of Gulliver the Man-Mountain
87035.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission

Subtitle: A manual-digital-tactile roleplaying game

Author Blurb:
You are given a chance to be the first Lilliputians to explore the Hand of Lemuel Gulliver, a Man-Mountain recently washed ashore. Are you up to the task of walking the fingers, mining the nails, deciphering the tattoos, and crossing the ring? Will you become the Master of the Hand?

87036.name: Kobolds
87036.description:
From publisher blurb:

What do a Soul Knife Assassin and a CR27 sorcerer have in common?

They're all Kobolds!

That's right.

Inside this 27 page E-book you'll find 4 blood-curdling kobolds designed to give your players a run for their money, no matter what level they are.

Pit yourself against the mighty spells of the wicked druid Makheret Greenclaw.

Hunt down Wightscale, the deadly vile soulknife assassin before he slays his next target.

Match blades with Rikajat the Fierce; a mighty barbarian who loves to hunt and slay dwarves, always seeking vengeance for wrongs the race visited on him in past days.

Inside this book you'll also find information on kobold society, information on cognizance nodes, anscester spirits, new spells and a new magic item: The Phylactery of Protection!

87037.name: Polyhedron (Issue 148, Vol.21 No.5)
rpgissuearticle: Elminster's Everwinking Eye: A Wayfarer's Guide to the FORGOTTEN REALMS
Nocturno Muerte: An All Flesh Must Be Eaten Deadworld!!!
On The Trail: The Big Ones in Pictures
Terrors of Gothic Earth: Monsters From a Gaslit World
87037.description:
Cover art: It's the end of the world as we know it. To commemorate the final issue of Polyhedron in its current incarnation, we've invited artist Kent Williams and the wicker man from Celtic legend (not to mention from the Terrors of Gothic Earth article in this issue) to burn our logo in a Poly inferno. (from the credits page)

This was the final issue of Polyhedron before it was merged with Dungeon Magazine.

87038.name: Aquatic Hazards
87038.description:
From publisher blurb:

Discover the dying power of eldritch surface magicks collecting along the ocean floor while exploring the mysteries of the ocean and the abundant life of the deep seas! Reality Deviant Publications presents Aquatic Hazards -sixteen underwater hazards born of dying magic, all designed to challenge and terrify your players! Whether found within the rivers, lakes, and oceans of the world, or buried in the forgotten pools of ancient crypts, these hazards will add spice to any campaign!

Each hazard is detailed with a complete description of its appearance, the nature of the hazard, and detailed information on the origin of the hazard. Discover the decomposing power of bone dust, be entrapped by the lure of coral song or experience the vast planar energies in dimensional clouds and planar darkness!

87039.name: Chronicles of Skin PLAYTEST EDITION (Obsolete)
rpghonor: 2011 Indie RPG Award - Best Production - Runner-Up
2011 Indie RPG Award - Game of the Year - Runner-Up
87039.description:
User Summary: Submission for the Game Chef 2010 Competition.

Author Blurb:
CHRONICLES OF SKIN
The last chief is dead. The kingdom is on the brink of collapse. Once brothers, the Iho and Croen tribes turn their knives in the dark, poisoned by greed and fear. It is a time of rivalry and hatred.

It is the eve of civil war.

ABOUT THIS GAME
CHRONICLES OF SKIN is a storytelling game for three or more players. Each player contributes to the depiction of a bitter civil war, collaborating to render the peoples on both sides as victims in a grand and unfair struggle. Through a series of atrocities, players build a picture of the war as told by the victors, and record it with drawings, called GLYPHS, on a hieroglyphic mural called the SKIN.

87040.name: Billy la Banlieue
87040.description:
User Summary

Billy is a young rocker and a video game fan. Billy has been challenged and must reassert his superiority by travelling to four video game arcades and score high scores, but it's late at night and every denizen of the Paris suburbs are out to get him, unless he confronts them with the necessary object (a switchblade, a bottle, a heart...)

The game is a side-scrolling arcade-adventure on the vein of Sorcery, involving a lot of back-and-forth travel to find the necessary items, platform jumping and four different minigames the player must wins.

87041.name: Armed and Dangerous!: Serial Killers
87041.description:
From publisher blurb:

This E-book takes a look at a group that sends chills up our spines. Serial Killers are the stuff of urban legends and slasher films, though their existence in the real world is undeniable. Placing little to no value in human life, serial killers cut a path of destruction through communities, killing men, women and children indiscriminately.

This 14 page E-book gives you six serial killers to set loose in your campaign world. They all have their own motivations and personalities, from a bored librarian to a mystic who murders to increase his power. More than just one-shot villains, the characters in this book can haunt your players in session after session.

rpg: The Chaos Lords and the Desert of Death
87042.name: The Chaos Lords and the Desert of Death
87042.description:
User Summary: Submission for the Game Chef 2010 Competition.

Author Blurb:
The Chaos Lords and the Desert of Death, from here on referred to as Chaos Lords, is a beer and pretzels, completely over-the-top, science fantasy role playing game that should not be taken too seriously. What exactly does that mean?
● Beer and Pretzels game: Simple mechanics, simple characters, almost no math beyond basic addition and dividing by two, and a setting that fully accepts unexpected characters.
● Completely over-the-top: The goal of the game is to ride out from the Last City with your group of heroes, destroy hordes of Death’s minions, and, if you make it far enough, destroy Death itself. Who are these heroes? Just about anything you can dream up. In Appendix A, you will find a few sample characters, including a Viking warchief, the Martian alchemist responsible for destroying most of the dinosaurs on Earth, and a walking war machine being controlled by a brain cloned from Abraham Lincoln.
● Science Fantasy: Alchemists and cloned brains...
● Should not be taken too seriously: ... of former presidents.

87043.name: Armed and Dangerous!: Ravage!
87043.description:
From publisher blurb:

This E-book takes a look at a terrorist organization known as Ravage. The 11 page E-book gives you six key members of this terrorist group to set loose in your campaign world.

87044.name: The Cleaved Boar Inn
87044.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cleaved Boar Inn provides GM's with a fully-detailed inn and tavern ready to drop into any D20-based fantasy game setting. Unlike other tavern supplements however, The Cleaved Boar Inn has three alternate histories and is pre-stocked with notable patrons. The Cleaved Boar Inn also provides creatures such as the ghost of a little girl, a Black Pudding, three variants on a Shield Guardian, and other threats for characters who find themselves immersed in the plethora of plot hooks that have been provided for you!

87045.name: Burial at Crossroads
87045.description:
User Summary: Submission for the Game Chef 2010 Competition.

Author Blurb:
At the crossroads, a pile of broken water-rich rock marked the road west; the north road bore a sign marked ‘To New Askja.’ Those who could read went north. You journeyed west. West across the volcanic desert, past other greners who already marked their claims with names like Lamia, Usha’s Hole and Lunar Landing. Your claim, illegally named after your lost love, proved barren. Without money, without food, without friends, without love, taking a job meant a chance at another claim and wealth and maybe love.

The job: Deliver a skinner to Oasis, the city of exile. An exile’s fresh start means your fresh start. To help you along your journey, someone in exile hired a mercenary, a scientist, a gambler, a frontiersman, a forgotten marshal and a native. Each of you have something to gain and something to lose. You’ll journey to Oasis together, apart or alone, and deliver the skinner or be consumed by the desert.

87046.name: Critical Feats
87046.description:
From publisher blurb:

So your character has just attacked and BAM; Natural 20! You score a critical threat! You follow up the roll and confirm the critical, adding X2 damage to the…WAIT, You don’t want to do that, not when you can have your cleric deliver a savage blow with his war hammer, breaking the infidel’s sword arm in the process!

Hold on just a second.

Breaking his arm? What’s that you say? You can’t do that…

With Critical Feats now you can!

Critical Feats is a selection of 40 new feats designed to add spice to the critical hit mechanic. No longer do you have to simply take the same old damage over and over again each time you score a critical hit. Now, a critical hit can knock your opponent out, slash his throat, break a limb or even rupture a lung!

Ladies and gentlemen, combat just got more dangerous.

87047.name: Gestalt Surge Feats
87047.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gestalt Surge Feats is a 14 page pDF conatining 45 new feats for Gestalt Wilder characters.

Gestalt Surge Feats expands upon the Wilders ability to Wild Surge and the ability to enter a Surging Euphoria afterwards. You will find feats that enhance the abilities of Gestalt Wilders.

87048.name: Symbolon
87048.description:
Author Blurb:
User Summary: Submission for the Game Chef 2010 Competition.

Author Blurb:
A Journey to Fall
Not knowing is worth a Question

You asked a Question. Of someone. Yourself. World. Life. Doesn't really matter. It has been pressing your soul and now it's out there. No taking it back. You've asked it. Now there's a fragment of a street map drawn on your palm, in ink. Like an imprint from a cheap newspaper, but there.

It's here, in the City. Your Answer waits. So start moving. Through the streets. Through time. Step of the building already. Fall. Fly.

Can't stay on the Edge forever. There are too many things too be said. Your Skin knows. Watch it. Follow as the marks are written. Only... this is Your Question and Your Answer... So who's writing?

The City is a construct providing Answers. It superimposes itself on any given surrounding, mimicing time period and space. Once unfolded, it ensures both obstacles and guidance. Feeding on lost Pledges of those that were here before, it exists solely to react to Questions.

87049.name: Billy 2
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
87049.description:
User Summary

Billy is back in the second game of the Billy la Banlieue series. This time he must phone his fiance before she runs away with his rival, Ricky le Têtard. Problem is, all the phones require an access code, and Ricky has sent some of his friend to prevent Billy from making his call.

Though a side-scrolling arcade game like its predecessor, the adventure elements have been toned down. Instead of having to look for specific items to get rid of enemy characters, they must be fought in a beat'em up sequence. The player must monitor Billy's energy (it can be replenished by buying chewing gum at distributors) and money (used in phones and arcade games). There are videogame cabinets scattered around, each with a different minigame. Success in these games earns Billy money and parts of the code needed to use the phones and complete the game.

87050.name: Monsters of Conjuration
87050.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the second pdf in Reality Deviant Publications' Monsters of Magic product line, each PDF in the series detailing monsters based on the schools of magic. Within the pages of this PDF you will find six extensively detailed monsters based around the theme of conjuration. These monsters will either be creatures that rely on conjuration magic, are based on some element of a conjuration spell or are related to the school of conjuration in some other way.

Each monster entry contains full details on the monster, including description, background, ecology, hunting methods, habits, society and combat statistics. To further entice you to use these creatures in your games, an adventure hook is given for each monster in the pdf. DMs are encouraged to make the most of the supporting background material on every monster to create interesting, detailed and realistic encounters based on the nature and ecology of the creatures presented.

In addition, this pdf contains a number of new conjuration spells, as well as two new and interesting NPCs based on the creatures contained within this PDF.

87051.name: Monsters of Illusion
87051.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore new facets of the mysterious realm of illusion in this 27 page sourcebook which provides a number of new monsters and spells that have strong ties to the realm of illusion. In this PDF, you find a variety of creatures, from the benevolent, cat-like Asnae to the elusive Shimmer Dragon. Also included are a few new illusion-based spells to spice up your game, and much more!

Features:

6 new creatures
6 illusion spells
2 NPC’s created from creatures in this PDF.
A new magic Item; The Pendant of the Siren
And a detailed look at a new area, Fordrusil Forest, complete with a map of the region!

87052.name: d66 Vargr Names
87052.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

A double list special! A d66 list Vargr Male Names and list of Vargr Female Names presented in an easy to pronounce fashion. Whether you are looking for the perfect name for your Vargr character or if you are populating a world full of these canine aliens, d66 Vargr Names has your answer.

87053.name: d66 Scout Bases
87053.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

With the scout service busy delivering messages at top speed across known space, the Scout Bases are everywhere and they each need a name. Pull up a name quickly with d66 Scout Bases.

87054.name: d66 Military Bases
87054.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

With every world possessing several difference branches of its own military, there are alot of bases out there. d66 Military Bases make the job of coming up with unique names easy for you.

87055.name: d66 Disease Names
87055.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Ever needed a name right now and all you could think of was "Bob"? Do you want quick descriptions and details fill out your adventures? The d66 series is the answer for you. Each list consists of 36 possibilities to get you out of a pinch. Set in the Foreven Sector, each list comes ready to be integrated into your OTU game. Just roll your d66 and you have your answer.

Plagues, outbreaks, contagions. All different names for the same problem: diseases. Diseases are just as much a problem in the future, if not worse, as they are today. Name these troubles with something memorable. Name them from the d66 Disease Names list.

87056.name: Désir Mortel
87056.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Désir Mortel is the first of four adventures in the Le Mousquetaire Déshonoré campaign.

Le Mousquetaire Déshonoré is a tale of hatred and revenge and revolves around former King’s Musketeer Delmar Boulanger. Delmar was thrown out of the company after being caught commiting a heinous crime. He blames four musketeers for his ouster and plots sweet revenge!

This adventure is designed for beginning characters although more experienced characters can be accommodated with little difficulty.

It is not necessary to run the final three adventures in order to play Désir Mortel and, indeed, the Le Mousquetaire Déshonoré campaign arc only tangentially affects the events in this adventure.

87057.name: Wissens-Spektrum Nachfüll-Pack
87057.description: This expansion contains 540 cards with 3200 new questions to the basic game.

87058.name: NotChess
87058.description:
NotChess is a game on an 8X* board that is a checker-like game, using pieces called Alternators. Any piece is able to be captured by an opponent whose piece moves onto the square of the piece being captured. (By replacement)

The objective is to become the only player remaining on the board.
An Alternator moves as a chess knight when moving from a white square but it moves as a short range chess rook when moving from a black square. A player starts with six pieces on the rank closest to them.

87059.name: Last Chance, USA
87059.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Contest Submission

Author Blurb:
Welcome to the wasteland of the USA after nuclear war has devastated the cohesion of the country and scarred the land. What was once lush, green farmland is now dead desert, and people struggle for survival in a place with no laws, and few resources. A group of wanderers comes together to the remnants of a town, and looks to start rebuilding from there -- but they will have to face threats to their newfound community, both external and internal, as everyone alive has secrets and no one will risk their survival.

The essential gameplay of Last Chance, USA is the relationships between characters in times of stress when all of their essential life needs are being threatened both by friends and enemies. Treachery should run rampant and loyalties should be tested.

Setting inspirations include The Road Warrior, The Colony, Book of Eli, The Seven Samurai, and other stories of Post-Apocalyptic survival. Interactivity inspirations include a variety of Reality TV shows and the methods they use to induce chaos into these temporary communities.

87060.name: Elephant Checkers
87060.description:
Elephant Checkers is basically Turkish Checkers played on an Xiangqi Board with a extra rules and additional pieces.
Each player starts with 24 pieces (soldiers). The goal of the game is to leave your opponent with no moves (capturing all of their pieces does this nicely), or to promote an Elephant (a promoted Soldier) to King on the point in the center of your opponent's fortress.

As in many checker games captures are obligatory, and a player must choose the move with the most possible captures.
Soldiers move one square forward or horizontally. They may also capture an enemy piece (or a series of them) by jumping over it to a vacant junction beyond.

Once across the river a Soldier may move two squares or capture pieces two squares ahead or to the side, or capture a piece an adjacent piece and land two squares past it.

When a Soldier reaches the far side it promotes to an Elephant (the name source).
Elephants may move to any vacant junction (since Xiangqi is played on the points, not sqaures) vertically or horizontally. They capture by jumping over an enemy piece, and can continue to any empty square beyond the capture.

"They may promote to King and win the game if on the Throne point in the center of the opposing fortress, but that move counts as a non-capturing move, and can not be made when there is a capture available."

87061.name: If Wishes Were Horses
87061.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Contest Submission

Author Blurb:
Each player writes down 2-3 wishes on seperate index cards. The wishes can be anything he wishes had been, would be, or could be.

All wishes go into a bowl, and each player draws one at random, which then becomes the Dream which drives his character.

Each character exists in his own story. Characters do not need to exist in the same place, time frame, or even the same universe. Each player decides who his character is and when and where that character lives. He may reword his character's wish as seems appropriate for the character and setting.

The connection between the characters is in a theme that runs through all of their stories. Think of this theme as the the Title of a collection of short stories, each story featuring one of the characters in play. Players may choose a Title from the list, or agree on a new Title more appropriate to the Dreams forming their stories.

87062.name: What Happened Here
87062.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Contest Submission

Author Blurb:
A player imagines what happened in one particular phase of a person on a journey. Then they present the evidence of that journey to the other player.

Players take turns presenting the evidence for different phases of that journey. The player not presenting evidence asks questions then hypothesizes and interprets that evidence. Correct interpretations or changing the original idea of the story earn points.

87063.name: In Between
87063.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Contest Submission

Author Blurb:
In Between is a role playing game for two or more players. You will take on the role of a recently deceased soul that is stranded in The Wasteland. Will earn redemption and make it to The Golden City, or will you go down the path of corruption and slowly transform into a hideous monster?

87064.name: Monstrous Feats!
87064.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monsters are the principal challenge PCs face in their adventuring careers. Whether they are the monsters populating a dangerous dungeon, encountered in the wild wilderness, or the mastermind villains behind nefarious schemes, monsters are the staple of any fantasy game. Monsters possess a wide range of eclectic and extraordinary abilities, from the feared vampiric energy drain, to the weakening touch of the shadow. In the pages of this product you will find 48 feats that enhance these fearsome abilities of monsters, allowing them to enhance their abilities and use them more effectively against the PCs in any DM’s campaign.

The feats in this book allow you to create wild vampires that not only drain your energy but also drain your spells and use them against you, great trampling beasts that can scatter opponents that stand in their path in all directions, and creatures that have evolved powerful defences against the powerful turning power of clerics. With these feats, each creature has honed its traditional abilities into devastating attacks and powerful defences. Your monsters won’t be the same again!

87065.name: After the Fall
87065.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Contest Submission

Game Chef Blurb:
Another post-apocalyptic fantasy game in which you play the crew of a flying airship trying to survive. There’s a very strong Final Fantasy or general Japanese video game RPG tone and this is by far the game that comes closest to being a straightforward fantasy adventure game- though of the 1990s-2000s style, not old school retro.

87066.name: Planetouched Feats: Secrets of the Inner Planes
87066.description:
From Introduction:

Planetouched feats are feats that a character may acquire after having spent a certain period of time on a plane of existence which is not the dimension she was born into. Oftentimes, a character might pick up some essence of the plane she has been to, or learn some new ability that would not otherwise available if she had not interacted with the denizens of a particular realm.

Adventurers in general might gain some affinity for the plane or it’s denizens. Sorcerers and magi might find that they suddenly have a clearer grasp of spells which originate from the plane they have been exploring. Rogues traveling on the plane of shadow, for instance, may find that they are able to move through shadows in other dimensions much easier. Warriors might learn new fighting styles derived from the horrors they encounter in their otherworldly travels.

87067.name: Rage Feats
87067.description:
From Introduction:

This PDF is meant to expand what a character with the Ability to rage can do. There are four ways that Rage feats expand the Ability to rage. Rage feats may add a benefit to the character while raging, allow a character to gain a different ability from the standard Ability to rage, allow a character an additional benefit while already raging to gain additional benefits or even allow a character to place magical abilities upon their weapons while they are raging.

This PDF contains 66 new feats usable by anyone with the Rage or Whirling Frenzy ability. It also contains 3 feats exclusively for the variant Whirling Frenzy Ability to rage (see Appendix A for information on Whirling Frenzy). In addition, there are 10 feats for the variant Totem Barbarian (see Appendix B for Information on Totem Barbarians).

87068.name: The Fall of Granada (Game Chef 2010)
87068.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Contest Submission

Author Blurb:
In 1492, Castilians and other Europeans destroyed the last of the Berber Muslim kingdoms on the Iberian Peninsula, Granada. The ‘great’ Reconquista of Spain was complete. As the kingdom fell, many Muslims escaped. Some fled by sea, some by land. Now it’s your turn to play through their story. Pick from one of four archetypes and work your way through the deserts of Northern Africa, trying to reach the seat of friendly Muslim power in Cairo. You will forge ahead to find hope, but remember your past and seek revenge. Can you change history, or will the memory of doomed Granada be too much?

87069.name: Summoner Feats
87069.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wouldn't it be nice if you had more control over the monsters you summoned? With Summoner Feats, now you can!

Summoning spells are favorites of many players and DMs alike. Whether you play a cleric, wizard, druid, bard or ranger, the extra creatures summoned can have utility both in and out combat. This PDF presents a selection of more than 50 feats that can expand the repertoire of any spellcaster or conjurer. Summoner Feats presents a new kind of feat, the infusion feat, which can grant your summoned creatures additional benefits and make them more useful, particularly at higher levels. Within this selection of feats there is bound to be feats that can spice up your summoning spells or help build a versatile and powerful summoning character!

rpg: In Skin City, You Need an Edge
87070.name: In Skin City, You Need an Edge
87070.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Contest Submission

Author Blurb:
The inhabitants organized into neighborhoods and gangs emerged to claim those neighborhoods. To this day, the government will ship criminals into Skin City, in part to be rid of 'problem' prisoners and in part to keep the society within the walls unstable. As a result of all these factors, and more, just making what should seem a simple journey cross town can be a dangerous adventure.

Players play a community of characters who live in Skin City. These characters are familiar with one another, members of the same neighborhood, extended family, and/or gang. There may be conflict between the characters, but generally they are not antagonistic toward one another, if only because they are too busy working together to survive to turn on one another.

87071.name: Sunder Feats
87071.description:
From Introduction:

This PDF is designed to expand upon a character’s ability to use the Improved Sunder feat. The feats included allow a character to
sunder a ranged weapon that would normally hit them. In addition, they gain the ability to inflict damage upon opponents with the shrapnel created by the successful sunder. This PDF also includes a new monk fighting style.

87072.name: The Order of Eudeus
87072.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Order of Eudeus is a fully illustrated, 71 page E-book which provides players and GM’s with a detailed holy order complete with new base classes, prestige classes, 51 feats, new magic items, spells and new creatures allied with and against the Order of Eudeus, including the dreaded Apocalyptic Balor, Denziel. Also in these pages you will find a streamlined mass combat system for use in your OGL-based fantasy campaigns!

87073.name: The Flame of the Sea
87073.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something sinister is happening in the Shrouded Sea. The waters are receding, leaving the fishing boats and trade vessels landlocked which is crippling the fragile economy of the city of Molmur. To make matters worse, the city endures nightly raids by dreaded Saughuin. Molmur is in need of heroes, will you answer the call?

"Flame of the Sea" is a 36-page adventure designed for 3 to 4 3rd-level characters.

87074.name: Wreckin Crew
87074.description:
User summary:

In Wreckin Crew you can choose to play up to eight different and very unusual characters, drive a selection of amazing vehicles, control some hilarious yet effective weapons in a wild race around 10 massive racing landscapes. Whether you do it against the computer or against a real opponent you are guaranteed to experience an absolutely wrecking driving extravaganza.

87075.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 1 - March/April 1994)
87075.description: First issue. Cover art by Tony Szczudlo.

87076.name: Def Jam Rapstar
87076.description:
User Summary

Def Jam Rapstar is a rap karaoke game for the Wii, PS3, and Xbox 360, and a spinoff title of the Def Jam series. The game brings together a setlist of 45 popular rap songs and places the player on the mic to rap along. The radio edit versions of the songs were used in order to maintain a rating of ESRB: T.

Rapstar is played by following along with the song and rapping to the cues provided onscreen. Performing lyrics correctly gains points, while making mistakes will prevent combos, much like other karaoke and rhythm games. The setlist included with the game has a range of musical styles, and varies between countries. The North American edition includes “Gold Digger” by Kanye West, “Can’t Truss It” by Public Enemy, and “Brass Monkey” by the Beastie Boys. In addition to the included songs, extra songs can be downloads as DLC from the online store.

Players can go solo, team up with a friend, or compete with an opponent on a song, and a strong online community exists for players to interact with others worldwide. The Xbox 360 and PS3 titles include video capabilities, and players can upload videos of them rapping to the in-game songs. Video battles can also be initiated by uploading a video of the same song and having the community vote on which rendition of the song is better.

87077.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 2 - May/June 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Når den røde hane galer på Korkegen
87077.description: Cover art by Peter Andrew Jones.

87078.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 3 - July/August 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Den gode, den onde og den grusomme
87078.description: Front cover by Angus McBride. Back cover by Casper Vang.

87079.name: Sour Grapes of Wrath
87079.description:
From the website:

The Scenario:
One year ago, Robert Killingsworth bought the farm. Six months later, he was dead - leaving his widow, Elizabeth, to tend to their fledgling winery and vineyard on the outskirts of California's wine country. With mounting debts and no clue as to how to run a business, Elizabeth is desperate to sell the farm and recoup her losses. The fierce drought and shaky economy, however, have left the Killingsworth Farm on the market for far too long.

One early autumn day, six people passed through the gates of Killingsworth Farm to see Elizabeth - one of them, a cold-blooded Killer...

Those Present at Killingsworth Farm:

Michael Nightshade: This real estate developer from New York arrived unannounced with plans to buy Killingsworth Farm and develop it into a low-cost housing community. His boss ordered him to obtain the Killingsworth land at any price…

Dr. Chelsea Barren: After suffering a nervous breakdown, this psychiatrist and best-selling author moved to Northern California to relax… but she moved next door to the Killingsworths instead.

Vicki D'Adly: Elizabeth's estranged sister from New Jersey, she and her husband were traveling on vacation when Vicki decided to drop by Killingsworth Farm for a visit… a surprise visit.

Norman D'Adly: A real estate broker from New Jersey and husband to Vicki, Norman is trying to salvage his job and his marriage while traveling across the country on vacation.

Kathryn Lawless: Best friend to Elizabeth, this local librarian and historian has a flare for the eccentric. She lives down the road with her 15 cats and loves true crime - especially the mysterious, unsolved death of Robert Killingsworth

Enrique Graves: This young drifter wandered onto Killingsworth Farm just as Robert and Elizabeth were moving in. Elizabeth took a liking to Enrique and he has lived on the farm ever since - tending to the fields… among other things.

Which of these people has a secret worth killing for? Come to Killingsworth Farm and find out before it is too late!

http://www.whodunitmysteries.com/sour.html

87080.name: DJ Max Portable: Hot Tunes
87080.description:
User Summary

DJ Max Portable: Hot Tunes is a compilation music video game for the PSP. The game includes songs and features from DJ Max Portable and DJ Max Portable 2, and was designed to be a beginner-friendly version of the games.

Hot Tunes allows players to choose from a number of different songs. Each song has a preset note configuration that scrolls from the top of the screen, and the player must press the buttons in time to the notes in order to build combos and complete the songs. Notes can either be single points or drawn lines, the latter of which require the player to hold the button down for a period of time. Successfully hitting enough notes engages Fever Mode, which increases the score multiplier and note values.

The game is a combination of Portable and Portable 2, and features a number of different play modes. The player can choose to have songs set in 4B Lite, 6B or 8B modes, which correspond to the number of buttons present in the songs.

A limited print of 2000 Collector’s sets were produced which include a limited edition wooden case, calendar, original soundtrack, 2 booklet posters, and 8 mini posters.

87081.name: Virtue Cards
87081.description:
Virtue Cards
Attitudes and Actions of Excellence

Virtue Cards come as a standard deck of 52 poker-sized playing cards, each detailing a different Virtue.

However, the deck doesn't just contain an arbitrary list of Virtues. Instead, extensive research and experimentation has resulted in a systematic approach to classifying Virtues by several factors including Aspect, Focus, Type, & Rank.

Each Virtue Card defines the corresponding Virtue and gives a reference Bible verse along with a an easy to understand definition. Each card displays several symbols specific to the system to allow for quick visual reference. In addition, the cards have been implemented using normal suits and ranks allowing the cards to be used like a standard playing deck.

Ultimately, using the system makes learning and remembering the Virtues easy and fun as Virtue Cards can be used to play any existing card game with a "Virtuous twist" as well as games specifically designed for the system.

87082.name: Journeys (Issue 4)
rpgissuearticle: Journeyer's Guide to AErth: How a Fuedal Noble's Stronghold is Organized
The Gamemaster's Purview: The Grand Campaign, Part II
87082.description:
Journeys, Issue 4
Journal of Multidimensional Roleplaying
Cover Art by Raymond Van Tilburg
The Cover: An enraged AEgyptian priest-mage

87083.description: Wizard's Quest is a free print and play game in which you take the role of a wizard about to complete his training. In order to do this, you must defeat a creature called Gegenhound which lives in a place called "The Gether." The wizard advances around a the map via die roll and looks up events in a paragraph book depending on what square he landed in. The game has three ways it can be played: The wizard can learn The Path of Mind, Path of Nature, or The Path of Shadows (dark and deceptive magic). Each of these adds variety to the game by changing the victory conditions. The game also comes with three different difficulty levels which modify the total strength of The Gether.
87083.name: Wizard's Quest

87084.name: Builderland
87084.description:
User Summary

Builderland is a race-against-the-clock puzzle game. The player must lead a little character named Melba across each of the side-scrolling levels. Melba doesn't stop and can't jump or climb rocks, so the player must move items on the screen to help him out: stairs, trampolines, blocks to fill pot holes. Melba also picks up any objects he walks over and the player can use these objects later.

Each level has a different code, there is a "timed pause" option (the player can freeze the game for several seconds to ponder the next moves), and a suicide option should the character becomes stuck (which is the main cause of death in the game).

87085.name: Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess
87085.description:
Enter the Labyrinth and Rescue the Princess is a free print and play game in which one or two players must explore a labyrinth to rescue a princess in an attempt to win her love.

The game has two paths to victory. In the first, you must try to find at least six of the princesses seven missing belongings in order to curry her favor. In the second, you must kill the labyrinth's minotaur and bring its horns to the princess to prove your courage.

The game uses a paragraph system for events. When a player lands in a square, he or she looks up that square in the paragraph book to see what happens.

In the two player game, the player who retrieves the most missing possessions wins. If one player slays the minotaur then he or she is the winner.

87086.name: Journeys (Issue 6)
87086.description:
Journeys Issue 6
Journal of Multidimensional Roleplaying
Cover Art by Ken Widing

87087.description:
The DragonSlayer is a free print and play game in which the player must enter seven lairs and slay each the beast that lives there. Each time a beast dies, the player can collect the weapon that the beast had in it's lair. The weapons are humorous and include such things as a double barreled bazooka, a rocket sword, and a tank.

The combat system is very simple. Both the player and the beast have a starting health which is decreased by modified die roll. Depending on your weapon and the beast's strength the damage may be a die roll + 2, a combination of four dice rolled together, or similar modifiers. Each lair and weapon has it's own modifier. Assuming that you survive combat, you're health is automatically reset for the next cave.

Each beast is more difficult to kill than the last (culminating with the dragon in the 7th lair), but each new weapon is more powerful so the player's combat ability increases with the game's difficulty. The game is won by slaying the dragon.
87087.name: The DragonSlayer

87088.name: Duck Attack!
87088.description:
User Summary

Duck Attack! is an action-adventure game developed by Will Nicholes. The game was developed as a retro-style game for the Atari 2600, and has a similar feel to games of that generation. The story begins with a mad scientist creating a group of mutant, fire breathing ducks that lay Plutonium eggs. These eggs are to be used in a doomsday device, and it is up to the player to collect them and stop the scientist.

The player controls a robot that has been sent into the scientist’s lair. Contact with the ducks or other obstacles results in losing a life. The game was released in both cartridge form and as a downloadable ROM pack.

87089.name: Cosmic Journey
87089.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Game Chef Blurb:
You find yourself in the Cosmic Temple Arena charged with bringing the band "Journey" back together to play a rock show on which the fate of the entire universe depends. Beware! The Agents of Entropy are out to spoil your quest and hasten the end of all creation.

87090.name: A City
87090.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Author Blurb:
A role playing game for 1 or more players along with a traditional game master role, intent on the journey involved in exploring a strange city located somewhere not entirely known, far from the comfortable and familiar.

In A City RPG the players take on traditional characters, sometimes with non-traditional abilities, and just explore the city and their surroundings, to discover what can be found in a straightforward RPG fashion.

A City is not an entry level Roleplaying Game. The author presupposes at least a passing familiarity to the idea of assuming characters, a player with the will to make decisions and to come up with things for a character to do, outside of having a Game Master. The players must have some idea of what a character might like to do, have some sense of independence in order to succeed, to enjoy, playing a game set in A City.

Likewise a Game Master, term used here, must have some idea of what sounds good to them, to run the game well.

Time to dive into the game set in A City.

87091.name: Red Land, Black Land
87091.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Author Blurb:
Red Land, Black Land takes place 5,000 years ago. Some of the familiar images of ancient Egypt have begun to arise, side-by-side with the trappings of the north African stone age.

You will play one of a small group of dissidents who want to escape the growing power of the man who will soon become the first pharaoh. Common knowledge says that to the east and west, the desert simply continues on forever. For one reason or another, though, you have decided to set out anyway, to find a place that may not even exist.

87092.name: A Sojourn in Alexandria
87092.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Author Blurb:
Alexander the Great forged one of the largest empires in ancient history. He was taught a secret wisdom by Aristotle, that to succeed in life one needs to walk the Edge between the Desert and the City. With the assistance of this scroll, you may journey in his footsteps.

A Sojourn in Alexandria is a game examining how a journey can shape a character, for good or for ill. It's meant to tell stories of both the physical voyage and the ethical one. The characters try to walk the knife's edge between the deprivation of the harsh Desert and the excess of the opulent City.

This game is intended for a single session of play; ideally suited to convention play or as an intermission to an ongoing campaign. It involves one Game Master who will one who directs the Desert and the City during the course of play.

Additionally, the game requires between one and six players who portray travellers who will work together to reach or flee from the great city of Alexandria. Each participant needs 6 six-sided dice, a character sheet, a writing implement and six small markers or tokens.

87093.name: Edge City
87093.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Author Blurb:
A roleplaying game set to a modern city, with modern men and women. It is played out with 4-5 players, using a method with shifting "DMs" (Deux ex Machina). The game is playable as a series of 2 hours sessions, or as a heavy 4-5 hours intense journey.

Edge City lies between the desert and the edge of the world. The characters of the game are explorers going over The Edge. A giant crane will hoist their exploration capsule into the starlit void. These explorers boldly goes where no man has gone before, dangling on the end of a wire, trapped in a capsule, dying to find out what is hidden in the darkness. What they find, is the old and twisted "skin" of their own city, peopled with strangely familiar ghost ...

87094.name: City in Darkness
87094.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Author Blurb:
You have completed your Apprenticeship and you are now a Journeyman Magi. What does that mean? Well, first off, you don’t have to go to school anymore. You are a full-fledged Magi. Journeyman Magi are expected to work with various Master Magi in order to learn new and different techniques. In this way, you can become a Master yourself. You are expected to train diligently under different Masters and in different cities so that your technique does not stagnate, or worse your art becomes inbred.

This RPG is about the mysteries you and your fellow Magi will encounter on your journey to become a Master. For you live in a magical world and your duty, as a Magi, is to protect those weaker than yourself. Mostly you are protecting the people from warlocks. Warlocks are Magi who have turned their eyes away from the light.

87095.name: Broken Dream
87095.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission.

Author Blurb:
You could have chosen comfort, you could have chosen easy. At anytime you wanted you could have made the journey from the desert to the south. There you could have joined those who have forgot what was and indulged in mindless pleasures. But you didn’t, and instead you fight the harsh desert land everyday, spending your free time creating songs about what came before.

You mark your skin with glyphs that evoke the memories of what was, and call these the marks of yesterday. These protect you from the harsh mind-bending nature of your new world, and give you power to hold your own against the beasts that hunt you. You have pooled all your power into the sacred stone and ink, and it in turn becomes your armor.

Now your tribal leader has called you to the task. A young one has run off with the sacred ink into the badlands of the north. You and your companions are charged with finding them and returning the ink. Failure is not an option, without the ink there will be no more marks of yesterday and all will be lost. Under the guidance of the sacred stone, you head out into the badlands of the north, the place that lies between the edge of the what is and what may be, and begin a journey through... the Broken Dream.

A game of the journey into a fuzzy land of what is and what may be.

87096.name: Wicked Wickets
87096.description:
Wicked Wickets is a cricket based table game suitable for the whole family, cricketers and non-cricketers alike, and can accommodate anything from two to twenty-two players. The game involves selection, bowling, batting, and active fielding, allowing for short over fast action games through to the complex realms of strategy found in test play. Although, like with cricket itself, the basics are simple and easily learnt, it will inevitably take a lifetime to master.

No prior knowledge of cricket is needed to play the game which is suitable for the whole family and up to 22 players. In essence the side that scores the most "runs" wins, though selecting the right players, the order they play, and where they are positioned all affect the outcome of the game. The basics of Wicked Wickets are really quite simple; the bowler throws the ball, in this case the red ball shaped die, and the batsman "hits" it by throwing the buff bat-shaped die. Adding the scores together shows how far the ball goes using the long flight measure. If the batsman's score is higher than the bowlers, the ball "flies" in the air; if the bowler's score is higher than the batsman's, then it is struck along the ground. The yellow counter and dice are used to show which direction the ball goes. The short pace measure is simply used to measure the distance players move and the green die is mostly used for fielding. The game cards give the individual abilities of the players affecting how and where they are used. However, as with most games there is often more to it than first meets the eye. --From the publisher

Official website: http://www.boadiceasbackyard.com/

87097.description:
"Out of the Bunker" is a package of 14 ASL scenarios from the ASL Fanzine "Dispatches from the Bunker".

The scenarios include some of MMP's favorites:

Riding the Coattails, Poland 1939
Point 247, France 1940
Brasche Encounter, France 1940
Headhunting for Bloody Huns, Crete 1941
Clearing Kamienka, Russia 1941
First Clash in Tunisia, Tunisia 1942
Crisis at Kasserine, Tunisia 1943
Unhappy Trails, Bougainville 1943
First Crack at Hellzapoppin' Ridge, Bougainville 1943
The Men From Zadig, France 1944
Avril Action, France 1944
Block at Ville-Sur-Illon, France 1944
A Hotly Contested Crossroads, Germany 1945
Pursuing Kobayashi, The Philippines 1945
87097.name: Out of the Bunker #1

87098.name: Wit
87098.description:
Paraphrased from the game's instruction sheet:

A word game for two to four players, utilizing a deck of 54 cards with individual letters on them (2 of each constanant other than Z (of which there is one) and 3 of A,E,I,O and U. Players are dealt a hand of 9 cards. Game play consists of laying cards to form complete words, which are scored against a table.
A player's turn begins by drawing a card from either the draw pile or the top of the discard pile, then continues with the laying of whatever words the player can make with the cards in his or her hand, then finishes with the laying of an additional card to the discard pile. Players may also capture words made by other players by adding letters to the played word to form a new word.
A round ends when someone fully discards his hand by playing a word or words. The player does not need to be able to discard a card if playing all cards into words.


The manufacturer had a different version of this game on the market at some time, with more than twice the number of cards.

87099.name: La Maison de Pain d'Epice
87099.description:
Hansel is too greedy and wants to eat all the cookies from the roof of the witch her house. But he has to be carefull because the witch who is disguised as a pigeon will prevent him.

The board looks like a house with on top 3 places to put a card. Shuffle the deck of cards and put three cards on these locations. Then you put a pigeon figure on the roof in one of the three slots above a card. There is also a Hansel figure, place this on the table.

At his turn a player may turn over a card from the deck. If the card doesn't match the card under the pigeon nothing happens and the player may take the card. The player can turn over as many cards as he wants. If he wants to stop he can take all the cards that he has turned over. But if he turns the same card that is under the pigeon then the player has to make the sound of a pigeon and take the pigeon figure from the roof to prevent the witch from coming down. At the same time each other player may try to take the hansel figure. The first person who does this gets the first card of the open pile, and all the cards go to a discard pile. So the player who turned the cards lost all his cards (except maybe one). The witch is then put in a slot on the roof again.

A player that took Hansel by mistake has to give in a card he won in a previous round.

When the drawing deck is empty the game stops. The player with the most cards wins the game.

87100.name: Assault on the Vault
rpgseries: CORS - Living Greyhawk Core Special Adventures
87100.description:
Adventure description from the front page:

This is a special event set to run at Winter Fantasy 2003. As such it is broken into two distinct sections. The first is a section dealing with the general assault on a drow compound while the second deals with rescuing a number of prisoners held deep within the compounds dungeons.

Lower level version: An adventure for characters level 1-8.

Higher level version: An adventure for characters level 7+.

This scenarion was exclusively run on conventions.

87101.name: Dust of the Dead World
