This 7-page PDF is designed to help GMs world build and bring adventures out of the dungeon by providing five ready-to-use festivals, fairs, and holy days. It's an invaluable tool for building a textured culture, for throwing at PCs to enliven their arrival in a new community, and for weaving a unique tapestry to serve as the backdrop for urban adventure.

Learning how people celebrate allows us to better understand their values, their fears, their collective personality. While PCs may quickly forget details about a pig-raising village they passed through, it's unlikely they'd forget the community that hosts the Razorback Festival during which pigs are slaughtered and in butcher-bees and which culminates in the grand spectacle of slaves engaging in gladiatorial combat against a dire boar -- the survivors being granted freedom and existence as were-boars.

87235.name: Ghostly Rumors
87235.description:
From publisher blurb:

12 rumors involving spirits in this 13-page PDF. Each rumor includes the results of a failed Gather Information check, a successful Gather Information check, and sources for each.

This release continues Ronin Arts' new Athenaeum Arcane line and follows in the tradition of other popular Ronin Arts PDFs. Written specifically to inspire adventures, DMs will find the enclosed rumors perfect as adventure starting points or as background "chatter" to help make his game feel more alive.

87237.name: Letters
87237.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 22-page PDF features twelve letters from various periods in a generic fantasy setting. These letters can be used to spice up treasure hordes, spur player characters toward their next quest, or simply provide a measure of verisimilitude to the DM?s world. Each entry includes a physical description, the entire letter, and any relevant background information and notes. Use these letters as is, or let them goad your imagination to create new ones.

Now includes each letter as a separate handout. Give your players one of these letters and watch as they try to figure out what it means. Special thanks to Mark Gedak for creating the handouts.

87238.name: Menu Items
87238.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 10-page PDF provides the DM with 12 different tasty dishes he can make available to his players. These meals add a lot of depth to any fantasy campaign and each dish includes a description for a common inn or tavern and a fine dining establishment -- it's amazing how two different social classes can have completely different words for the same meal!

Also included are two different eating establishments. Each dish is written to be read aloud to the players and includes information on the waiter, cook, or innkeeper that is the source for the description.

87239.name: Fractal Spectrum (Issue 18 - Winter 1998)
rpgissuearticle: Interview with The BattleTech Trading Card Design Group
87239.description:
Cover art by Donald J. Redick

In this issue: Cybernetic Overkill the microgame

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

87240.name: Blood Tales: More than you can Chew
rpghonor: 2010 Indie RPG Awards - Supplement of the Year - Runner Up
rpg: Blood! The Roleplaying Game of Modern Horror (1st Edition)
Blood! The Roleplaying Game of Modern Horror (2nd Edition)
87240.description:
Publisher Blurb:
A short adventure, written for Indiecon 2009, in which the characters are stranded upon a remote Scottish island where things are not as they seem. They soon begin to fall prey to an antique evil that has survived in this remote and inhospitable place for centuries...

87241.name: More Menu Items
87241.description:
From publisher blurb:

This sequel to Ronin Arts' Athenaeum Arcana: Menu Items presents another 12 tasty dishes to offer your player characters. This 11-page PDF was specifically designed to assist the DM in adding flavor to his campaign. A player handout menu has been included -- print and distribute to your players during the game!

87242.name: Spells of the Vampire
87242.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vampires make very effective spell-casters. Their bonuses to Intelligence and Charisma make them good wizards and exceptional sorcerers, while many vampires enjoy the clerics' ability to rebuke and control other forms of undead.

Uninterrupted centuries in which to research and experiment have led to numerous dark, arcane spells unique to vampire-like. Some spells are designed to reflect a vampire's obsession with blood. Other spells improve a vampire's natural abilities, and compensate for its weaknesses.

This 9-page PDF presents 12 spells unique to the Lords of the Night.

87243.name: Treasure Chests
87243.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 7-page PDF presents 10 treasure chests that DMs can use to store treasure or as treasure. Includes magical and mundane treasure chests.

87244.name: Valuable Paintings
87244.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 7-page PDF presents 12 paintings that can be used as treasure items or to decorate the walls of an important NPC's home or office. Each painting includes a description, historical information, and value and all 12 have been designed to drop seamlessly into any D20 System fantasy campaign.

87245.name: InSaNiTy
87245.description:
Publisher's description:
Take a role-playing game, destroy all sense of setting and boundaries of reality, mix in a fair amount of foul language, shake in a smattering of puzzles and what do you get...? As off-kilter beer and pretzel game as there ever was!

Will you play the part of the noble housewife, finally at wits end? Or maybe you'll be a disgruntled defense contractor who just wants to eat from the breakfast menu? Who knows - character generation is random!

One thing's for sure - your character is going to go nuts, and they're going to take everyone with them!

87246.name: Vortext (Issue 9 - Fall 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Double Edged Sword Part Two - Rats in a Maze
In the Not Too Distant Future...
A Message from the Guidance Ro-Man
Reality and Archery in  Role-Playing Games
87246.description:
"Second Anniversary Issue"

Cover "Snow Leopard Moon" by Susan Van Camp

87247.name: Fourth Millennium
87247.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 45-page PDF introduces the "Fourth Millennium" setting to D20 Future. This PDF includes basic setting information, character information including new occupations and feats, and technology information. This PDF includes everything a GM needs to start running adventures in the Fourth Millennium.

87248.name: Juggernauts
87248.description:
Publisher's description:
The world serving as the backdrop for Juggernauts is an ultra-modern Earth, soiled with the supernatural. Most folks blame the change in the moon's attitude for all the drastic transformations in our culture. Ever since that thing started to grin down on the planet, the days have been nothing but strange?

Werewolves hold-up banks. Couples get mugged by unscrupulous vegetation. Extraterrestrials drive REAL slow in the fast lane. The boss of every minimum-wage employee is guaranteed to be involved in the global plot to forge Armageddon. Demons steal everyone's last slice of leftover pizza at the night's peak.

Everything needed to play is here, with the exception of 5 10-sided dice:


Instructions for building your own unstoppable juggernaut, kept loose to allow for complete customization of one's character. Play as anything, from a towering cybernetic hulk to an ancient master of Kung Fu!



Easy, clean and borderless skill system; no need to consult charts or choose from an arbitrary list or possibilities. Your free to put your character into whatever proficiency areas you feel like.



Tense, strategic combat. Players are rewarded for thinking about what they're doing, opposed to just hacking and slashing. Mechanically inspired by the popular card game, Poker.



Step-by-step examples, so you don't get lost along the way or find yourself spending too much time scratching your head.



A really big opportunity to turn whole bunches of intelligent beings into strawberry jam, in a stomping ground you'll not likely forget.

87249.name: The Nova Star
87249.description:
From publisher blurb:

This release in Ronin Arts' line of support products for futuristic D20 System campaigns presents the Nova Star, a light freighter suitable for use in most space opera or galaxy-hopping campaigns. Designed using SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles: Star Freighter, this PDF includes an overview of the ship, game statistics, and two new pieces of equipment for customizing starships.

Also features two tiles that can be combined with e-Future Tiles: Star Freighter in order to create the Nova Star for your next game session -- or for designing your own star freighters!

87250.name: GURPS Low-Tech Companion 1: Philosophers and Kings
87250.description:
From the publisher:

It's Good to be the King!

The learned and powerful might not labor, but they do work. Low-Tech Companion 1: Philosophers and Kings takes a look at the "technologies" they need to do their jobs at TL0-4. With it, you can:

* Take charge by choosing your political system and learning what abilities you need to stay on top.
* Wow the masses with temples, palaces, and monuments raised using the included construction rules.
* Get the gods on your side through offerings, ceremonies, and altered states of consciousness.
* Have bards sing your praises, helped by the detailed information on Musical Instrument specialties.
* Bring enlightenment by making practical use of medical, scientific, and mathematical skills.
* Spread your teachings with the expanded guidelines for tutelage, drills, and learning.
* Chronicle your exploits, assisted by the rules for scripts, shorthands, and copying books.

Whether you're a GM designing a campaign setting or the player of one of the privileged few, Low-Tech Companion 1: Philosophers and Kings puts power in your hands.

Low-Tech Companion 1: Philosophers and Kings is a supplement to GURPS Low-Tech. The information on the world of the mind would be useful in any historical setting featuring rulers, priests, or philosophers.

Low-Tech Companion 1: Philosophers and Kings is a supplement to GURPS Low-Tech. The information on the world of the mind would be useful in any historical setting featuring rulers, priests, or philosophers.

87252.name: The Foxhawk-Class
87252.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 13-page PDF presents the Foxhawk-class scout. This ultralight ship is detailed with complete game stats, an illustration, a deckplan/key, and information on the class of ship. An alternate version, a command ship, is also detailed -- for a total of two illustrations and deckplans. In addition, a starship class template is included so that other starships can be addapted to the Foxhawk-class.

This starship was designed with SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles: Star Patrol and e-Future Tiles: Star Freighter sets. In addition, one new bonus tile -- the cockpit -- has been included in this PDF.

87253.name: Monkey Party
87253.description:
From the back of the box:

Be as clever as a "monkey" and take on the challenge!

One after the other, each player takes a card. When two identical monkeys follow one another, be the fastest to touch stack of cards!
Be lively because the last player will have to collect all the played cards.
Be careful of the tricks and the tactics of your opponents...
This exiting game will create unforgettable moments in a fun-filled eviroment of laughter!
Agility and observation are the keys to winning the game. Monkey Party will really test your reflexes!

87254.name: The Black Mantis
87254.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 11-page PDF continues Ronin Arts' new starship series. The Black Mantis is a modified heavy assault fighter used by privateers. The Black Mantis has been designed using SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles: Star Hunter and e-Future Tiles: Star Patrol tile sets.

In addition to game statistics and basic information, this PDF also includes two new tiles -- the wings -- for use with SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles series.

87255.name: The Livingstone
87255.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the largest ship design yet! The first light starship designed and released by Ronin Arts, the Livingstone is presented in a 12-page PDF. The ship is so large that it's about to burst out of the cover!

Including information so that a GM can use the Livingstone as a colony ship, a hospital ship, a morgue ship, a prison transport, or a specimen transport, this massive starship is easily adapted to almost any futuristic campaign. Additionally, D20 System rules for cryonics -- including possible side-effects of being frozen in a cryonics chamber -- are also included.

Includes a top view illustration, silhouette, and two pages of deck plans -- the forward and rear sections of the ship each cover a page.

This starship can be designed for use with miniatures using SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles: Star Hunter, e-Future Tiles: Star Patrol, and e-Future Tiles: Star Freighter. NOTE: This starship PDF does not include any tiles.

87256.name: The Havamàl
87256.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 11-page PDF presents the Havamàl, a unique starship design that functions as a spy ship. The Havamal includes custom sensor systems and sensor drones -- detailed in the PDF -- and is most definitely not a combat ship.

Includes a top view illustration and front view silhouette, a deck plan, and counters for the sensor drones.

This starship can be designed for use with miniatures using SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles: Star Hunter, e-Future Tiles: Star Patrol, and e-Future Tiles: Star Freighter.

NOTE: Includes two new tiles -- the wing extensions -- that work with the existing SkeletonKey Games e-Future Tiles.

87257.name: Berge des Wahnsinns: Der Soundtrack
rpgissuearticle: Cthulhu - Berge des Wahnsinns: Kampagnenband I: Aufbruch in die Antarktis
87257.description:
From the band website (in German):

Berge des Wahnsinns: Der Soundtrack (auf CD)

Speziell zu dieser Kampagne neu komponierte Musik.

Wir schreiben das Jahr 1933. Eine unerschrockene Forschungsexpedition bricht ins ewige Eis der Antarktis auf, um ihre letzten Geheimnisse freizulegen. Doch was die Expeditionsteilnehmer finden, übersteigt die menschliche Vorstellungskraft. In den Tiefen eines gigantischen Bergmassivs liegen die Überreste einer vergessenen präkambrischen Zivilisation. So wecken die Forscher ungewollt ein Grauen auf, das besser unter ewigem Eis verborgen geblieben wäre.

Dieser klassische Horrorroman H.P. Lovecrafts und das Kult-Pen&Paper-Rollenspiel Cthulhu dienen als Grundlage für das zehnte Konzeptalbum von Erdenstern. Zusammen mit dem Schriftsteller und Cthulhu-Chefredakteur Frank Heller und dem französischen Cthulhu-Verlag Sans DéTour entstand die wohl tiefgründigste musikalische Reise Erdensterns.
Der Soundtrack begleitet die Forscher der Starkweather-Moore-Expedition von New York bis in die Tiefen der Antarktis und führt die Abenteurer durch das Grauen, das in den kalten Bergen des ewigen Eises lauert. Mit der stilistischen Erzählkraft symphonischer Filmmusik umspielt die Komposition entscheidende Situationen des Abenteuers. So werden wichtige Charaktere und Ereignisse musikalisch untermalt, Landschaften beschrieben oder der gnadenlose Überlebenskampf mit der Natur - und mit Dingen und Wesen wider die Natur - akzentreich musikalisch in Szene gesetzt.

Die Musik wurde von Andreas Petersen komponiert.

---

Translation:

Newly composed music for this campaign.

We're writing the year 1933. A bold expedition is on its way to the eternal ice of Antarctica to uncover the last secrets of this continent. But what the explorers find lies beyond human comprehension. In the depths of a gigantic mountain range are buried the last remnants of a pre-cambric civilization. And thus the scientists unknowingly awaken what should better have been left under the ice.

The classic horror novel of H.P. Lovecraft and the cult pen & paper RPG Call of Cthulhu are the basis and background for the tenth concept album of Erdenstern. Together with author and managing Cthulhu editor Frank Heller, and the French Cthulhu publisher Sans DéTour they've created their most profound musical journey so far.
The soundtrack accompanies the explorers of the Starkweather-Moore expedition from New York to the icy depths of the Antarctic and leads the ivestigators through the horrors awaiting them in those cold mountains of eternal frost. Using stylistic elements of symphonic film music their compositions portrait defining moments along the way. Important characters or events are being accentuated, landscapes described, and the merciless battle with nature's forces - or those from another world - are staged excellently.

All music composed by Andreas Petersen.

87258.name: ColorFever
87258.description:
From the Back Cover:

Colorfever is point scoring game combining a perfect blend of strategy and chance.
You draw tiles, roll the dice, and place your tile accordingly. You score by building strings of tiles horizontally, vertically and diagonally. With every turn comes the chance to draw special tiles that give you extraordinary action!

Players take turns drawing a tile of one of five colors and then placing it in one of a limited choice of columns based on a die roll. The columns are built from the bottom up, much as in Connect 4. At the end of the game, players will score for horizontal, vertical, and diagonal runs of all-different tiles and all-alike tiles. Several special tiles and board spaces create additional scoring opportunities.

87259.name: EverQuest II: Sentinal's Fate
87259.description:
User Summary

EverQuest II: Sentinal’s Fate is the sixth expansion pack for the MMO EverQuest II. Sentinal’s Fate is based in the legendary lands of Odus, a place once thought lost to the world. The expansion brings a number of new features to the title, including:

Increased Caps – The level cap was increased to 90 from 80, and alternate advancement caps were increased to 250. New alternate advancement abilities have been added to the game as well.

New Quests – The expansion includes 400 new quests for players to complete across a range of storylines. This includes 5 new Heritage Quests that will give lavish rewards – if the player can complete them.

Enhanced World – There are 2 new regions for players to explore: The Sundered Frontier and the Stone Brunt Highlands. In addition, 12 new dungeons have been added to the EverQuest world that will test even the strongest of heroes. There are also 3 new raids for players to tackle based on the new regions.

Increased Diversity – Sentinal’s Fate brings over 2000 new weapons, armor, and items to the MMO, as well as hundreds of new enemies.

The Collector’s edition includes an exclusive in-game mount and figurine, as well as a DVD documentary on the history of EverQuest.

87260.name: Gbanga Famiglia
87260.description:
User Summary

Gbanga Famiglia is a mixed-reality game for the iPhone. The premise of the game is that all players attempt to take over bars and become the best Mafia boss in the region. Gbanga Famiglia is location aware, meaning that the game tracks a player’s location in cities and translates it into an in-game location.

Players need to travel around the city to locate bars and clubs – which are linked to actual bars in cities – which they then attempt to take over for their Famiglia. Takeovers successes are dependent on a Famiglia’s power, which is determined by cash flow and the number of members.

87261.name: Night Watch
87261.description:
Night Watch (Russian: Ночной дозор) is a tactical role-playing game developed by Russian developer Nival Interactive, and based on the Russian novel and the film of the same name. It features a group of Light Others trying to combat the schemes of Day Watch.

Source: Wikipedia, "Night Watch (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87262.name: Hasbro Family Game Night 3
87262.description:
User Summary

Hasbro Family Game Night 3 is a board game compilation title for the Xbox 360, Playstation 3, and Wii. The title features five family board games: The Game of Life, Clue, Mouse Trap, Yahtzee Hands Down, and Twister. Mr. Potato Head is the game host and he guides players around the park. The game features both local and online multiplayer capabilities.

87263.name: Game Genie
87263.description:
The Game Genie is a series of cheat systems designed by Codemasters and sold by Camerica and Galoob for the Nintendo Entertainment System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Game Boy, Mega Drive/Genesis, and Sega Game Gear that modifies game data, allowing the player to cheat, manipulate various aspects of games, and sometimes view unused content and functions. It is known as the first example of consumer-friendly "game enhancement" by means of (temporarily) directly altering the binary code of a game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Game Genie", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87264.name: Titan
87264.description:
User Summary

In 2114, Professor Hybrys invented a new extreme game and announced a fabulous price of one thousand Kronurs to whomever would be able to beat the 80 levels of his new invention, Titan. He conveniently forgot to mention that all the playtesters died during the game. A lot of adventurers have since tried to win, none if them have come back. Do you have enough skill to succeed where so many others have failed?

Titan is an arcade-puzzle mix. The player guides a ball across the levels and must either destroy every brick of the level, or push the ball through the exit tile if there is one. Hazards are numerous, including tiles deadly to the ball but not to the player (and vice versa), disappearing walls, teleport traps, walls that allow only the ball to pass through... The player can put the ball in a loop, or catch it and release it later, giving time to study the level and look for a solution. The player can also hold the space bar down to slow down the pace of the game.

Version notes:
The Amstrad CPC cassette edition has only 16 levels.

87265.name: Disney Channel All Star Party
87265.description:
User Summary

Disney Channel All Star Party is a party game for the Nintendo Wii. The game is a Mario Party-style game that is based on the Disney channel shows and characters. Players can choose from one of 6 Disney Channel stars in the games. Additionally, this is the first Disney game that permits using Miis as playable characters. All Star Party includes 30 minigames based on the franchise shows.

Character List:

- Joe, Kevin, and Nick Jonas (Jonas L.A.)
- Sonny Munroe (Sonny with a Chance)
- Alex Russo (Wizards of Waverly Place)
- Miley Stewart (Hannah Montana)
- Zack and Cody Martin (The Suite Life of Zack & Cody)
- Mitchie Torres (Camp Rock)

87266.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 4 - September/October 1994)
rpgissuearticle: Ludo - et spil for rigtige helte
87266.description: Front cover by Kristian West, Jan Kjær and Michael G. Schmidt.

87267.name: Rollespilsmagasinet Fønix (Issue 5 - November/December 1994)
rpgissuearticle: En købmands betragtninger om en svunden tid
FBI - En myte overgår sig selv
87267.description: Front cover by Vibeke K. Jensen.

87268.name: Fire and Forget
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87268.description:
User Summary

In the near future, Earth is ablaze as conflicts rage across all of the globe. Only you and your trusty Thunder Master race car have the power to stop all of it and restore global peace.

Fire and Forget is a racing game with guns. There are 18 conflict zones, split in three categories according to their intensity. Each of these zones is represented by a long stretch of road the player must travel, while battling helicopters, tanks and roadside bunkers, dodging rocks and picking up fuel. The player has infinite lives but each death costs fuel, and the game ends when the car's fuel tanks are empty.

87269.name: Shufflepuck Café
videogamepublisher: Pony Canyon, Inc. (株式会社ポニーキャニオン / Kabushiki kaisha Ponī Kyanion)
87269.description:
Shufflepuck Café is a computer air hockey game developed by Christopher Gross, Gene Portwood and Lauren Elliott for Brøderbund (not a table shuffleboard computer game, as the name would suggest- though that was the intention when the name was first coined by Christopher Gross). Originally developed for the Apple Macintosh, it was later adapted by Ubisoft for the Amiga, Atari ST, Apple IIGS (leaked version), Amstrad CPC, Family Computer (in Japan) and DOS operating systems.

Source: Wikipedia, "Shufflepuck Café", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87270.name: Broken Gears
87270.description:
Publisher's description:
This is a world of animism, where all but the most basic technology is powered by bound spirits, conjured and caged by ritual and science. But in 1945 the Allies built a new device, a thinking machine: Colossus. The result was a war that killed half of all humanity, ruined most of the world?s cities, and turned even the weather hostile. But Humanity won. Britain, China and a few other nations endured the apocalypse, while others rebuilt from the rubble.

Now, more than a hundred years later, electricity, mass-production and other such advanced technology is anathema - steam and cogs drive the great warships of the New British Empire, the soldiers of the United Republic of Asia take the field armed with sword and musket alongside vast uranium-driven land leviathan tanks, semaphore towers and horse-riders relay messages from town to town across the expanded territories of the United States, while gigantic Difference Engines calculate and compute in vast complexes below ground.

This is a world of Broken Gears.

Broken Gears is a complete game made available free for download. It includes both a novel setting of animistic steampunk, and an easily accessible system designed specifically for the game.

87271.name: Skin City Romance
87271.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission

Game Chef Blurb:
It’s a role playing game of noir-inspired journeys ( or will be when it’s complete anyway). You’re desperate people submerged in a city synonymous with corruption. You play to find out how that works out for you.

87272.name: Pancakes
87272.description:
(From the back of the box):

Pancakes is a simple and easy game to play. Build stacks of pancakes, add butter to increase the value of the stack, then top it off with syrup before someone else to score the stack!

The game takes minutes to learn and is simple enough to be enjoyed by the whole family!

87273.name: Fire & Forget II
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87273.description:
User Summary

The third International Peace Conference is scheduled to take place in Mégapolis, but a terrorist group has planned to destroy the whole town. There are five heavily armed terrorist convoys headed for Mégapolis, and only you and your trusted Thunder Master mk II can stop them.

This sequel to Fire and Forget features five levels, in which players must race along the road, catch up with the convoy and reach and destroy the head vehicle. There are fuel and equipment power-ups to pick up, lots of different enemies to shoot, and the car can take off and fly once it has reached top speed.

87274.name: Sojourn: The City and The Desert
rpg: Sojourn: The City and The Desert
87274.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission

Author Blurb:
In Sojourn: The City and The Desert, players will tell the tale of a region of natural splendor which is under invasion by a City, the only City to exist. This City, Sojourn, sweeps through the region, literally moving across the earth in some way, whether it is pulled by titanic worms made of brass and gears, or whether it rolls upon wheels which leave deep trenches in the dirt. As it moves, it consumes everything, eating all in its path and everything around it, digesting the food into resources. It leaves in its wake an entirely lifeless desert, a wasteland horrible and terrifying to a people who know only a world with so much life. The fate of the entire region falls upon the shoulders of a select group of individuals who have been called to Sojourn because it offers them the ability to fulfill their darkest desires. If they should choose to serve the city, to help in its quest to consume the land and everything, everyone, on it, then they may be rewarded. But if they want to save their homes, their friends, their family, then these individuals will have to shun the help of Sojourn and stand against it, forever giving up their darkest desires.

87275.name: Under the Sun
87275.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission

Author Blurb:
The People have been given a warning by the good ancestor spirits of an impending disaster that will wipe the People from the face of the earth. The only way to save themselves, the spirits have foretold, is to journey into the heart of the Deep Desert, where even the People fear to tread, in search of the Promised Land. Until now, even the wisest of the tribes believed the Promised Land to be a place of myth and legend. And so your tribe has gathered up their possessions and prepared as best they could for a journey into the Deep Desert and the unknown.

What is the impending disaster? What will they find in the Deep Desert? Does the Promised Land exist? And will the other tribes be saved as well, or will they be the only remnants of the People who will survive to find this Promised Land? These are all questions you will answer during play.

87276.name: Pilgrim
87276.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission

Author Blurb:
In a distant future earth, people undertake a pilgrimage through the vast global desert towards the city of Prees. Their goal is to be reskinned - to have their bodies and minds renewed, rejuvenated. The journey is a difficult one that lays one's soul bare. But to be reskinned, one's soul must be as barren and featureless as the global desert.

Will your soul be ready for reskinning?

87277.name: Deserting Paradise
87277.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission

Game Chef Blurb:
All you wanted was to live forever. So you and your street punk friends stole immortality from The Man. Now he wants vengeance. The City has come alive to try to swallow you whole. Deal with your unfinished business, put this voodoo stuff behind you, and get the fuck out of dodge.

87278.name: The Book of Sands: A Story of Our People
rpg: The Book of Sands: A Story of Our People
87278.description:
User Summary: Game Chef 2010 Design Competition Submission

Author Blurb:
The Book of Sands: A Story of Our People (hereafter, The Book) is a role-playing and storytelling game for four people about the mythical history of a fantasy culture. It is intended to be played in three four to six hour sessions. In the game the players tell the story of four heroes who are the potential progenitors of titular People. The story goes through a number of fixed steps, and at various points a hero will drop out of the story, leaving only one hero standing at the end.

This story begins in the desert with the Tribe of Not-People. This tribe is composed of beings like humans, but in place of skin, they have the feather, fur or scales of animals. The heroes begin as part of this tribe, but at some point they loose their outer coverings to reveal the human skin beneath, at which point the tribe deserts them.

The heroes then find themselves wandering in the desert, where they face the tribulations of the journey. When it seems as if the can go no further, a voice is heard from the heavens, the voice of the God of the People, who urges the heroes onward to the site of the first city, the city that they are destined to build, but the path to the city is fraught with easier temptations that the heroes must struggle to resist.

Finally, the heroes make it to the site of the future city where they find themselves competing for allies and resources, with one hero arising as patriarch of the First People.

87280.name: Danse Macabre
87280.description:
2-player game based on famous painting fragment by Bernt Notke situated in Niguliste Museum, Tallinn, Estonia.

One player takes the role of god, other player takes the role of Devil. Then players compete to earn more dancers' souls.
They bet for every soul and peek bets of opponent or secret dancers' cards.
The player who owns the more souls in the end of the game is the winner.

Components:

Gameboard
6 Secret dancers
God's carddeck
Devil's carddeck
Coin

87281.name: Barclay City Life Game
87281.description:
The board displays the map of a city.

Players roll and move along the paths of the city. Their object is to collect 8 different catergory cards.When a player has collected his/her 8 cards, that player has to go home.
During the game players can use 'Task' cards. These cards can be used to block the way for other players

The first player that arrives at home wins the game.

87282.name: OZ: Dark & Terrible Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook
87282.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Welcome to Oz! An Oz where Witches with extraordinary magical abilities vie for power against a steamtech based Emerald City, lead by the Wizard himself. But who has the right to rule all of Oz? Does might make right?

All of the familiar characters from the Land Oz are in Oz: Dark & Terrible, with one exception. The Scarecrow is an Anidum; a creature containing a person's soul that has been transplanted into a mannequin, while the witch responsible walks around in the Husk with all its memories. The Tin Woodsman is a retired member of the Wizard's "secret service", the Tin Men, who ensure the citizens of the Emerald City remain loyal to their ruler and are willing to use whatever means necessary to achieve their goals. The Cowardly Lion is a disgraced exile from his rightful kingdom after his father betrayed the other Animals in a catastrophic battle against Blinkie, the former Wicked Witch of the South, who refuses to be like other Carnivores who eat the hearts of Humans to gain lycanthropic powers.

The exception is Dorothy. She never went to Oz...yet. You play the role of an Outsider. Or, you can play a native of Oz, be he a mutated Munchkin, tribal Quadling, or even an Automaton, a sentient clockwork machine, among dozens of other possibilities.

Oz: Dark & Terrible is based on the Land of Oz created by L. Frank Baum. But we have taken Oz in a direction never before seen.

rpgitemversion: Return to the Ghost Tower of Inverness (CL10-16)
Return to the Ghost Tower of Inverness (CL2-8)
87283.name: Return to the Ghost Tower of Inverness
rpgseries: CORS - Living Greyhawk Core Special Adventures
87283.description:
From the Front Page:

A One-Round Dungeons & Dragons Living Greyhawk Core Special Event

Legends have ever clustered thickly around the ghostly keep of Inverness. Many have entered the ruins in search of riches and eternal fame. Some few have managed to win free from the terrors lurking within but all have failed to retrieve the Soul Gem - a glowing white bauble as thick as a man's head! Dare you brave the dangers of Inverness in search of its legendary tresaure?

87284.name: Sea of  Dust
rpgseries: CORS - Living Greyhawk Core Special Adventures
87284.description:
Adventure Description from the Front Page:

'Time is the fire in which we burn' - Those words echo in your head as your stare across the endless sea of dust before you. The mighty Suel empire, once admired and feared by all, once stood here. Now the fire that burns has washed it clean and time has buried and forgotten it. Sometimes things best left forgotten do not remain so and things thought long dead and swept away in the fires of time return. The shifting winds and dust has revealed a ruined city deep in the Sea of Dust. Time to grab the shovels and see what lurks beneath the dust. A Core Special scenario for APLs 2-16.

This scenario will only be available for play at Winter Fantasy 2004 and select over-seas conventions.

87285.name: Here There Be Dragons
rpgseries: CORS - Living Greyhawk Core Special Adventures
87285.description:
Adventure Description from the Front Page:

A timeless dragon-lore prophecy speaks of an empire of serpents and their worshippers who will threaten even the greatest nations of Oerth. In the frozen world of the obsidian North, the desperate, the ambitious, and the foolhardy eke out a meager existence, all pursuing their own mysterious goals. What impact can a few adventurers have on a cruel and barren land and the wyrms that dwell there?

A two-round core special scenario for APLs 2-18

87286.name: Mad God's Key
rpgseries: CORS - Living Greyhawk Core Special Adventures
87286.description:
Adventure Description from the Front Page:

A Special D&D Living Greyhawk Core Adventure Adaption.

The adventure is printed in Dungeon issue September 2004 pages 18 - 39.


User Summary:

This item consists of the materials required in order to run the adventure Mad God's Key as an official Living Greyhawk event. It requires the use of Dungeon (Issue 114 - Sep 2004) in order to have the base adventure as well.

87287.name: Hjärtefrost
87287.description:
From the back of the book:

Det är nådens år 1712 och det har gått tre år sedan den svenska härens nederlag mot ryssen i Poltava. I Europa dominerar Frankrike och i öster börjar Ryssland bli en stormakt att räkna med.

Samtidigt blåser det kalla vindar i Sverige, en krigstrött nation har till synes sett toppen på sin storhetstid och fiender som Danmark ser sin möjlighet att kräva tribut. Många i den svenska överklassen försöker att glömma den bistra verkligheten. Dekadenta fester, hor, intriger och ond bråd död har blivit en del av vardagen.

En kall vinternatt, på en överdådig fest i den svenska huvudstaden, går allt slutligen överstyr. Ett svartsjukegräl får ödesdigra konsekvenser för en firad hjälte. Men är allt verkligen som det verkar?

Rough translation:

It is the year of our Lord 1712 and it has been three years since the Russians defeated the Swedish army at Poltava. Europe is dominated by France and in the east Russia is beginning to develop into a super power.

Meanwhile cold winds blow in Sweden, a war weary nation has seen the height of its power and enemies like Denmark now sees an opportunity to claim tribute. Many of Swedish nobility try to ignore reality. Decadent feasts, adultery, plotting and death is now part of daily life.

A cold winter night, at a party in the Swedish capital, everything falls apart. A marital fight leads to dark consequences for a Swedish hero. But is everything really as it seems?

87288.name: Cinco
87288.description: In the game of CINCO, each player tries to lay down five of his own playing pieces in a row in a straight continuous line on the gameboard. The board shows 90 fields numbered 1-90. The fields where a player may place one of his pieces is limited through cards (like in 5iveStraight). There are 90 cards numbered 1-90. Each player starts with four cards. When in his turn he plays a card the number shown determines the field where he may playe a piece. The number on the field must be teh same or higher than the number played.

87289.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Pass the Popcorn's movie fun is now a fast-paced matching card game! You love movies but how well do you remember details about the cast, characters and plot? Do you know which movie plots feature time travel or crooked cops? The game is started by dealing a hand of themed Popcorn Cards to each players. The challenge is to match Popcorn Cards with the famous films on the Movie Cards. Only the first two matches count. The first person to play all of their Popcorn Cards wins.
87289.name: Pass the  Popcorn Card Game

87290.name: Multiverser: the First Book of Worlds
87290.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This is the book that debuted with seven worlds, nine playable scenarios, and untold adventures. The alien landscape of NagaWorld is the traditional and recommended starting point for play, as it leaves no question that the characters have entered another universe. Tristan's Labyrinth proved even dungeon crawls could be new and different. The Dancing Princess adapted a fairy tale to a game adventure. Brave the deep and face pirates on one of the merchant vessels of The Mary Piper Twin Scenarios - whether it is the deep blue sea, or deep space. Sherwood Forest gave more than just Robin Hood; it gave a thorough background of the age in which he appeared, with the politics and attitudes of another world that once was this one. Richard Connell is immortalized in his own short story, The Most Dangerous Game, showing once again that anything can be the basis of a Multiverser game world. Finally, The Zygote Experience goes where no role playing game has ventured before, letting the player character become an unborn child and grow up all over again.

87291.description:
Publihser Blurb:

This is the travel version of the blockbuster game: Pass the Popcorn. It can also be used as a booster set for your full-sized Pass the Popcorn board game. We also sell the full version game as well as the alternative card game. Pass the Popcorn is movie guessing mayhem! This travel version/booster pack features 100 freshly popped award-winners, fan favorites and recent box-office smashes. It's easy to figure out the movie based on the clues, but can you shout out the title, before anyone else does? the tiles tell you which clues you should use. race to complete your set of tiles before your opponents complete theirs. This travel game/booster set comes in a convenient travel size box (4"x6"), and includes 50 movie cards and 16 game tiles
87291.name: Pass the  Popcorn Travel Game and Booster Pack

87292.name: Multiverser: the Second Book of Worlds
87292.description:
Publisher Blurb:

If anything, Bah Ke'gehn is yet more alien than NagaWorld, with genuinely alien intelligent creatures who in the tradition of the best fantasy teach us about ourselves. Even if you've never seen nor read The Prisoner of Zenda, you'll recognize this tale of the man who has to stand in for the king and rescue him from his evil brother, and enjoy giving a player this role. The Farmland is a quiet, rural, pre-industrial world; but depending on which version you play, there is danger here. When The New Ice Age was a free playtest version here on the site, it got positive reviews; this frozen wasteland survival scenario has been expanded for inclusion here. Post-sympathetic Man gives a bleak alternate present in which survival of the fittest is taken to mean that the weak should die. A different kind of post-apocalyptic world, one in which civilization fell quietly by laziness, is portrayed in The Industrial Complex. Finally, M. Joseph Young's time travel story The Perpetual Barbecue becomes the basis for a Groundhog Day-like setting in which one day keeps repeating, but in two different versions, and the player has to unravel what has happened.

87293.name: Multiverser: Referee's Rules
87293.description:
Publisher Blurb:

From the creative genius of E. R. Jones and the mechanical brilliance of M. Joseph Young, Multiverser® has impressed gamers across the country. We promise both that we will make available useful supplementary material and that the Referee's Rules are the only rules you will ever need. The five hundred-plus page book contains not only every rule needed to run the game, to construct characters, to create new worlds, and to interface with other game systems, but also extensive appendices on everything from dice curves to temporal anomalies.

87294.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This special edition features the films that send chills up your spine! It includes both movie classics and new hits, from Alien to Cloverfield, from Frankenstein to Halloween, and from Psycho to Zombieland.
87294.name: Pass the  Popcorn! Thrills and Chills Edition

87295.name: Revelation
87295.description:
Subtitle: The Modern Superheroic Horror Role-Playing Game

Publisher's description:

Tired of playing horror games where the bad guy is some demented drama queen who's just misunderstood? Want to dust a few vampires, flambe a few werewolves, or just kick demon butt? Then this is the game for you!

Enter a world where vampires, werewolves, demons and goblins stalk the earth, preying on humanity and turning the tide ever closer to Judgement Day.

In this world of dark horror, you the player will take on the role of brave Monster Hunters, half breed Dhampyrs, Nephilim, or any of countless other heroes working for The Order in an effort to stem the tide and save humanity from the forces of darkness.

Ready your stake and holy water, and prepare for the world of Revelation. Don't run towards the screams of horror, and may God have mercy on your soul!

87296.name: Santa's Soldiers (Second Edition)
87296.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Saving Christmas... By Any Means Necessary. Join the OSN and save Christmas from the depredations of Santa's deadliest enemies! In this hilarious roleplaying game, you take on the part of an elf operative in the Order of St. Nicholas, Santa's paramilitary defense force! Take on bizarre villains like the Winter Wizard, the Boogieman and Anti-Claus! This is a not-to-be-missed upgrade to the old game that will have your players in stitches!

87297.name: StarCluster 2
87297.description:
User Summary:

Starcluster is a percentile science fiction RPG that drives many of Flying Mice Games RPGs, even non-SF games. Includes character generation options, sample star system, sample starships, sample vehicles, all 117 Cluster star systems in stat block form, societies and cultures, and much more.


Publisher Blurb:

Revised and greatly expanded, with new character generation options, sample star system, sample starships, sample vehicles, all 117 Cluster star systems in stat block form, societies and cultures, and much more!

87298.name: Disgaea 4: A Promise Unforgotten
87298.description:
Joystiq Press Release:

Like previous entries in the series, Disgaea 4 is a hardcore SRPG with a comedic twist. NIS is promising "stupidity to the MAX" in this upcoming endeavor. Taking place in hell, the story will have a political theme, with players building their own political cabinets. "I'd love to have questionable politicians play this game," he joked.

New features for Disgaea 4 are the addition of network features which will allow you to invade other player's worlds, and vice versa. However, the primary new feature is the revamped focused on graphics. While the game will still retain its trademark 2D look, the resolution of the sprite art has been bumped significantly, and will look more like illustrator Takehito Harada's original drawings. "Wow, that must have cost a lot," the NIS host joked during the presentation.

Microbadges available

87299.name: Marvel vs Capcom 3:  Fate of Two Worlds
videogamehonor: 2010 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2011 Spike Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
87299.description:
From the Publisher Website:

After a decade of waiting, the biggest names from the Marvel Universe will clash head on with the combined might of Capcom's best known and most feared roster of gaming characters. Powered by the mighty MT Framework engine, MARVEL VS. CAPCOM 3 will deliver the best ever match up of legendary fighters and no holds barred fighting action. Get set for the ultimate faceoff when MARVEL® vs. CAPCOM® 3: Fate of Two Worlds hits the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 in Spring 2011.

87300.name: inFAMOUS 2
videogamehonor: 2010 Game Critics Best Console Game of the Year Nominee
2011 Spike Best PlayStation Game of the Year Nominee
2012 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
87300.description:
Infamous 2 is a 2011 open world video game for the PlayStation 3 video game console developed by Sucker Punch Productions and published by Sony Computer Entertainment. The game is the sequel to the 2009 video game Infamous and will feature support for the PlayStation Move motion controller.

The game follows the events of Infamous with Cole McGrath as the main protagonist again. The game will take place in a new city called New Marais, a New Orleans-inspired city, and will involve Cole opposing the Beast. The game begins with Cole fighting the Beast and barely escaping with his life. He, along with his friend Zeke, flees to New Marais and prepares for Cole's inevitable encounter with the Beast while combating The Militia, a shadowy group led by a man named Bertrand. The Militia has taken over New Marais in an attempt to keep all superpowered or abnormal things away. Cole will combat the Militia, explore New Marais, and learn about himself, Kessler, and The First Sons along the way while gaining new abilities to confront the Beast.

Source: Wikipedia, Infamous 2, available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87303.name: Vortext (Issue 8 - Spring 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Arduin: The Return of the Legend
In the Not Too Distant Future...
A Message from the Guidance Ro-Man
Stellar Babe Gets Some... Table Manners
What a Wonderful Morgue You Have Here
Wizardry 7: A Breath of Fresh Air

87304.name: Beneath the Despairing Stone (C&C)
87304.description:
Publisher Blurb:

In that time before the All-father warded the world of Airhde, many creatures were already roaming his dreaming creation. These were the Val-Eahrakun. Of that order were the Oonmaukling, elemental lords of staggering power. Unklar, the Horned God, bound one of these oonmaukling to him and set it in a dungeon beneath the stones of despair; there it dwelt in a great temple, upon the edge of the dark lord's vision. Guardians he set there and they watched ever after, waiting in the timelessness of that place.

But that was long ago. Unklar himself now lays in the Void and the dungeon, like so many of his creations, lies in ruins. The desolation of the temple leaves little to chance and its malignant inhabitants have their own desires and goals, often at odds with their one time master.

Beneath the Despairing Stone Plays as a stand alone adventure or as part of the ongoing Road to Aufstrag series. The characters are brought back to the Black Tooth Ridge along its northern terminus in an area many fear to tread or even explore. They will travel far beyond the Black Tooth Ridge both in form and spirit for it is here, beneath the Despairing Stone, where devils and magic dwell whose origin reaches beyond the time of man and dwarf to that of the beginning of creation.

From the makers of the Castles & Crusades roleplaying game comes the seventh adventure in the Road to Aufstrag Series; designed for champions and heroes who must brave a demon's wrath to destroy an artifact of great power.

87305.name: Shuttle Orbiter
87305.description:
User summary:

In Shuttle Orbiter you are in control of Challenger space shuttle. Your goal is to complete the construction of the space station around Earth by delivering and installing the last ten sections of the station. You must complete your goal within a specific time limit. You also have to avoid running out of fuel, and hitting space debris that can damage the shuttle and cause unnecessary loss of fuel.

87306.name: EA Sports Active 2
87306.description:
User Summary

EA Sports Active 2.0 is EA’s 2010 addition to their fitness franchise. The game acts as a fitness program for the player and makes use of arm and leg motion sensors and a heart rate monitor. Active 2.0 offers a range of over 70 exercises to choose from, and a trainer-designed 9 week program applies progressive conditioning to help users get the most out of their workouts.

The game includes a personal goal tracking system that will inform you how you are progressing and if you have met your goals, and the included heart monitor tracks on-screen to let you know how much exertion you are putting your body through. There are a number of online features associated with Active 2.0 as well, including means to post achievements and train with other like-minded individuals.

The motion capture system included for the Wii will track every motion and translate it to the on-screen avatar. The PS3 and Xbox 360 editions make use of the Playstation Move and Kinect, respectively.

87307.name: International Cricket 2010
videogamehonor: 2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
87307.description:
User Summary

International Cricket 2010 is a cricket title for the Xbox 360 and PS3. The title has licensing from the England and Wales Cricket Board, which allows it to have official players and stadiums for a realistic cricket experience. The game is commentated by Jonathan Agnew and Shane Warne.

IC 2010 is a sequel to Ashes Cricket 2009, and it includes a number of improvements, including:

Power Stick Innovation – The Power Stick allows a greater range of control over the style and direction of hits, permitting 360 degree power and direction controls.

Additional Game Modes – There are a number of new play modes such as Instant Tournaments and the inclusion of four new Overs tournaments.

Expanded Roster – 2010 has a roster of 16 teams including Canada, Bermuda, Scotland, and the Netherlands, and 3 new stadiums.

87308.name: Double Trouble
87308.description:
From the back of the box:

You're in Trouble!...No! You're in DOUBLE TROUBLE! In fact, you've got a whole handful of DOUBLE TROUBLE!--"Bad News!" cards, "Double Trouble" cards, and a bunch of other penalty cards - All against you!

Quick! Dump your Trouble cards - On The Double! - By playing two at a time. Then dump even more by PASSING them to your opponents. Be first to go out (and WIN!), sticking your opponents with DOUBLE TROUBLE if you can.

Player Summary:

Playing cards by number and color (similar to Uno), the player to get rid of all of their cards first wins the round. An extra effort must be made to hand off certain 'Trouble' cards to other players that will count against their score if they're not able to get rid of them. After a number of rounds, the first player to reach a pre-determined score wins the game.

The game comes with a special deck of 108 cards:
- 9 WILD cards
- Three suits of cards (red, green, yellow) each containing:
* 18 color cards
* two BAD NEWS cards
* two DOUBLE TROUBLE cards
* two PASS BASH! cards
* three PASS cards
* three PASS RIGHT cards
* three PASS LEFT cards

87310.name: ALEA Grundregler
87310.description:
Basic rules for ALEA. Contains basic hints, rules for character creation, rules for fighting and sample bestiary.

This is not intended to be a complete rule set. In order to play a module describing the setting/world is also required.

87311.name: Just Dance 2
87311.description:
User Summary

Just Dance 2 is a rhythm game for the Wii. It is a sequel to Just Dance, and brings a number of new features to the series. There are several new game modes in addition to the modes present in Just Dance. Dancing Duet allows two players to team up to aim for the highest score, while Sweat Mode is exercise-themed and tracks calories burned. Dance Crew Face-Off permits up to 8 players to compete in team matches.

Just Dance 2 has a base setlist of 45 songs, and the option is available to download additional songs from the online store. The complete setlist includes:

• Avril Lavigne – "Girlfriend"
• Baby Girl – “Reggaeton”
• Bangles – "Walk Like An Egyptian"
• Beastie Boys – "Body Movin’ (Fatboy Slim Remix)"
• Benny Benassi presents “The Biz” – "Satisfaction"
• Blondie – "Call Me"
• Boney M. – "Rasputin"
• Cher – "The Shoop Shoop Song (It’s In His Kiss)"
• Dagomba – “Sorcerer”
• Digitalism – "Idealistic"
• Donna Summer – "Hot Stuff"
• Elvis Presley – "Viva Las Vegas"
• Fatboy Slim – "Rockafeller Skank"
• Franz Ferdinand – "Take Me Out"
• Harry Belafonte – "Jump In The Line"
• Ike & Tina Turner – "Proud Mary"
• James Brown – "I Got You (I Feel Good)"
• Jamiroquai – "Cosmic Girl"
• Junior Senior – "Move Your Feet"
• Justice – "D.A.N.C.E."
• Katti Kalandal – “Bollywood "
• Katy Perry - "Firework"*
• Ke$ha – "TiK ToK"
• Mardi Gras – "Iko Iko"
• Marine Band – "Sway (Quien Sera)"
• MIKA – "Big Girl (You Are Beautiful)"
• Mugsy Baloney – “Charleston”
• Outkast – "Hey Ya!"
• Quincy Jones & His Orchestra – "Soul Bossa Nova"
• Rihanna – "S.O.S."
• Snap! – "The Power"
• Studio Allstars – "Jump"
• Studio Musicians – "Crazy In Love"
• Studio Musicians – "Jungle Boogie"
• Supergrass – "Alright"
• The Frighteners – "Monster Mash"
• The Hit Crew – "Holiday"
• The Hit Crew – "Toxic"
• The Jackson 5 – "I Want You Back"
• The Pussycat Dolls – "When I Grow Up"
• The Rolling Stones – "Sympathy For The Devil (Fatboy Slim Remix)"
• The Ting Tings – "That’s Not My Name"
• The Weather Girls – "It’s Raining Men"
• Vampire Weekend – "A-Punk"
• Wham! – "Wake Me Up Before You Go Go"

87312.name: I guds namn
87312.description:
User summary
Module describing how to play ALEA in a medieval setting.

Contents:

Historical background for the period 1096-1148, from the first crusade to the second.
Culture and customs in the holy land.
Description of major cities in the area.
Campaigning ideas
Hints
New professions suitable for the era.
Rules for battles.

87313.name: LOGOS
87313.description:
User Summary

LOGOS is a collectible card game based in the Second Life universe. The LOGOS is an organization that uses a neurographic interface to animate competing manifestations in order to find truth. Players each take a deck of LOGOS cards and use them in an attempt to reduce their opponent’s hit points to 0.

Each player begins with 100,000 hit points, and the cards are broken into three categories – Matter, Energy, and Information. The cards follow a basic rock-paper-scissors mechanism, with the dominant card type attacking the weaker one. Each card has an Attack and Defense stat, and the difference in combat values determines the damage done to the defender.

LOGOS is a premium service in Second Life, and cards can be purchased both in-game or from the Second Life web marketplace.

87314.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 13 - Feb/Mar 1979)
rpgissuearticle: Contest Winning Dungeon Levels: 6th level - 3rd place
Missing 4th Level Map of Henry Veldenz (from last ish)
The Misadventures of the Erroneous Grog
The Misadventures of the Erroneous Grog
87314.description:
Judges Guild Journal
Issue #13
February/March 1979

Cover art by Aaron Arocho.

87315.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 15 - Jun/Jul 1979)
rpgissuearticle: Let's Go Eat at the Red Apple, or inn-naming for the unimaginative
Omniscient Opinions: Intership Combat - A Game Error?
Short Biographies of Judges Guild Staff
Shrewd Slants from the Sagacious Sage: Djinni and Efreeti
Systematic Magic II: Revised Magic Tables
The Rage, or how to be damned
87315.description:
Judges Guild Journal
Issue #15
June/July 1979

Cover art by Buz

87316.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 16 - Aug/Sep 1979)
rpgissuearticle: Survival of Fittest Explanations and Map
The Escaping of Monsters and Traps
87316.description:
Form the Table of Contents:

Features:
Ancients Column by David Petrowsky
Survival of Fittest Explanations and Map by Michael Mayeau
G Modules by Richard Forster
Encounters in D&D by Ronald Pehr
Writing Good Computer Games by Rev. George Blank
Daymark by Dean Kunisisky
Generals of the City State by Bill Paley
Whitestone Castle by Eric Hill
Black Lotus by Bill Paley
The Escaping of Monsters and Traps by Bill Paley
Thieves: Two Views by Bill Paley

Dungeon Contest Winners Announced!
Tips from the Tower by Chuck Anshell
Prodigious Platemail
Under Toe
New Contest Announcement
Our Magical Staff: Kevin Siembieda

87317.name: More Champions for the Celestial Paragons
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87317.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for the Book of Exalted Deeds

The Book of Vile Darkness presented the tools and legions of evil, and now the Book of Exalted Deeds does the same for the celestial host. Within its pages are exalted feats, spells, and magic items, as well as the celestial paragons-the good counterparts of the Dukes of Hell and the Demon Princes. Though most of the celestial paragons do not personally sponsor cadres of followers, individual champions nonetheless dedicate themselves to furthering the agendas of these creatures. The Book of Exalted Deeds offers one champion for each celestial paragon detailed in its pages. This article presents three more-one for a lawful good paragon of Celestia,
one for the queen of the chaotic good Court of Stars, and one for a member of the neutral good Companions.

87318.name: Polyhedron (Introductory Issue)
rpgissuearticle: The Living City's Quill and Scribe Shop
87318.description:
Introductory Issue

SPECIAL MODULE FEATURE
Ghost Righters

FEATURES
Getting Together
Heroes and Villains
The New Rogues Gallery
The Living City's Quill and Scribe Shop
Ravens Bluff Rumours

EDITORIAL
Notes from HQ

DEPARTMENTS
With Great Power


Additional User Summary:

The "Introductory Issue" was printed in 1989 and sent to all new RPGA members for a few years after that, and was first offered for sale to existing members in Polyhedron #49 (Sept. 1989). It wasn't the actual first issue (which dates to 1981); it just contained useful information for new members.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87319.name: Yet More Archfiends
87319.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Book of Vile Darkness Web Enhancement

The Book of Vile Darkness details all aspects of evil as they might apply to your campaign. This includes, but is not limited to, the statistics and descriptions of those most evil beings, the archfiends-the Lords of Hell and Demon Princes. They each come with their own details plus descriptions of their followers and cultists. Yes, although the archfiends are not true deities, cults of mortals revere them all the same. (The Book of Vile Darkness describes how this works and suggests relevant variant rules.)

Presented here for you are three more archfiends that didn’t make it into the book: a deposed archdevil and two demon princes-well, one demon prince and one princess.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87320.name: Staying Out of the Dark
87320.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for the Book of Challenges

When getting ready to face the encounters in the Book of Challenges, or any other venture underground, your chances for success (and survival) will improve if you’re prepared to assess the Dungeon Environment properly. All too often, players concentrate on their characters’ combat abilities and neglect equipment that serves other purposes.

This web enhancement suggests some magic and equipment that player characters (PCs) might overlook before entering a challenging dungeon. This bonus material is exclusive to the official DUNGEONS & DRAGONS® website.

87321.name: Stryfe
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87321.description:
User Summary

The evil Morvelinh has decided to enslave the gnomes of the kingdom of Féerie. Two young gnomes, Wlamir the wizard and Olaf the warrior escape captivity and decide to fight back, free Féerie and destroy Morvelinh.

Stryfe is a top-down action game for one or two players in coop mode. The goal of each level (called chapter) is to find the Silver key, which allows to pick up the Golden key, which itself is used to open the Gates of Invisibility and go to the next chapter. The game is heavily inspired by Gauntlet: both characters have different strength and weaknesses, players can pick up bottles of potion which can be used to destroy monster generators, chests to gain points and food to gain hit points.

The game was developed by Emmanuel Zerbib, with graphics by Orou Mama.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast - Free Adventure Downloads
Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87322.name: Vanrakdoom
87322.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Short Adventure for Four 17th-Level Player Characters Featuring Material from Champions of Ruin

Champions of Ruin addresses the evil campaign, both as a general concept and as it applies to games set in the Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting. The book also offers invaluable tips for running evil PCs as well as overcoming evil NPCs.

Vanrakdoom is a short D&D adventure for four 17th-level player characters (PCs) that utilizes the new material in Champions of Ruin. It takes place in Wterdeep, also known as the City of Splendors, which lies on the continent of Faerûn in the Forgotten Relams Campaign Setting. Famed for the legendary dungeon called Undermountain that lies beneath its streets, Waterdeep draws adventurers from all over Faerûn. Dug by the shield dwarves of Clan Melairkyn and their successors, Undermountain consists of nine major levels and fourteen sublevels. Halaster, the Mad Mage (detailed on page 180 of the Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting and updated on page 294 of the Epic Level Handbook), rules this sprawling complex. However, many powerful creatures have carved out personal demesnes within the sprawling caverns and chambers of Halaster’s Halls, and the Mad Mage of Undermountain has largely ignored their presence.

A confused tangle of sublevels between levels 4 and 6 of the main dungeon has come to be known as the Dark Levels of Undermountain. Since many of these sublevels are accessible only via portals, few have been explored by outsiders. Several of the Dark Levels, all ruled by undead creatures, are collectively known as dooms.

One of these sublevels, known as Vanrakdoom, is controlled by the Church of Shar. Penetration of this area is a mission appropriate for a group of four 17th-level nonevil characters. The inclusion of a cleric in a party planning an excursion to this area is highly recommended.

As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87323.name: Benefits of Membership
87323.description:
From the PDF introduction

Substitution Levels for Minor Valorous Organizations in Champions of Valor

Champions of Valor discusses what it means to be valorous and heroic in Faerûn. The book introduces heroic ideals, as well as new feats, prestige classes, and substitution levels for heroes associated with the major valorous organizations. However, it does not provide any alternate mechanics for heroes belonging to all the minor valorous organizations in its pages. Some of these organizations are more suited for player characters than others, and several seem to cry out for some player character options. Thus, this web enhancement offers substitution levels for members of six minor valorous organizations.

Champions of Ruin, on the other hand, discusses what it means to be evil in Faerun, but it offers no substitution levels for any of the organizations that appear in its pages. To rectify this apparent oversight, substitution levels for the Zhentarim fighter and the Dark Moon monk are provided here as well.

As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87324.name: Environs of Waterdeep
87324.description:
From the PDF introduction

A City of Splendors: Waterdeep Forgotten Realms Web Enhancement

NEW HISTORICAL AND GEOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION FOR USE WITH CITY OF SPLENDORS: WATERDEEP

City of Splendors: Waterdeep provides the most in-depth description to date of the famed city of Waterdeep in the FORGOTTEN REALMS Campaign Setting. The book also offers new prestige classes, feats, monsters, and magic items. But space did not permit an exhaustive description of the areas around Waterdeep, so author Eric Boyd has provided a complete description and history of those areas in this web enhancement.

As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87325.name: Noble Houses of Waterdeep
87325.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for City of Splendors: Waterdeep

City of Splendors: Waterdeep provides the most indepth description to date of the famed city of Waterdeep in the FORGOTTEN REALMS Campaign Setting. The book also offers four new prestige classes appropriate for residents of Waterdeep, plus a variety of new feats, monsters, and magic items.

Noble Houses of Waterdeep provides a thorough and up-to-date break down of Waterdeep’s most important nobility. The nobles detailed he redo not rule the Waterdeep region, but they do own much of the surrounding countryside. For more information on these noble houses and their influence on the city, see City of Splendors: Waterdeep.

As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87326.name: Underdark Campaigns: Additional Encounters in the Deep Wastes
87326.description:
From the PDF introduction

A City of the Spider Queen Web Enhancement

City of the Spider Queen is an epic FORGOTTEN REALMS adventure designed to occupy a party of adventurers as they advance from 10th level all the way up to around 18th level. Enormous in scope and world-shaking in consequences, the adventure could provide the foundation for an entire campaign. The purpose of this web enhancement is to offer additional material to just that end: to enrich campaigns set in the Underdark, focusing on the events of the City of the Spider Queen adventure and the War of the Spider Queen novel series.

To use this web enhancement, you should already have City of the Spider Queen by James Wyatt. This bonus material is brought to you by the official FORGOTTEN REALMS website.

(This layout intentionally begins on page 2. There is no page 1.)

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87327.name: Secrets of the Fochlucan College
87327.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement Adventure Site for Complete Adventurer

Complete Adventurer offers a wealth of new spells, prestige classes, feats, and magic items for bards and rogues. According to a sidebar in the description of the Fochlucan lyrist prestige class, a college for bards is located on the shores of Loch Firrnen, a few miles from the town of Oakenway. This adventure site details that haven of peaceful study.

Secrets of the Fochlucan College is an adventure site that can be dropped into any area that has a large, clear lake. A variety of adventures can take place here, since outsiders frequently infiltrate the college to search for its secrets. As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

87328.name: Tarth Moorda
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87328.description:
From the PDF introduction

An Adventure Site for Complete Arcane

Complete Arcane offers a wealth of new spells, prestige classes, feats, and magic items for arcane spellcasters. Considerable information on running an arcane campaign is also provided, along with the details of three standard classes: the warlock, the warmage, and the wu jen. A fortified enclave dedicated to one of these classes, the warmage, is mentioned in a sidebar in the book. This adventure site details this isolated warmage training facility.

Tarth Moorda is an adventure site that can be dropped into any remote area with a hot, dry climate. A variety of adventures can take place here, though the intrigue within the enclave can constitute an adventure in itself. As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

87329.name: More Divinity
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87329.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Complete Divine

Complete Divine is packed full of material useful to clerics, druids, and other divine spellcasters, including feats, prestige classes, spells, and magic items. Some of this material is freshly updated for D&D v.3.5, and the rest is brand-new.

But there’s only so much room in any book, and some of the new prestige classes couldn’t be included. So without further ado, here are four new divine prestige classes to use in your D&D campaign.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87330.name: The Order of the Chalice Expansion
87330.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for the Complete Warrior

The Complete Warrior presents prestige classes, feats, spells, magic items, and organizations geared for the martial at heart. This article expands one of these organizations, the Order of the Chalice, with details of membership, a fully developed chapter house, and complete statistics blocks for three NPC members.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87331.name: Called to Serve
87331.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Defenders of the Faith: A Guidebook to Clerics and Paladins Web Enhancement

Defenders of the Faith: A Guidebook to Clerics and Paladins offers suggestions for holy (and unholy) quests and missions that churches might request or demand clerics undertake on behalf of their deities. Divine quests can serve as great adventure-starters, not just for clerics but for any character or party with allegiance to a patron deity.

Of course, each god has his or her own agenda in the world, so the nature of such quests can vary drastically from deity to deity. Also, as Defenders of the Faith points out, even churches devoted to the same god might emphasize different aspects of that god or parts of the god’s portfolio, and thus might hand down very dissimilar quests.

Let these suggestions, arranged by deity, get you started-whether you’re the player of a cleric, paladin, or other devout character, or a DM in need of a hook for your next adventure.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87332.name: Defenders of the Faith Spell Sheets
87332.description:
From the publisher's Website

A Defenders of the Faith: A Guidebook to Clerics and Paladins Web Enhancement

Bonus! Spell Planning Worksheets

Available only here! Check out our improved character sheets, tailored especially for clerics, paladins, blackguards, and the new prestige classes from Defenders of the Faith. The worksheets include:Updated spell lists specific to each character class (including new spells from Defenders).

* Boxes for tracking which spells your character has prepared and cast.
* Room to write in three domains -- to accommodate "prestige domains."
* Spell duration tracking system.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87333.name: New Gods on the Block
87333.description:
From the PDF Introduction

A Web Enhancement for Deities and Demigods

The new Deities and Demigods supplement provides everything you need to create, control, and call upon the most powerful beings in your campaign. While the book includes plenty of information on advancing characters to godhood, we thought it would be helpful, as you begin to explore the book, to have at hand an example of a recently ascended deity. Presented here
for your use and enjoyment is a divine character-Erbin, the beggar god-for your player characters to encounter in any of five different divine ranks. In addition, this web enhancement provides 21 campaign hooks offering suggestions for how this character might enter the PCs’ lives as part of, or as a result of, divine ascension. The wide range of these adventure
ideas helps show DMs how to develop their own stories around mortals becoming deities.

To use this web enhancement, you must already have the new edition of Deities and Demigods. This bonus material is exclusive to the official DUNGEONS &
DRAGONS website.

87334.name: Building a City
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87334.description:
From the PDF Introduction

A Web Enhancement for the Dungeon Master's Guide (D&D 3.5e) v3.5

If you plan to run an extended adventure-or even a whole campaign-in an urban environment, it’s important to put some time and effort into describing the details of your city. Chapter 5 of the DUNGEON MASTER’s Guide for D&D v.3.5 provides a basic framework for describing some key features of a city, such as its power centers, assets, and highest-level nonplayer characters. This web enhancement expands that basic system into
one that is more complex, but well worth the extra work in terms of the payoff for running a city-based campaign.

87335.name: L'Ange de Cristal
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
UK Amstrad CPC Floppy Disk edition
87335.description:
User Summary

The Council ruling the planet Xul 3 has a problem: while conducting a routine observation mission on the planet Kef, their spies have discovered a plot by the Kef leaders to attack several other worlds, including Xul 3. Kef, second planet of the Betelgeuse system, is inhabited by two races, the disciplined and organized Stiffiens and the anarchic, peace-loving Swapis and has always stayed outside galactic affairs. But since a series of natural catastrophes a few months ago, a religion called the Cult of Antinès has spread among the Stiffiens. The cult revolves around a mysterious building, Antinès, located high in the Kef mountains, that nobody has ever been able to enter. The Council is concerned by the threats of war and the spread of the new religion and they decide to send Crafton and his alien sidekick Xunk to investigate and try to discover the secrets of Antinès.

Get Dexter 2 uses the same engine as the previous game. The display uses isometric 3D. The player controls Crafton using the keyboard or the joystick, exploring Kef, picking up objects, dodging dangerous animals, plants or robots and searching for clues. The player can swap items with swapis, and must build up trust with the locals (represented by a percentage value on the screen) before being allowed to some places.

Get Dexter 2 was developed by Remi Herbulot, with graphics by Michel Rho.

87336.name: Heroes, Villains, and Vigilantes
87336.description:
Heroes, Villains, and Vigilantes is the title of a superhero-themed board game where two players use the forces of good and evil to vie for control of the city. The game currently features:

20 characters cards (5 heroes, 5 villains, 5 vigilantes, and support characters - Police Lieutenant, Police Squad, Mobster, Gangsters, and Street Punks)
12 location cards
markers

Victory is achieved by controlling a majority of the locations in play. Each player takes control of either the Heroes or the Villains. There are also five independent vigilantes that can be persuaded to join either team over time. The Mob is an extra resource for the Villains that can be driven out of the picture by the Heroes, and the cops swing with City Hall. If City Hall falls under the sway of evil, corruption runs rampant, and the police will actively help the Villains. Clean up City Hall, and the police become the force for Good they're supposed to be.

The fate of The City is in your hands!










HVV is now available as a free PNP edition.

87337.name: Wizards' Realm
87337.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Quite possibly, Wizards' Realm is your first introduction to the adventure of fantasy role-playing (though you've most likely heard of such gaming before). FRP, as it is abbreviated, lets you capture all the fun and challenge of "make-believe" again: You and your fellow-players are actors in a drama of your own invention, as you create your own characters and send them across imaginary worlds in search of wonder.

87338.name: Moebius Adventures: Core Rules
87338.description:
Publisher's Blurb:
