The Moebius Adventures Roleplaying Game is a universal, cross-genre rule system that will take you on a journey up the Mobius Strip and back again until you see all the stops along the way. The Core Rules book starts the trip by providing all the basic rules for the system. Here you'll learn about character creation, general gameplay, combat rules, and possibly even save the village of Domerre from some men with a monster!

87339.name: Obsidian Live Action Roleplaying Quickstart
87339.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Obsidian LARP project is based on the Obsidian: the Age of Judgement RPG from Apophis Consortium. This Quickstart offers a basic introduction to Live Action Obsidian gaming for fans of post-apocalyptic settings. This Quickstart contains the Live Action rules for all four starting Ethos (Mystics, Kultists, Corporates and Machines) from the Obsidian RPG as well as rules to explore the bleak future.

87340.name: A Christmas Story The Party Game
87340.description: This licensed board game is based on the classic holiday movie, "A Christmas Story". Players use one of the four pre-painted plastic miniatures to move across a board with a relatively simple track. The miniatures represent characters from the movie: Ralphie (the main character in his infamous pink bunny suit), Randy (Ralphie's younger brother bundled in immobilizing layers of winter clothing), Flick (Ralphie's friend), and the Old Man (Ralphie's father). Players are challenged with trivia cards and social activities.

87341.name: Wereldwijs Spel-Boek
87341.description:
The "Wereldwijs Spel-Boek" (freely translated to "Worldwise Gamebook") is based on the 1988 Dutch television show "Wereldwijs".
It was available in stores, but also given to the participants of the television show.

The game consists of:
- the book containing more than 5000 questions and answers
- a gameboard
- 12 theme cards
- 6 Worldwise jigsaw puzzles
- 6 pawns
- 1 die

From the back of the gamebook:
This Gamebook Worldwise is the first exciting question and answer game that will lead you across the whole world. The gamebook contains more than 5000 questions divided in three age categories: from 8-11, 11-16 and 16 years and older. To put it short: a game for the complete family.
The more you know, the further you will get! With the gamebook Worldwise one can enlarge ones knowledge on the field of: voyages of discovery, expressive art, worldseas, nature, music, tourism, sports and many other subjects.
Casablanca - Anton Geesink - origami, H2O - barracudas - drift currents and Beaujolais. Fascinating names out of the challenging gamebook Worldwise that will put to the test everybodies knowledge to their limits.
Knowledge alone isn't enough, as luck an coincidence will change the favors on unexpected moments.
More than five thousand difficult yet educational questions in increasing difficulty levels are the obstacles that one will meet in the Gamebook Worldwise. You decide if you want to answer easy or difficult questions. A correct answer will provide you with one or more pieces of the Worldwise jigsaw puzzle. Herewith you will progress to your goal step by step.
Have you almost completed your Worldwise jigsaw puzzle? Do you already believe you are the worldwise winner? You'd better watch out! Because with the gamebook Worldwise the smartest can still loose!

87342.name: Fantasy Wars
87342.description:
Fantasy Wars is a turn-based strategy game set in a fantasy world. Combining both classic strategy gameplay and sophisticated 3D graphics players can experience epic battles like never before.

Taking place in a fantasy world of Human kingdoms, Orc clans, Dwarfs' citadels and Elven forests the player is thrust into a world of war and legend. Play the role of an Orc or Goblin boss, a captain of the Human army or lead the elite forces of the Elven army. Participate in castle sieges and village defense, assault and reconnaissance operations and swift raids. To be victorious remember that the amount and experience of troops is not always the key factor, organize cooperation between different types of units and use the landscape to achieve strategic superiority.

The game consists of three story-connected campaigns. In each of them players will have to gather an army, upgrade units, find magic artifacts and study magic spells. An epic story has been crafted to draw gamers in. The great Orc chieftain and conqueror Ugraum, incited by the cruel shamans, gathers a huge horde to invade the land of Humans. Only a small, but experienced army of general Pfeil is able to fight against the powerful enemy. However the sides in this confrontation don't know that this is all just a part of evil plot of the dark powers.

Source: The Publisher Website.

User Summary
Fantasy Wars uses mechanisms similar to the series 'General' (in particular Fantasy General)

87343.name: Polyhedron (Issue 147, Vol.21, No.2)
rpgissuearticle: Elminster's Everwinking Eye: A Wayfarer's Guide to the FORGOTTEN REALMS
On The Trail: And So It Begins
87343.description:
Cover art: This month, Polyhedron goes druid crazy with a stunning painting from comics master Charles Vess. If you're not reading his amazing comic The Rose, you're really missing out on some beautiful art and fantastic storytelling. (from the credits page)

This issue featured articles on Druids and the leaders of Ravens Bluff.
It also had a Reader Survey on page 64.

87344.name: Dead Gawd's Hand
87344.description:
Publisher Description:

South of the savage lands of Gnardor, dominated by both rugged mountains and swampland, lies the Kingdom of Da'Neer, where fear and dark secrets are commonplace. Now, an ancient evil stirs deep within the bowels of the swamp, threatening to bring horrors beyond any this region – or this wurld – has seen for millennia. The Cult of Ygaruth is active, no doubt hoping to gain power from realms of terror beyond man's comprehension. It will take a brave band of adventurers to end this menace, or fall before the might of the Dead Gawd’s Hand. Have you the courage?

If so, you must prepare yourself, my friend. You are about to embark on a journey into a land where magic and monsters lurk in every darkened corner. This is not a place for the meek spirited or the wuss of heart. The Aldrazar™ campaign setting is a land embroiled in an epic struggle that has raged for countless eons: where the forces of evil war against those of good, where law struggles to keep chaos in check, where adventure and the art of hack are the meat and drink of all who would seek to carve their niche in such a hostile, forbidding and unforgiving environment. This is the realm of the HackMaster™ 4th edition role-playing game.

87345.name: Elven Legacy
87345.description:
Elven Legacy, the sequel to Fantasy Wars, delivers a world filled with magic and thrilling nonlinear storyline, gauged to provide many hours of gameplay for strategy fans. Through an epic quest aimed to restore the former glory of the Elven race the game offers both depth and scope, all in colorful and inspirational settings.

Play for elves or humans in two primary campaigns or for orcs in a wide variety of bonus missions. Using the accompanying tools players may create their own missions and campaigns and share them in multiplayer mode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

87346.name: White Wolf Inphobia (Issue 52 - Feb 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Leaded or Unleaded: Violence in Roleplaying
A Vintage Year for Vampires - Jugular Wine: A Vampire Odyssey
87346.description:
User summary
First lines of the editorial column says a lot about the focus of this issue:
Hey it’s February! All right! Sex and hearts and sex and stuff! Don’t forget to include our magazine in there. This is our St. Valentines issue and as usual we approach the day in our own immature, stupid and perverted style.

The issue came with two sets of cards for the card game Heavy Gear Fighter

Lovable Features
Dossy Stylin’
Violet
A vintage year for vampires
Sex and anime
Rolemaster Experience: Simplified
The Interactive Toolkit, Part II
Heavy Gear Fighter
VR/RL
Cinema on the "Lew" of Substance
Apocalypse Cow
Harlan Ellison Responds

Amorous Columns
Runes
From the Pack
Industry Wired
Howling at the Moon
The White Wolf EAC
Fear & Loating
Beyond the Parents’ Basement

87347.name: Indianer-Joes Versteck: Tom Sawyer in Gefahr
87347.description:
User summary:

Adventure for the RPG 'Der Geheimbund des Schwarzen Auges'. The module is about Tom Sawyer by Mark Twain. The characters are sent out to correct the story which has magically changed, trapping Tom Sawyer and Becky in a cave.

87348.name: Entführt ins Wunderland: Rettet Silbermähne!
87348.description:
User summary:

Adventure for the RPG 'Der Geheimbund des Schwarzen Auges'. The module is about Alice in Wonderland by Lewis Carroll. The characters are sent out to correct the story which has magically changed, finding some main characters of the story that disappeared.

87349.name: Matt Hazard: Blood Bath and Beyond
87349.description:
User Summary

Matt Hazard: Blood Bath and Beyond is the downloadable sequel to Eat Lead: The Return of Matt Hazard. The game places players in control of Matt Hazard again, and this time he needs to prevent the evil conglomerate Marathon Megacorp from destroying him by going back in time.

Blood Bath and Beyond steps away from its predecessor, and is modeled as a more retro-style 2D side-scroller instead of a 3D third person shooter. The game draws many components from classic run-and-gun titles, such as the ability to use upgraded weapons after collecting pickups and a difficulty setting where enemies kill Matt with a single hit.

The main villain, General Neutronov, has revived Hazard’s greatest enemies, and the hero’s subsequent romp through time brings him to a number of wild environments, including a Japanese castle, pirate hideout, and Siberian ice mine. Players can tackle the game solo or team up with a friend in coop mode. The second player controls Matt’s partner Dexter Dare. Three difficulty settings allow players to tailor the title to their gaming preferences.

87350.name: Montjoie!
87350.description:
Computerized version of the boardgame "Joan of Arc"

Montjoie ! is what French knights used to yell out in the midst of the battle as a rallying cry and to identify each other. It remained so till the end of knighthood days.

8 historical missions - 8 free games - Multiplayer - 100+ hours of game playing time. A game strong on history and fun for players aged ten years and above.

Montjoie ! the video game is your chance to embody one of the factions (France, England, Burgundy, Brittany, Navarre, Flanders) that fought over the French realm during the Hundred Years’ War (1337-1454) and to bring back to life the major events and battles of that stormy era. The famous homonymous board game was adapted, round by round, as a strategy video game, to be played solo or multiplayer, offering a journey through the whole Hundred Years’ War as well as scenarios representing the realm of France at various key dates, calling for a combination of diplomacy, tactics, fights and careful thinking.

Source: The Developer Website.

87351.name: Die Räuber von Sherwood Forest: Robin Hood unter falschem Verdacht
87351.description:
User summary:

Adventure for the RPG 'Der Geheimbund des Schwarzen Auges'. The module is about Robin Hood. The characters are sent out to correct the story which has magically changed, fighting off a gang of robbers sent by the sheriff..

87352.name: 20000 Years Under The Earth
87352.description:
Publisher Blurb:
We know there isn’t anything ‘out there’ since the globe has been explored top to bottom...or has it? An entire lost continent, Antarctica, holds secrets a scientist can only dream of, treasures a thief could only hope for, and alien beings that an adventurer, such as yourself, is about to meet face-to-face...

87353.name: Ghost Stories
87353.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Everybody's heard ghost stories around the fire. Ghosts like to haunt our dreams, our fantasies, and now your lives! Delve into some of the most haunted locations in the world with these three open-ended adventures, wherein the door that separates this world from the next will be ripped off its hinges!

87354.name: John Silvers dunkler Plan: Das Abenteuer auf der Schatzinsel
87354.description:
User summary:

Adventure for the RPG 'Der Geheimbund des Schwarzen Auges'. The module is about Treasure Island by Louis Stevenson. The characters are sent out to correct the story which has magically changed.

Return to Stevensons Treasure Island an try to screw John Silvers evil plans. At the end you will met John Hawkins and help him to get the treasure on board.

87355.name: Der Fluch des maurischen Zauberers: Wo ist Aladdins Wunderlampe?
87355.description:
User summary:

Adventure for the RPG 'Der Geheimbund des Schwarzen Auges'. The module is about Aladdin. The characters are sent out to correct the story which has magically changed, to stop the evil wizard who has put a spell on Aladdin causing him to forget everything.

87356.description:
Indie expansion set - including boards, cards and rules - for Talisman third Edition a board and card game in a fantastic world where players attempt to collect Talismans for Victory.

From the rules:
"The Vampire's Keep is designed to expand the world of Talisman in a dark new way. Throughout the course of the game, Characters may discover several points of entry to the Keep. If this expansion is used with the new accompanying rules, the only way a Character can successfully obtain a Talisman is through the bowels of the Keep. The Keep exists on a mysterious plane and is riddled with terrors, traps and treasure. Only the strongest adventurers may survive the perils of the Vampire's Keep!"
87356.name: The Vampire's Keep (fan expansion for Talisman)

87357.name: The Day after Ragnarok (HERO System 6th Edition)
rpgpodcastepisode: Carnagecast 22: Brad Younie of Carnivore Games and The Day After Ragnarok
87357.description:
From the publisher's website:
The Day After Ragnarok: Hero Edition includes:

Complete rules and guidelines for creating a hero suited for these dark times, including thirty-five Heroic Templates!
Dangerous ophi-tech devices built with knowledge torn from the Thing that nearly killed the world: fiber bombs, Marconi pistols, jet-packs, and more!
A grand tour through the post-apocalyptic world of 1948, from the drowned East Coast to the Soviet empire behind the Serpent Curtain—including the Top Five Places to Be Attacked By Pirates, the Top Five *Places to Find A Remote Castle Ruled By A Madman, and much more!
Stats for more than thirty foes to shoot, stab, or sneak past: *Serpent cultists, Spetsnaz troopers, swamp devils, and … snakes! Giant, 80-foot long snakes, that is!
Over 20 pages of pure adventure: Four campaign types, each with a sample campaign laid out in nine scenario seeds. A massive Adventure Generator, helping you build every tale from the Hook to the Henchmen to the Twist ending! Four worked examples, taking the Adventure Generator’s raw numbers and running with them.
Plus old-school random encounters for the devastated wastelands of America—will you face slave-raiding Klansmen, the terrifying fly-by-night, or a desperate band of escaped Wehrmacht P.O.W.s?




user comment
also see The Day after Ragnarok (Savage Worlds)

87358.description:
A set of 12 new cards which expands the Heavy Gear Fighter base game. According to the description when published, these card are more powerful than those in the regular deck. The theme is power and performance, thus the name Booster

The 12 cards are:
* Multi (in three colors)
* Enhanced
* Explosive
* Malfunction
* False Alarm
* Heavy Rocket Pod
* Extended Range
* Tactical Linkup
* Nitro Charger

Two copies of this set was included in the periodical White Wolf Inphobia issue 52.
87358.name: Heavy Gear Fighter, Booster I Card Set

87359.name: Polyhedron (Issue 77 - Vol. 12, No. 11)
rpgissuearticle: Convention Sights: The Network in Pictures
Cutting Remarks: A Macabre Crossword Puzzle
Downunder The Living City: An AD&D 2nd Edition Scenario for 4-6 PCs, Levels 2-5
Enigma: Who Is This Mysterious Woman?
Into The Dark: That Devilish Doctor
The Living City: Elonia's Beauty Shoppe
The Living Galaxy: Adventures From Your Library, Part 1
Notes From HQ: What You Can Do For Your Newszine
The Bard's Corner: Rainy Days and Mundanes Always Get Me Down
Weather Report For Krynn: Onto Every Campaign, A Little Rain Should Fall
87359.description:
Cover art: Could this scene of watery peril await your PCs? Go "Downunder the Living City" (page 9) and find out. Art by Terry Pavlet. (from the contents page)

This issue featured Downunder the Living City by Wayne Straiton - The Port of Ravens Bluff could be left high and dry unless you venture beneath the Sea of Fallen Stars.
'Classifieds' were on the inside front mailing cover, 'Conventions' was on the inside back mailing cover, and a 'Standard Disclosure Form' for readers wanting to submit articles to TSR was on the outside back mailing cover.
It also had a center pull-out, a preregistration form for the Winter Fantasy Convention '93.

The contents page listed an article, "Hey Rocky" by Kevin Rau, but the article did not appear in the magazine.

87360.name: G.M. Magazine (Issue 11 - Jul 1989)
rpgissue: G.M. - The Independent Fantasy Roleplaying Magazine
rpg: Judge Dredd the Role-Playing Game (Games Workshop)
87360.description:
Contents:

•News
•Rose "Greyhawk" Estes Interview
•Win the Silver Arm
•Reviews
•Computer RPGs
•Covention Corner
•Books by Alan Crump
•Zine Scene by Wayne
•Live Roleplaying Supplement by Piers Massey
•Win A Monster Mask
•Adventuring in Discworld by Kevin Puttick
•The Test - Exclusive extract from Terry Pratchett's latest Discworld Novel
•PBM Update by Wayne
•Megafax - Part 2 -A Judge Dread RPG sub-plot by Marcus L Rowlands
•The Axeman Cometh!
•Critical Hits by David Langford

87361.name: Bitwa pod Beresteczkiem z Samuelem Twardowskim
87361.description: The game is a simplified simulation of Battle of Beresteczko. The event took place on 28-30 June 1651. After a few lost battles Polish-Lithuanian Republic managed to consolidate its forces - in number of about 60 thousand - and stopped about 80 thousand army of Cossacks led by Bohdan Chmielnicki and 30 thousand Tatars. Game mechanics try to reflect the way the battle was carried out but is not a typical battle simulation. Units can reatreat using a bridge on river Styr or across swamps. Players' aim is to eliminate each other's pieces.

87362.name: Spectre of the Beast
87362.description:
Subtitle: A Storytelling Game of Civilization, Suffering, and Triumph

Publisher's description:

There is a Beast in the heart of Man. A savage instinct baser than any animal's, which leads to self-destruction. Mankind's children cry out in their bondage. Will you heed their cry and liberate them, or increase their burden until they break?

Spectre of the Beast is a roleplaying game about the march of Civilization, and the bloody grist that fuels its mill. Players will tell the stories of Champions: pivotal men and women of different cultures throughout Epochs of history, each poised on the crux of historical change and whose driving Ambitions decide the fate of their people. Always the ways of war and massacre loom as tempting options to attain their desires, but you will forge a Paradise for humanity or wipe it from the face of the Earth? Play is about finding out.

87363.name: Trin'Dar
87363.description:
Subtitle: Fantasy Role Playing Game

Publisher's description:
Welcome to Trin'Dar. A continent formed from the aftermath of warring gods; a realm kept in balance by a superior race of Dragons that will only interact in the guise of mortals. Explore a world where the only absolute is the unknown. Creation of characters is straightforward; combat is swift and deadly. The spells of the realms are limited only by your imagination and weapons are organized in groups for easy classification. This is the first step in an ever-expanding system to bring about the ultimate in gaming satisfaction. Become a part of the story and share your ideas and input.

87364.name: Universal Decay: Dead Stars Primer
87364.description:
Publisher Blurb:
It is the 29th century. Earth- indeed the entire Sol system – is no more. The great Gaean Empire has disintegrated, leaving hundreds of fragmented colonies scattered throughout the stars. Mankind has encountered other intelligent life- some benign, some terrifying- and is just now starting to rebuild. And lurking in the shadows lies the ever-present danger of the Necrol...

The Universal Decay: Dead Stars Primer is designed to introduce you to the alternative-d20 Universal Decay system and the Dead Stars setting. Included is all you need to run a simplified UDDS campaign. This product is free for download. If you like it, consider purchasing the full version- Universal Decay- Dead Stars Rule Book.

87365.description:
Pyramideto is a game by Jan Divecký (illustrations by Hana Pavlátová) for 2 to 4 players. For Pyramideto you need only one set of Magical pyramids and a deck of Pyramideto cards. The players’ task is to form trios out of the pyramids. These trios represent things around us.

The basic pack contains 36 regular goal cards divided into six groups. Each group consists of six goals with a same-color frame. In addition to the frame and a picture, each card shows the pyramid trio forming its goal. And a name of the goal in English, Czech and German.

Integrates with:

Hanukkah Pyramideto
87365.name: Pyramideto

87367.name: G-Core
87367.description:
What is G-Core?
G-Core is a simple set of rules for use in any genre. Spawned and updated for the modern gamer, G-Core roots come from the original Marvel Superheroes Role-Playing Game or more famously known as FASERIP. This ISN'T the original FASERIP nor is it a product of Marvel Comics, but it is 99% compatible with it.

Things we've updated:
-Talents have now become Special Focus
-Special Focus makes more out of a character's specialities
-Instead of Fighting, Agility, Strength, Endurance, Reason, Intuition, and Psyche we now have: Rumble, Agility, Might, Moxie, Smarts, Perception and Spirit.
-The tables are gone! After play testing using a simple ten-sided die, we found a better way to make resolutions! By doing this it became MUCH more comic book than the previous incarnation.
-Character Generation has moved into a Point Based creation. It is mapped out to avoid confusion. Creation takes around 10 to 15 minutes for adults. 15 to 30 minutes for younger children. The process, however, is always kept exciting.

Worried about real compatibility?
We took a character from the old FASERIP game and changed it to G-Core in less than 20 seconds!

87368.name: Monsters' Twilight: The Unhinged
87368.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Halloween is coming and the Twilight Medallion is missing! That means that soon the monsters of classic literature and more will be released! Can your heroes stop them before it's too late?

This the FIRST Character Pack for G-Core Super Hero Role-Playing system. In this PDF you get 8 famous monsters to run amok in your G-Core settings

87369.name: GodTech Technical Manual
87369.description:
Publisher Blurb:
GodTech sits in the shadows working to save humanity through amazing technology. Now get the inside scoop on the GodTech Technology!

Giant Robots!
Super Androids!
Mega Machines!
Anti-Super Tech!
And....two heroes who have access to alien tech and know how to use it!

This product requires G-Core to use!

87370.name: War of the Worlds 2010
87370.description:
Publisher Blurb:
The Martians have arrived at G-Core!

In 2010 the Martians invaded Earth. Super Heroes died. Other heroes took their place. But in 5 days the Earth would never be the same.

Set in the Guardian Universe III campaign, this G-Core product can be used in ANY G-Core setting!

You get:
Stats for the Martians, their Grey troops, the Queen, Martian War Machines, Flying Saucers and a SPECIAL surprise!

A daily campaign guide to all 5 days of the war! (Usable for any supers setting!)

Due to some content we recommend this for ages 13+, but with parental supervision it would work for ages 10+.
This product requires G-Core to use!

87371.name: Archimedes 7
87371.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Archimedes 7 is a colony ship traveling from our solar system to a distant world.
A small piece of tin protecting its inhabitants from the dangers of the void.
But the real danger is already inside the ship.

Archimedes 7 is the final chapter in a series of Call of Cthulhu scenarios all linked by the Yellow Sign. The Curse of the Yellow Sign scenarios contain no blasphemous books, no monsters, no cultists and no Library Use rolls. Only ordinary humans confronted with the true nature of the universe. They are designed to be played in a single evening with limited preparation and maximum impact, filled with the kind of ruthless game master techniques you expect from John Wick.

Archimedes 7 contains:

a map of the ship
6 pre-generated characters
Tons of advice and playtest notes

87372.name: Polyhedron (Issue 51 - Vol.10, No. 1)
rpgissuearticle: The Caves of Confection: An adventure for 6 D&D/AD&D characters, level 1-3
87372.description:
Also included as a free insert in Dragon #152 (Vol. XIV, No. 7), December 1989.

Cover art: A ship comes out of hyperspace to find itself bombarded by well-armed satellites, kicking off our science fiction series. Art by Kevin Ward.

This issue featured The Caves of Confection - a lighthearted D&D/AD&D adventure for 6 PCs of levels 1-3.
An RPGA membership application was on the inside of the front mailing cover, and an RPGA Network Tournament Request Form was on both sides of the back mailing cover.

87373.name: BEAN! The D2 RPG
87373.description:
Publisher Blurb:
BEAN! is an easy-to-master, rules-lite, d2 RPG system, and the latest stand-alone title from the Fabled Worlds RPG game system! Perfect for introducing new players or children to the hobby, BEAN! is also great for veteran gamers who enjoy flexibility in their rules. Complete in one simple volume, spend less time reading and more time playing! The highly versatile and customizable d2 game system is unique and quickly memorized, so simple, yet able to handle any situation on the spot, without having to thumb through volumes of obscure rules.

The best part? You get to toss your beans! With a d2 dice system, you could use standard dice for "high or low" "odd or even" rolls, you could toss coins or any other objects that have two distinct sides, but we recommend plain ol' beans! They're cheap and plentiful, some people really enjoy customizing their own beans, and a handful of beans keeps the game moving along quick and easy!

87374.name: Deliverance: Stormlord II
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
UK Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87374.description:
User Summary

Stormlord the warrior is back: his quest is not over and there are fairies to be saved in four different worlds.

Deliverance is a straight action game (the puzzle elements of the first game have been toned down) where the player lead Stormlord across each level, killing enemies and picking up fairies. There are bonus rounds between each level, in which the player must pick up gold pieces (2 gold pieces buys an extra life). Each level has its hazards and creatures (the first level, Hell has all sorts of demons, the third level is an enchanted forest peopled by creatures made of living wood...), and the last level is a shoot'em up where Stormlord rides a Dragon. Each level ends with a boss fight.

87375.name: Pocket Enigma
87375.description:
From the back of the box:
"Refreshingly different, POCKET ENIGMA is the perfect game for TWO adults.

"It's a race to the centre, BUT with a twist; you can sabotage your opponent. See them squirm as you move them back. Yes, at long last the pocket game that brings out the scoundrel in us all.

"The Riddle is the key - the NEW Challenge of the 90's. Some are easy, some fiendishly difficult. Can't solve them? Ask for a clue and see who your friends really are."

Pocket Enigma is a small version of the Enigma game of riddles, with a small board inside the box lid, two pieces, a dice, some instructions, and 500 riddles. The objective is to move your gaming piece through a maze, from a starting point on the outer edge of the board, to the finishing point, at the center of the board. Players take it in turns to roll a die and move their pawn the indicated number of spaces along the track. There are special spaces along the track where a player is asked to solve a riddle.

87376.name: Lännen kultapeli
87376.description:
Players are gold miners, travelling first from east coast to west to dig gold, and then return back to east coast with money. Each state is owned by one player, and other players need to pay taxes, when entering the state.

Players can travel by walking or with horse by rolling the dice, with these options it is possible to get anywhere on the board. There are also some railroads on the east of Mississippi, these provide a constant travel speed, but they do cost something. It is also possible to travel with boats, this is very fast, but also very expensive.

Getting over the Mississippi river or over the Rockies is always a risky business. when players stop on special spots on the map, they need to draw one Chance card, which is usually trouble, but there are some good things also.

Once players get to the West, they can visit mining spots and dig gold, this is done simply by drawing one treasure card. Most of them are empty, but there are some gold (and other) valuable cards. When player finds gold, he needs to change it to cash in Los Angeles and return all the way back to East coast. The player who first finds gold, changes it to cash in LA and returns to East coast, is the winner.

87377.name: One Must Fall: Battlegrounds
87377.description:
User Summary

One Must Fall: Battlegrounds is a PC-only 3d fighting game developed by Diversions Entertainment.

Players takes control of a giant robot that does battle with others in many different arenas. There is a single player campaign mode for players, but the main draw is the 16 player simultaneous multiplayer.

Not only do players have to choose which robot to control, but which pilot to control it. The pilot determines the agility, overall strength, and endurance of the robot.

87378.name: Sango Fighter
videogameversion: South Korean Sega Master System edition
87378.description:
User Summary
Sango Fighter is a two-dimensional fighting game based on the Han Dynasty of feudal China (or the Three Kingdoms period). Players choose one of many famous generals, such as Guan Yu and Zhang Fei. Simple special moves exist for each playable character.

87379.name: StarCraft: Retribution
87379.description:
Retribution, an authorized expansion pack to StarCraft: Brood War, was published in 1998 by WizardWorks Software, independently from Blizzard Entertainment, and authorized by Blizzard as an expansion pack.

Retribution works within the limits of the original StarCraft game engine, and does not add any explicitly new content to the game, although it does contain over 120 new multiplayer maps, and a large single-player campaign.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://starcraft.wikia.com/wiki/StarCraft:_Retribution," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87380.name: Half-Dragons: Twice as Much Fun
87380.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Bonus Web Enhancement for Draconomicon: The Book of Dragons

Draconomicon is the ultimate D&D game accessory about the legendary creatures that give the game its name. Packed into the pages of this book are new dragon prestige classes, spells, feats, dragonlike monsters, and full statistics for 120 sample dragons-all ten of the chromatic and metallic dragons at all 12 age categories. A few pages of new material on half-dragons round out the book’s offerings, but there just wasn’t room to include samples of those.

This article presents ten sample half-dragons, one spawned from each of the ten true dragons presented in the Monster Manual. Each description includes a brief personality profile and some background notes, plus a full statistics block for the creature and sample treasure appropriate for the encounter.

87381.name: Sventsorggviresh's Volcano Lair
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87381.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Draconomicon: The Book of Dragons

The Draconomicon is the ultimate D&D game accessory about the legendary creatures that are literally the name of the game. Packed into the pages of this book are new dragon prestige classes, spells, feats, dragonlike monsters, and full statistics for 120 sample dragons-all ten of the chromatic and metallic dragons at all 12 age categories. This article presents one of the sample dragons from The Draconomicon along with her fully detailed lair. Sventsorggviresh, an old red dragon, is a suitable opponent for a 20th-level party.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87382.name: Epic-Level Prestige Class Progression
87382.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for the Epic Level Handbook

The Epic Level Handbook provides epic-level progressions-that is, information on the powers, abilities, and bonus feats gained by epic-level characters-for all 11 classes presented in the Player’s Handbook, as well as the six prestige classes detailed in the DUNGEON MASTER’s Guide. But with the vast number of prestige classes published in other DUNGEONS & DRAGONS products, the Epic Level Handbook couldn’t address the needs of every single epic-level character.

That’s where this web enhancement comes in. Here, you’ll find epic-level progressions for a full two dozen prestige classes drawn from various core D&D products: specifically, Defenders of the Faith, Manual of the Planes, Masters of the Wild, Song & Silence, Sword & Fist, and Tome & Blood. While this doesn’t encompass every prestige class presented to date (that would require an entire book all to itself!), it gives DMs a wide range of examples that should help them build other epic progressions as needed. Simply find a class (either here or in the Epic Level Handbook) that’s roughly similar to your chosen prestige class and start there.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87383.name: Deity Do's and Don'ts
87383.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Faiths and Pantheons

Faiths and Pantheons by Eric L. Boyd and Erik Mona offers an incredible amount of information on the primary deities of the FORGOTTEN REALMS Campaign Setting, including hit points, attacks, saving throws, and other abilities in a format similar to the MONSTER MANUAL’s. At first glance, one might expect to treat deities in a FORGOTTEN REALMS campaign like any other monster-brought in to harass and fight the heroes. Otherwise, why include that combat information?

In truth, the deities of Faerûn are much more than very powerful monsters and should be treated as such. Epic-level characters who have an easy time slaying dragons and the tarrasque should not look to the deities as their next conquests, to be pushed off the tops of walls, looted of their items, and locked in dungeons to make artifacts. These beings are deities for a reason, so introduce them into your campaign after careful consideration and in particular circumstances. This free supplement to Faiths and Pantheons helps guide you through this process.

To use this web enhancement, you must already have Faiths and Pantheons. This bonus material is exclusive to the official FORGOTTEN REALMS website.

This layout intentionally begins on page 2. There is no page 1.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87384.name: The Leaves of Learning
87384.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Faiths and Pantheons Web Enhancement

This bonus supplement, a full description of a temple to Oghma,, god of knowledge, was cut from the Faiths and Pantheons sourcebook for space reasons. We offer it here, including color map, NPC stats, and adventure hooks, as a free supplement to the product or for use in your FORGOTTEN REALMS campaign. For more FORGOTTEN REALMS bonus material, visit the setting’s official website every week.

This layout intentionally begins on page 2. There is no page 1.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87385.name: Fiendish Fun
87385.description:
From the PDF introduction

Sample fiends for use with Fiend Folio

The new Fiend Folio book has an emphasis on, logically enough, fiends: outsiders with the evil subtype. So great is this emphasis that the book even offers new ways to enhance the powers and abilities of such creatures, particularly as they pertain to their interactions with mortals.

The Fiend Folio offers three new prestige classes designed especially for fiends-the fiend of blasphemy, the fiend of corruption, and the fiend of possession. This article explores the application of those prestige classes by offering detailed statistics and brief histories for several fiends that have adopted them. Each prestige class is illustrated with two fiends, one from the Monster Manual and one from the Fiend Folio. These creatures are ready-to-use NPCs that you can drop into your campaign world wherever you need a real challenge for your players!

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87386.name: Fiendish Codex I: The Lost Annals
87386.description:
For Fiendish Codex I: Hordes of the Abyss

From the PDF introduction

Further Information Regarding Abyssal Topics

Loremasters and other scholarly folk always seek information to fill the gaps of their knowledge. With luck and skill, they can discover knowledge that some find useful, but they sometimes find that others believe that the lore they pursue would be best forgotten eternally. The passages below fall into the former category for many who must deal with Abyssal topics in their research and their journeys. Why not take a look and make your own decision on the subjects discussed, though? What harm could it do?

With great pride, we present the "lost" sections of the Fiendish Codex I: Hordes of the Abyss. Use the knowledge contained within these entries in good health.

> Laghathti
> The Woeful Escarand
> Additional Layers

User Comment

This document consisted of three separate hyper-linked webpage documents. These documents could be downloaded as a set of three PDFs titled; Laghathi, The Woeful Escarand and Additional Layers.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87387.name: Fiendish Aspects I
87387.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Fiendish Codex I: Hordes of the Abyss

Got demons? Well, you will if you pick up a copy of Fiendish Codex I: Hordes of the Abyss, which is packed full of information on demons and demon lords and how to use all this nastiness in your campaign. The chapter on demon lords mentions aspects of the demon lords as more common foes than the demon lords themselves, but few aspects are presented in the book since the designers put so many other useful things in that tome.

Well, that is where this little guide comes in. Over the next month or so, you’ll meet eleven aspects of demon lords, all suitable for mid-level campaigns. This first outing presents four: Juiblex and his rival Zuggtmoy, Kostchtchie the Lord of Wrath, and everyone’s favorite (or second favorite) Demogorgon. This version of Demogorgon’s aspect is different from that presented in the Miniatures Handbook, since it focuses on a different side of the Prince of Demons. Several of the demon lords could have aspects that are different than the ones you see here, because an aspect is one facet of a demon lord rather than a lesser version of the whole package. If you don’t like the aspect presented here for your demon lord of choice, choose a different "view" of the demon lord and make your own. For example, Juiblex has a few combat tricks, plus a few spell-like and ooze-related powers. If you want a more oozy aspect of Juiblex, take away the grappling and constriction powers and give it the create slime and summon ooze abilities. Additionally, each aspect has entries with suggestions on how to use the aspect in the EBERRON and FORGOTTEN REALMS settings.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87388.name: Fiendish Aspects II
87388.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Fiendish Codex I: Hordes of the Abyss

With all the nastiness inside Fiendish Codex I: Hordes of the Abyss, and all the nastiness that the designers of the book couldn’t quite squeeze into this tome, you’re bound to have a bit of overflow possibilities. Our second installment of the aspects of demon princes introduces you to the queen of the succubi and brings back the aspect of Orcus from the Miniatures Handbook. He is a little changed in this version, but not very much. This part also introduces ancient Dagon, the first obyrith demon prince of this collection. As in the first web enhancement in this series, each aspect has entries with suggestions on how to use the aspect in the EBERRON and FORGOTTEN REALMS settings.

Obyriths are older demons than the tanar’ri that have arisen in the past millennia. Before delving into the demons themselves, though, take a look the information on the obyrith demon subtype in the sidebar.

User Comment

This item shares the same name as the web enhancement for Fiendish Codex II: Tyrants of the Nine Hells. Fiendish Aspects II

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87389.name: Fiendish Aspects II
87389.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Web Enhancement for Fiendish Codex II: Tyrants of the Nine Hells

Fiendish Codex II: Tyrants of the Nine Hells is packed to the brim with information about the Nine Hells, devils, archdevils, harvesting souls, playing devils, and more. If you like using devils in your campaigns, you should get this book to help you flesh them out. It also includes updated versions of devils that saw publication in Book of Vile Darkness and the different Monster Manual tomes. At the end of the book you’ll find aspects of the archdukes, the rulers of the layers of the Nine Hells. The aspects of the Lords of the Nine presented there are suitable for high-level campaigns. However, you might want your lower level player characters (PCs) to encounter appropriately challenging aspects of the Lords of the Nine. This web enhancement presents these mid-level aspects, along with a revised aspect of Tiamat (originally from Miniatures Handbook) and aspects of the kobold deity Kurtulmak and the sahuagin deity Sekolah.

As with the demonic aspects in Fiendish Aspects I, you can create different "versions" of the aspects than those presented here. Each archduke is complex and has many powers. If you want a version along different lines, just swap out the special abilities for the ones you want, using the high-level aspects presented in Fiendish Codex II: Tyrants of the Nine Hells as your template.

Since the Nine Hells are very orderly, the aspects are presented in order of planar home from first to
ninth.

User Comment

This document shares the same name as the 2nd web enhancement for Fiendish Codex I: Hordes of the Abyss. Fiendish Aspects II

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87390.name: Deities
87390.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting Web Enhancement

The new FORGOTTEN REALMS Campaign Setting provides basic information on all of the deities of Faerûn and detailed information on thirty of them. Here are descriptions similar to those found in the deity entries in the D&D Player’s Handbook for all the remaining deities of the FORGOTTEN REALMS Campaign Setting.

This layout intentionally begins on page 2. There is no page 1.

87391.name: A Duo of Fighters
87391.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 13-page PDF includes two starfighters, the Harasser and the Gnat, and new game rules and statistics. Each starfighter includes a full-page illustrator and silhouette.

Includes four pages of counters to use these ships with upcoming carrier and hangar tile sets from SkeletonKey Games. Three different fighters, each with two counters (pristine and damaged versions).

This new PDF does not include deckplans or new tiles -- these are small starfighters with cockpit space only.

87392.name: Curse of the Rusty Walrus
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87392.description:
From the PDF introduction

A web enhancement for Frostburn

A Short Adventure for Four 8th-Level Player Characters

Frostburn introduces a wealth of information for players and Dungeon Masters whose campaigns happen to be set in frozen lands such as the north pole, a high mountain pass, a frozen outer plane, or somewhere equally inhospitable. While these dangerous realms are rife with adventure and would make excellent locations for any number of exciting campaigns, it s not a simple matter to abandon a current campaign and start up a new one. Of course, you could just have the PCs go on one or two adventures set in such a region, eventually to return to warmer climates and the main campaign.

Yet you don't have to make the PCs travel to the distant glaciers or frozen outer planes just to get some use out of this book. Nor do you need to start up a brand new campaign set in the Land of Black Ice, or the Great Glacier, or even Stygia. You can bring the frost to the PCs!

Curse of the Rusty Walrus is a short adventure for 8th-level player characters (PCs). You can use it as inspiration or as a starting point for adventures that utilize the new rules and options presented in Frostburn. As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

87393.name: The Cronkite
87393.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take to the stars . . . and report the news! The Cronkite is a news broadcast starship that includes camera drones and two hovervan "news trucks," and is the perfect base of operations for a player character group looking for interesting roleplaying opportunities.

Packed with a starship key, top view illustration and front view silhouette, deckplan, game statistics, and notes and adventure hooks for news broadcast campaigns, this 10-page PDF is ready for action.

Also includes a sheet of counters -- 28 camera drones* (including 4 destroyed versions), 4 hovervans** (two of them destroyed), and 2 sensor drones.

To use this starship with your miniatures you'll need SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles: Star Command, Star Freighter, and Star Hunter.

Includes one bonus tile, a variant of a tile found in the e-Future Tiles: Star Command.


One design, two different colors.
One design, two different colors.

87394.name: The Magellan
87394.description:
From publisher blurb:

This latest release details a science vessel constructed using SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles: Star Chaser, Star Command, Star Patrol, and Star Freighter tile sets.

10-pages of new rules, adventure hooks, game statistics -- for the starship, a shuttle, a science drone, and a hovertruck -- and the deckplan and starship illustration/silhouette found in all* of Ronin Arts' "Starship" releases.

Includes a new starship tile for use with SkeletonKey Games' starship series (the cockpit) and a sheet of counters (hovertrucks, science drones, and a variant colored version of a hovervan from Starship 7).


[Starship 6] does not include deckplans.

87395.name: Devastator
87395.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 12-page PDF presents the Devastator Class, one of the heaviest and toughest gunships in known space. In addition to the four turrets of fire-linked needle drivers, the Devastator also carries a half-dozen InfantryBot Series combat robots. This PDF is packed with adventure ideas, game statistics, and two new bonus tiles for use with SkeletonKey Games' e-Future Tiles series.

To create this starship for use with miniatures you will need Future: Starship 3, e-Future Tiles: Star Freighter, e-Future Tiles: Star Patrol, and e-Future Tiles: Star Chasers.

87396.name: The Daytona
87396.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 12-page PDF presents The Daytona, the personal starship of the Cerulean Racing crew. This struggling band of hover racers is an excellent model for a creative approach to a party of adventurers and can be used as material to enrich your campaign or inspiration for a series of adventures or a complete campaign.

By using SkeletonKey Games e-Future Tiles: Star Freighter and e-Future Tiles: Star Chasers (see below), along with the two included garage tiles, you can construct this ship for use with miniatures. Also includes hover racer counters.

87397.name: Ghostwalk Web Enhancement
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87397.description:
For Ghostwalk

From the PDF introduction

One of the advantages of designing games in Washington state is the ready supply of rules-knowledgeable gamers. During the design and development of the Ghostwalk campaign, we spent a whole summer playing through two of the adventures included in the book. This weekly minicampaign allowed us to test not only the adventures but also the game rules for the setting. Playtester feedback helped shape the flavor of Manifest and its environs, and the comments we received often offered ideas and solved problems that the designers had overlooked.

Unfortunately, not everything we wanted to include would fit into the book. So without further ado, here are some additional monster templates, feats, spells, and magic items for the Ghostwalk campaign, plus an adventure seed for you to develop and the full statistics for the playtest characters. May all of these offerings enhance your players’ experiences on the other side.

87398.name: Horizon Traveler
rpgissuearticle: The Flexibility of the Compact System
87398.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our largest ship yet! Four levels!

This 21-page PDF presents the Horizon Traveler, a unique starship design with four levels. The Horizon Traveler is ready for use as an adventure location, a base of operations, or a background element for your campaign. Includes a bonus tile from SkeletonKey Games and new concepts, adventure hooks, game stats, and deckplans.

To use this starship you will need tiles from the following SkeletonKey Games e-Future Tiles sets. Scroll down for links to these products.

Star Freighter
Star Patrol
Star Chaser
Star Command
Battle Damaged Starship

87399.name: Ghost Ship
rpgissuearticle: The Flexibility of the Compact System
87399.description:
From publisher blurb:

Flickering lights. Showering sparks. Drifting silently through space.

You've discovered the Kapteyn, a ghost ship lost in deep space. Inside this 29-page PDF your crew will encounter a starship unlike any other yet released by the Ronin Arts shipyards.

Designed as an adventure location, this drifting starship includes:

Information on the Kapteyn, including its history and game statistics.
Information and game statistics on the robotic crew.
A key for the 100+ areas inside the ship and two forms designed for customizing the ship to fit your exact needs.
Advice on customizing the ship and introducing it to your campaign including notes on the condition of the ship and encountering the ship.
Scenario suggestions that assist the GM in fitting the ship to his needs.




This adventure toolkit also includes the deckplans, recognition sheet, and a bonus tile from SkeletonKey Games. To construct the ship for use with miniatures you will need SkeletonKey Games' complete line of starship-related e-Future Tiles. See below for the complete listing.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87400.name: Ghostwalk Update for D&D 3.5
87400.description:
From the PDF introduction

The Ghostwalk Campaign Option was released only a short time before the D&D v3.5 rules were. This document provides all the changes that should be made to the book to update it for use with the new rules. A few clarifications are included here as well.

Minor or obvious changes that a reasonable person could determine without effort, or which have no effect on the game mechanics of the book, have been omitted unless entire sections are being replaced. Such changes include the following.

> The number of 5-foot squares corresponding to a creature’s
speed,
> A separate attack entry for any monster that has only
one attack form, or whose full attack is identical to its
normal attack,
> Changing "Face/Reach" to "Space/Reach" in cases
where the corresponding numbers remain the same,
> Changing a spell’s casting time from "1 action" to "1
standard action,"
> Changing a magic item’s "Market Price" to "Price," and
so forth. Changes such as these are left in the reader’s
hands. All other pertinent adjustments, however, are
given here.

Also included with this document is a map that was dropped from the book for space reasons. With this bonus map and the changes indicated here, your Ghostwalk campaign can be better than ever before. So get out your pen and start marking these changes in your book!

87401.name: Picket Ship
87401.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Picket Ship is a 7-page FREE starship. Inside this PDF you'll find the deckplan, two starship class templates, and full statistics for the ship.

87402.name: The Taurus
87402.description:
From publisher blurb:

Future: Starship 15 -- The Taurus takes you on an intergalactic safari as you race across the stars in search of big game of the xenomorph variety. Whether you're working for science, an eccentric billionaire, or an evil corporation the goal is the same: load down your customized cargo hold with the strangest, most valuable xenomorph that you can track and capture.

This release in Ronin Arts' Future: Starship series presents more than just a new starship with deckplans and detailed information for the official future SRD -- though we've got that, too! Inside you?ll find:

Gamemaster information on running a hunter campaign, including suggestions for those that might be in the market for unique xenomorphs;
Rules on tranquilizers and tranq guns;
Two new vehicles;
and adventure hooks written to fire up your imagination and get you quickly into the adventure.




All this plus three new tiles from SkeletonKey Games, perfect for use with almost any release in SkeletonKey Games? e-Future Tiles series (see below for covers and links to each set in the series).

So what are you waiting for? Let's get out there and bag us a beastie, boys! And don't ever forget, you've always gotta bring 'em back alive!

87403.name: Celestial Defender
87403.description:
From publisher blurb:

This rebuilt light frigate spends its days patrolling the Drexas IV system, snatching illegal cargo from smugglers, pirates, and other unwanted individuals that enter the system. With three new starship devices, two new starship actions, a detailed deckplan, and a full-page illustration this latest release in Ronin Arts' popular Future: Starship series is ready for immediate use.

Note: You need SkeletonKey Games' Future Tiles: Starships PDF in order to use this ship with miniatures.

87404.name: Scaling Up Hellspike Prison
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87404.description:
From the PDF introduction

Scaling the Adventure for Four 12th-Level Characters

The adventure Fantastic Locations: Hellspike Prison was designed for four 9th-level characters. The following web enhancement provides alternative encounters that scale the adventure up for four 12th-level characters. Each section below should match up with the appropriate section in the original adventure.

87405.name: The Cygnus
87405.description:
From publisher blurb:

Prepare to lose yourself in space! The Cygnus is an experimental PL 7 starship featuring a prototype PL 8 gravitic redirector engine -- the perfect thing to throw your players' characters into the marooned campaign described in the pages of this PDF.

The Cygnus is a two-level starship design packed with new ideas, new rules, an exciting new campaign concept, and the art and deckplans you've grown to expect from each release in Ronin Arts' Future: Starship series.

With more sales than any other single starship series, grab The Cygnus today to see what sets Ronin Arts' starships apart from the competition.

Deckplans can be created at miniatures scale using SkeletonKey Games' Future Tiles: Starships.

87406.name: Mecha SRD Extreme
87406.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mecha SRD Extreme is a 91-page landscape PDF that presents the Mecha SRD along with a 6-page appendix of new material and an appendix titled "Mecha as Magic Items." The new material includes new feats, new mecha defects, and new mecha exotic abilities. Two mecha (a power suit and giant robot) and a monster complete the new material.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87407.name: Theaters of Death
87407.description:
From the PDF introduction

Battlefield Encounters for 4th-, 8th-, and 10th-Level Player Characters Featuring Material from Heroes of Battle

Heroes of Battle brings the dungeon out onto the battlefield and enables Dungeon Masters (DMs) to set adventures against the backdrop of armed conflict. Whether player characters (PCs) lead army units into battle or perform elite missions on behalf of battle leaders, the foes they face on the battlefield are just as lethal as any they would find in a dungeon. In addition to new battle-oriented spells, feats, and items, Heroes of Battle presents plenty of sample battlefield encounters that can be dropped into any war-based scenario.

Theaters of Death is a collection of new battlefield encounters (for characters from 4th to 10th level) are designed to supplement those pre s e nted in Chapter 3 of Heroes of Battle. These scenarios are nonlinear and not designed to work with any one specific battle. Thus, each can be dropped into a mass combat of your choice, or modified to work with a variety of different battles. Like the battlefield encounters given in Heroes of Battle, these scenarios can easily be reused simply by changing the specific creatures or terrain. As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

Theaters of Death is not set in a specific campaign world. In fact, in most cases, no specific names or places are given, so that you can more easily drop the encounter into your campaign.

87408.name: Tarus's Banquet
rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast - Free Adventure Downloads
Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87408.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Short Web Enhancement Adventure for Libris Mortis: The Book of Undead

For Four 10th-Level Player Characters

Libris Mortis is all about undead-their abilities, how to fight them, how to improve them, and how best to use them in your campaign. This short scenario uses feats, spells, and monsters from that book to build campaign elements that involve undead.

Tarus’s Banquet is a short D&D adventure for four 10th-level player characters (PCs). It takes place in and around a manor house near a small city. As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87409.name: The Flow of Fresh Brains
87409.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Short Adventure for Four 11th-Level Player Characters Featuring Material from Lords of Madness: The Book of Aberrations

Lords of Madness details the D&D game’s most unusual and unsettling creatures-the aberrations. The book also offers invaluable tips for overcoming these creatures, as well as new feats, spells, and equipment based on their abilities. In addition, several organizations dedicated to the eradication of aberrations are presented.

The Flow of Fresh Brains is a short D&D adventure for four 11th-level player characters (PCs). The scenario is not setting-specific; you can place it in any populated section of your campaign world that is a near a medium or large city. The action begins along one of the major trading routes between cities, then progresses to an illithid nautiloid. As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

This adventure uses the horrific adventure guidelines presented on page 13 of Lords of Madness. Since the encounter levels (ELs) of several encounters are higher than normal for the character level of the PCs, character death is a very real possibility. At the very least, the PCs will find themselves severely taxed during this adventure, so be sure to provide ample opportunities for healing.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87410.name: Secrets of Imaskar
87410.description:
From the PDF introduction

Lost Empires of Faerûn Web Enhancement

An Adventure for Four 6th-Level Player Characters

Lost Empires of Faerûn details the ancient past of the FORGOTTEN REALMS Campaign Setting-its magic, its greatness, and its failures. The book also offers invaluable tips for making a campaign world’s past relevant to current events. Secrets of Imaskar is a short D&D adventure for four 6th-level player characters (PCs). This short adventure uses feats, spells, monsters, and historical elements from ancient Imaskar. The action takes place in far eastern Mulhorand, at the edge of the Raurin Desert. In other campaign worlds, this adventure can be placed any place where the ruins of an ancient empire might be found. As always, feel free to adapt the material presented here as you see fit to make it work with your campaign.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87411.name: A Druid's Grove
87411.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Magic of Faerûn Web Enhancement

Magic of Faerûn has chapters on Understanding Magic, Magic Variants, Practitioners of Magic, Places of Power, Spells, Magic Items, and Creatures. This sample druid’s grove is a place of power that could not be constrained within the 192 pages of this sourcebook.

This layout intentionally begins on page 2. There is no page 1.

User Comment

This shares the same name as the web enhancement for Masters of the Wild.

87412.name: I'm O.K - A Murder Simulator
87412.description:
This game was created and released in response to the "modest video game proposal" issued in late-2005 by activist attorney Jack Thompson, known for his opposition to sex and violence in entertainment, including computer and video games. This challenge dared computer game producers to release a game following a "script" he outlined, in which the grieving father of a child killed by a computer gamer takes vengeance by murdering many people connected with the gaming industry in a brutal manner. Thompson promised to contribute a $10,000 donation to the charity of choice of Paul Eibeler (then-chairman of Take-Two Interactive, one of the game companies most heavily criticized by Thompson) if such a game were released. However, he has since claimed that the proposal was only a joke, and currently, no charity has been designated by Eibeler. The makers of the gaming-related webcomic Penny Arcade have, however, made a $10,000 donation in Thompson's name to Child's Play, a charity they founded to provide children in hospitals with toys and games.

The "O.K" in the title refers to the initials of the protagonist, Osaki Kim, but together with the second part of the game's name is also a play on the accusation that video game violence is being considered normal by manufacturers and gamers. The reference to a "Murder Simulator" refers to what Thompson regularly proclaims all violent computer games to be.

I'm O.K is a side-scrolling game with 16-bit era low-resolution graphics that shares (to a degree) the basic gameplay (and somewhat lowbrow humor) of the Metal Slug series.

Source: Wikipedia, "I'm O.K – A Murder Simulator", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

rpgseries: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement
87413.name: The Modrons
87413.description:
From the PDF introduction

A Manual of the Planes Web Enhancement

No creatures are more alien and mysterious than the ultralawful modrons. In this web-only supplement, available exclusively from the Wizards of the Coast website, we offer statistics for these geometrical creatures, plus an extensive background on their history, society, life cycle, and relationships with other planar creatures.

What’s a mortal to make of the modrons-those strange creatures of absolute order that whir and click along in the Clockwork Nirvana of Mechanus? To an outsider, they seem to have no existence other than as a whole. Indeed, there is a saying: "To look at one modron is to look at all of them."

It is only logical that these creatures are native to Mechanus. Rumor has it that they are the keepers of their mechanical plane, the maintainers of the gears and the polishers of the cogs. Modrons keep the whole place running smoothly and cleanly-without them, Mechanus would surely break down.

Though the majority of modrons live in Regulus (their own city in Mechanus), they can be encountered anywhere within the planes. No modron is ever without a task to carry out, though these tasks may be no more comprehensible to other creatures than the modrons themselves are.

Just what are the goals of these creatures of ultimate order? Do they want to impose total law over the rest of the cosmos? Are they simply keepers of the machinery that drives the multiverse-the repair unit of infinity? Or are they devious players on the cosmic gameboard, trying to eliminate their competition? These questions may never be answered, and a host more may never be asked. No one but a modron truly understands a modron.

87414.name: What Could Be Worse?
87414.description:
Publisher Blurb:

What is worse? Addressing congress or being naked in public? Or addressing a naked congress? Or being naked, while addressing a naked congress? Or sitting on a baby?

These are the kinds of things you'll have to figure out when you play "What Could Be Worse?"

You and several of your friends (or maybe they're strangers, or maybe you're playing this in prison where the other people aren't quite strangers but don't really count as friends) take turns deciding what to compare your comparisons to.

Roll a die to figure out whether it's something Worse, Better, or As Bad As a card from your hand.

Then there's a lot of cards with funny crap on them, and whatever- there's no point teaching the game in a blurb. Buy the game, play it, laugh your butt off, and thank us later.

87415.name: Political Machine 2008
87415.description:
Introduction

The Political Machine is a PC strategy game in which players run for President. Players can choose an existing candidate or can design their own from scratch, then choose a map/scenario to campaign in. From there, players must tackle the issues and battle against their ideological opponent for victory on election day.

Playing the game

Each scenario divides out the map into states (or provinces depending on the scenario). Each state is worth a certain number of electoral votes in which the player must win a majority of them on election day to win the game.

A player has two major political resources, capital and money. What they do with these two resources depends on the strategy employed. Each candidate has a number of traits that provide them with strengths and weaknesses such as charisma, stamina, integrity, intelligence, and position on the issues.

As the player travels the country, they can raise money, build campaign head quarters, do policy research, make speeches, take out advertisements, or hire political consultants with various abilities.

Meanwhile, your opponent will be doing the same thing. As the game progresses, the map will begin to turn either red or blue depending on who is winning (or purple of it's a tossup).

Spend too much time raising money and you won't have built up an effective grassroots movement. Spend too much time giving speeches or building political capital with local politicians and you won't have the money to take out advertisements, or conduct policy research that gives you access to better consultants and more effective campaign techniques.

Source: The Game Website.

87416.name: Atlantic City Jackpot Game
87416.description:
Contents: 3 dice, with BAR, Bell, Lemon, Cherries, Orange, and Plum faces.

From the packaging: Each player contributes 10 chips to the pot before starting the game. The starting player pays one chip into the pot to roll the dice, and is rewarded from the pot according to the payoff as shown. At the end of the game, the remaining chips are divided equally amongst the players.

Distributed by Howard Sales Company, Margate, N.J.

87417.name: Pokémon Trading Card Game
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
87417.description:
Pokémon Trading Card Game is a video game simulation of the original tabletop collectible card game with role-playing elements similar to earlier titles in the Pokémon series. Players control a young boy named Mark (Japanese: パーク Parke), and must travel around the game world interacting with non-player characters and challenging them to card battles using 60-card decks. During gameplay, the player must defeat eight Club Masters, each with a different deck representing one of the game's elemental card types, allowing them to face four Grand Masters and earn the right to inherit four powerful Legendary Cards. A total of 226 cards exist within the game, which include cards from the first three sets of the real-life game, as well as exclusive cards not available outside of the game. The player is given to opportunity to choose one of three starter decks at the start of their journey, each containing Pokémon cards revolving around the three possible starting creatures from Pokémon Red and Blue. As players defeat opponents, they are rewarded with booster packs containing a random assortment of additional cards they may use in their deck, with up to four separate decks able to be saved at a time.

Up to two players may interact with each other using the Game Boy Color's infrared linking capability to battle or trade cards As players trade with one another, they are given access to a special feature called "Card Pop!", which allows them to obtain cards that would otherwise be inaccessible in the main game

Source: Wikipedia, "Pokémon Trading Card Game (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87418.name: The Maw
videogamehonor: 2010 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
87418.description:
The Maw is set in a futuristic universe. The game begins with Frank, a pacifist bipedal alien, and The Maw, a purple one-eyed creature with large teeth, both having been captured by the Galactic Bounty Hunters. For unknown reasons the ship on which they are being held crash lands on a strange planet, killing everyone the crew. Alone, they set out for a communications tower in the distance while on the run from additional Galactic Bounty Hunters who have come to recapture them.

In The Maw players control Frank, who in turn controls The Maw via an electrical leash. Gameplay involves guiding The Maw in specific directions to clear obstacles and complete levels. The Maw also has the ability to eat objects and creatures, taking on some of the properties of the thing it eats, such as breathing fire, flying, or simply growing in size. Players then use The Maw's increased abilities to navigate previously impossible sections of a level.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Maw", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87419.description:
Het Zuinig Rijden Bordspel - freely translated to "The Economical Driving Boardgame" - is made by Shell as a promotional game for "De Zuinig Rijden Beweging" ("The Economical Driving Movement").
This movement wishes to help drivers save 10 percent fuel by giving and sharing driving tips.

The game components:
- gameboard
- 4 cars (pawns)
- 2 dice
- gamerules

The game is based on the game Game of Goose. Though in this game the players drive their car and confront problems like an open bridge, driving with open windows or using the wrong fuel.
Favorables for example are switching on cruise control, or throwing double 5, which means you shifted to fifth gear correctly.
Winner is the player ending his or her move on field 63.
87419.name: Het Zuinig Rijden Bordspel

87420.name: Harvest Moon 64
87420.description:
The objective of Harvest Moon 64 is to take over your grandfather's farm, which was left in disarray since his death, with weeds, stones, and tree stumps littering the farm land. The game operates on an accelerated time; a single day lasts very little time, and each season only lasts for 30 days. Time does, however, stand still if the player enters a particular building (i.e.: the bakery or the barn). To get a quality evaluation, the player must cultivate and ship crops, raise quality animals, interact with the other villagers, get married, and have a baby. The player starts out with the bare minimum features for the farm - a small house, a shipping bin, a barn for sheep and cows, a coop for chickens, a silo, a shed, and farm land. The player's house contains a television, a journal, a calendar that shows the date, and a toolbox.

Source: Wikipedia, "Harvest Moon 64", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87421.name: Sam's Smugglers Emporium Part 2
87421.description:
From the PDF introduction

The following continues the tour of Sam’s Smuggler’s Emporium, wherein a grizzled veteran trader and smuggler named Sam shows off his wares to those folk fixing to stock up on appropriate supplies . . .

Part Two

Sam leads you through the maze of shelves and boxes to a large metal rack next to what appears to be a pile of engine parts. On the rack is yet another mixed assortment of items, from what appear to be large storage boxes to a pile of cargo netting.

"Well, you had me ‘Verse survival collection, now this here is what I like to think of as your Spacer’s essentials, at least if you’re runnin’ any manner of transport that is."

"Here we have something I don’t think any spacer should be without, the good old Traveller’s Lockbox, for storing all your bits of precious, safe and sound...I still have one of these myself, ah the memories..."

87422.description:
Huckepack durch die Wüste - freely translated "Porters through the Desert" - is a adventurous dice game.

Game components:
- a cloth game board, 49 x 49 cm
- 4 sets of 3 wooden game pawns (12 in total)
- 1 die
- the rules

From the game:
Somewhere in Arabia, in a small settlement on the border of the never ending desert, a great tension can be felt. In the shadow of an old palm tree four bold nomad sons are planning a dare-devil adventure. What is their plan? Will they really try to cross the desert by the infamous west route? Don't they know the treacherous quicksand and all those other dangers which lie in wait for them? Have no fear! With cautiousness, good companionship and some luck this route is passable. Each caravan still has one place open - dare this adventure and join them!

The rules:
Each player has three pawns with which to reach the large oasis in the middle of the board. Pawns are moved by throwing the die. A pawn can get stuck in quicksand, and then has to be rescued by another pawn of the same player. (Optional: or by rolling a six.) A rescued pawn is carried on the back of the other to the next oasis, where the pawn which was stuck has to rest till another pawn ends its turn there, or a six is rolled by the player.

When a pawn ends its move on a field where another pawn already is, it can climb on the others back, and be carried/ported by it. This is possible with both your own or other players pawns. (Multiply carrying is allowed.) However: a carried pawn should hop off before reaching the next oasis, as once the porter reaches it, it will drop off all carried pawns in the oasis! And likewise with resting pawns from being stuck in the quicksand: formerly carried pawns will have to rest till another pawn ends its turn there, or a six is rolled by the corresponding player.

When a pawn ends it turn on a place from which a short track continues (shown by a road sign), this may be taken on the next turn. Any carried pawns are carried along.
To reach the end oasis, a pawn has to reach it, either by throwing the required number exactly or higher.

Winner of this adventurous journey is the player who has crossed the desert with his or her three pawns first.
87422.name: Huckepack durch die Wüste

87423.name: Collapse Field Simulation Manual
87423.description:
User Summary

The Field Simulation Manual is a free player's guide for the Collapse RPG.

It includes:


Dice mechanics
Character creation rules
Combat rules
Survival rules
Argentina background information

87424.name: Realm Masters Guide
87424.description:
User summary

The Lycadican Realm Masters Guide contains game master information and advice, and also the combat rules.

It includes:

Character awards
World building
Running a campaign
Combat rules

87425.name: Codex Lycadican Canonici
87425.description:
User summary

The Codex Lycadican Canonici contains the Lycadican magic rules.

87426.description:
"Roue Breizh / The Lords of Brocéliande" is strategy game set during the Dark Ages in the Celtic land of Brittany (the north-west corner of France). In the Breton language "Roue Breizh" means "King of Brittany" (Roue is pronounced "Roué", the old pronunciation of the French word Roi or King). The game comes with an educational booklet setting out the history of what was, to the medieval mind, a mystical land associated with the knights of the Round Table and the legendary forest of Brocéliande.

In this game, players play the feudal lords of Brittany who have survived the fall of Rome (or have fled from their original homeland: Britain) and now face barbarian invasions from the sea and the encroachments of the Frankish kingdom from the east. The Breton lords gradually settle and connect up their different domains, establishing towns and defending themselves against the terrible Vikings and Northmen. The aim of the game is to found ever larger baronies, counties and duchies, whether on one's own, or in combination with the domains of an ally. At the end of the game, one of these lords will be crowned King of Brittany: the "Roue Breizh"!

Mechanisms: Kingdoms are made and unmade, alliances are formed at will. There's no elimination of players. Instead, players are given the chance to form alliances, and may freely give and receive lands as they make or break alliances at the end of each turn. During a turn, members of the same alliance are not allowed to attack each other. Being a member of a strong alliance will allow each player in the alliance to have a better dice-roll in times of conflict. Some players are also members of the Council of Brocéliande, which gives its members more power, but also - inevitably - the obligation to redistribute resources and to promote the development of other players instead! Gaming enthusiasts will certainly enjoy the fact that "Roue Breizh" gives a decisive advantage to team-play, through the principle of rotating "coalitions". Between each round of play, the formation and re-formation of teams gives rise to complex interactions between the players as they negotiate the terms of their alliance.

(This is an amended version of the summary published on the Tric Trac website, in French).
87426.name: Roue Breizh

87427.name: Up the Garden Path
87427.description:
