Special Game Adventure for the 1986 National Garden Festival.

For 5-8 Characters, Levels 4-7.

From the back cover:

The day has been long and hard and, as night falls, you gratefully surrender to the soft, silent blackness of well-earned sleep.

Then the dream comes.

You are seated on a throne in a cavern where the sun has never shone: where no voice has ever spoken. Yet you are not alone. Through the darkness, silent figures are moving. Blacker than black... formless yet menacing... advancing towards you from every side...

You feel their touch; icy claws plucking at your skin and hair, lifting the throne and carrying you helpless on a journey from darkness into further darkness, from silence into deeper silence. You scream, and a million anguished, reedy voices answer your call.

Suddenly you awake...

...and the dream is real.

This adventure is for use with the DUNGEONS & DRAGONS Expert and Basic Rules Sets. Both of these are needed to use the information in Up the Garden Path. Experienced Dungeon Masters of the ADVANCED DUNGEONS & DRAGONS game should have no difficulty in adapting this adventure to the AD&D game system.

(c)1986 TSR UK Limited. All Rights Reserved. Printed in the United Kingdom. This special promotional adventure module is not for sale outside the United Kingdom.

From the introduction:

A Special, Not-too-serious, Dungeons & Dragons Adventure Module for the National Garden Festival, Stoke-on-Trent - 1986.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine Game Nominee
87428.description:
(from Battles website:)

Wagram 1809 simulates one of Napoleon's greatest victories. After the troubling defeat at Essling on 22 May 1809, and still holding Vienna, Napoleon needed to renew his confidence and finish the campaign.
For the second time, Napoleon crossed the Danube to meet the force of Archduke Charles. This time, however, preparations for the crossing were better and during the night of 4-5 july he managed to get most of his troops across.
The battle of Wagram could then commence, and it would last for two days.

The game is at divisional scale and uses a plotted system of moving army corps with alternating activations of units during the turn. There is no CRT and units become progressively weaker during the battle.
For Wagram 1809, Laurent Martin has used an adaptation and evolution of the system he has already used for the battle of Bull Run and Cedar Creek, which appeared in Vae Victis.
87428.name: Wagram 1809

87429.name: Birdie
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87429.description:
User Summary

Birdie is part flight simulator, part exploration game. The player controls Birdie, a white bird of unknown species. The game starts in a forest where the player can practice flying (there is no danger there except for other birds if Birdie flies too high for too long). Avian flight dynamics are modelled quite well (wings must be beat at a regular rythm to avoid stalling, speed is gained by diving). Butterflies can be picked up for an energy boost (but too much eating and Birdie becomes aggressive and hard to control). Scattered in the forest are Magic Doors which lead to several surreal landscapes, peopled by all manners of bizarre creatures (the manual hints that these may be what a bird's dreams are like).

There is no definite ending in this game, the player can keep exploring the game as long as Birdie can be kept alive.

87430.name: Tales of the Old Margreve
87430.description:
publisher blurb

Tales of the Old Margreve contains 8 eerie forest adventures for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game in a unique Old World setting inspired by the medieval folktales and superstitions of Eastern Europe.

Here in the Old Margreve Forest, heroes trek past crumbled griffon towers, over stiles and shepherds' fields, to where the lonely road thins and branches under the dark canopy of the trees. Deep in the forest's misty hollows, you may hear the rusalka's song rising over the crackle of a midnight fire or glimpse the white flash of a deer centaur's tail as it vanishes between the trees.

In this place, those who ignore the old ways are never seen again.

Inside you'll find:

-8 adventures for player characters of 1st to 10th level
-Dozens of Margreve sites, inhabitants and adventure hooks
-12 unsettling new monsters
-New spells and incantations
-Unexpected powers wielded by the living forest itself!
Whether you choose to take your players into the legendary forest between the realm of the vampire knights and the clockwork city of Zobeck, or cherry-pick its contents for your own campaign world, Tales of the Old Margreve will challenge your players to earn a place in fireside tales.

Written by Tim and Eileen Connors, Richard Pett, and Open Design patrons, with frequent review, playtest and feedback to maximize playability. 112 pages.

user comment

Also, the book includes a brief short story by Wade Rockett.

87431.name: Clash (1987)
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC Floppy disc edition
87431.description:
User Summary

Manu, a small-time thief living in the Paris suburbs comes home from the cinema to find his mother lying dead in a pool of blood in her appartment, a knife at her side. The building caretaker sees him with the murder weapon and phones the police. Manu flees the scene and finds himself the prime suspect in her mother's murder. He has no choice but to find the murderer and retrieve the knife with his fingerprints.

Clash is a graphical adventure game. The player uses icons to move around town, question Manu's former friends and acquaintances, search for clues and escape the police. The game has a time limit (8 hours and 15 minutes); it can only be solved by carefully talking to almost every character in the game, taking notes and making a map of the city.

87432.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 20 - Apr/May 1980)
rpgissuearticle: Campaign Use Of "City State Of the World Emperor"
Jocular Judgments: The Ballad of Judges Guild
Shrewd Slants from the Sagacious Sage
Traveller Merchants: An Expanded Character Generation System
87432.description:
Judges Guild Journal
Issue #20
April/May 1980

Cover art by Kevin Siembieda (inks) and Bob Hadley (colours).

87433.name: Contamination
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
UK Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87433.description:
User Summary

Unknown viruses are spreading like wildfire across the world. You, as newly-elected head of the World Health Organization, must lead the fight against the new diseases, find ways to prevent the spread of the contagion, research and develop cures while trying to minimize civic unrest.

The game has strategy and arcade elements. It is played in real time. The player is presented with a world map showing the different infection sources. There are different choices to limit the spread of the infection, from quarantining the area to using nuclear bombs to sterilize the place. The player can also order samples to be picked up in infected zones. The game then enters its arcade sequence, where the player must pick up virus elements floating around in a petri dish and assemble them to form an antivirus. Once an antivirus is made, it can be tested (often with horrible side effects such as lungs liquefaction or brain haemorrage), then distributed to the infected areas.

Distributing antiviruses with a lot of side effects and using scorched earth policies can result in the rise of public unrest. If it rises too high, the player can be sacked (and the game is over).

87434.name: Gutter
87434.description:
User Summary

Gutter is an arcade game. The player leads a metal ball rolling down a gutter. There are several creatures in the game, some give points when hit (like kings, queens and jesters), other must be avoided (the monk takes the ball back to the start of the level, the executioner removes a life); there are also items with special effects, sending the player to the next level, giving an extra ball, giving a score multiplier for a short period of time...

87435.name: Monopoly Junior
87435.description:
From the box blurb:

Now play the junior version of the world's most popular game on CD-ROM. Join Mr Monopoly and his nice and nephew Sandy and Andy in a fun amusement park with stalls, fun buildings and rides.

User Summary

This is a faithful representation of the Junior Monopoly boardgame. Mr Monopoly pops up to tell you what to do to enforce the rules of the game, which is quite helpful for small children, for example if you try to pay the wrong amount he will say so and ask you to try again. Similarly you have to click on your destination square correctly after you've rolled the die.

There are also 8 minigames you access by landing on the appropriate square. They have no bearing on the game but are fun as a diversion.

87436.name: The Dungeoneer (Issue 10, Mar - Apr 1979)
rpgissuearticle: Corrections to Issue 9 of The Dungeoneer
Errata Sheets for "Of Skulls and Scrapfaggot Green"
A New and Radically Different Skills System
87436.description:
The Dungeoneer
Vol. III, No. 2
Issue #10
March/April 1979

Cover art by Paul Jaquays.

videogame: Jet Set Willy II: The Final Frontier
87437.name: Hit Pak 6>Pak
videogamecompilation: Jet Set Willy II: The Final Frontier
87437.description:
User Summary

A set of older titles released on one disc - 6 + a free bonus game. These were:

Scooby Doo, Fighting Warrior, 1942, Antiriad, Jet Set Willy 2, Split Personalities and Duet.

87438.name: Gołębie
87438.description:
"Gołębie" ("Pigeons") is a non-collectible mini card game for 2 players in which they take the roles of pigeons. They "fight" with the patience of people waiting at a bus stop. The purpose of the game is to be the bird that reduces their patience the most.

There are total 5 character cards. Each character card has different number of marks printed on it. These marks are called "patience". During the play "patience" on those cards will be covered by player's markers as they play their pigeons cards. After all "patience" on a card is covered, that card is put aside – it won’t be used till the end of the game.

Game ends when all character cards has been put aside. Players count their markers on those cards. One with the most counters wins the game.

87439.name: Harry & Harry: La Boîte de Rajmahal
87439.description:
User Summary

Los Angeles, 1930. George was just coming back home with the newspaper he just bought when two thugs jumped out of a car and kidnapped him, yelling "We've got da professor!". George wakes up in a damp basement. He's tied to a chair and from the conversation he overhears, he'd better find a way out quickly.

Harry & Harry is a graphical text adventure game inspired by the film noir genre. Graphics are in black and white and the text uses a lot of slang words. Like a lot of other adventure games of the era, Harr & Harry uses a text parser for player input (there is a list of all the recognized words in the game manual). While george's first goal is to escape his prison, he soon finds out this is more than a random kidnapping; it has something to do with the Box of Rajmahal, a 2000 years object rumored to hold the secrets of Existence.

The game in progress can't be saved, but once the player finishes a chapter (there are three in this game), he's given a code to unlock the next.

87440.name: The Dungeoneer (Issue 13 - Sep-Oct 1979)
rpgissuearticle: The Die is Cast: Review: Authentic Thaumaturgy
87440.description:
The Dungeoneer
Issue #13
September/October 1979

Cover art by Paul Jaquays.

87441.name: Harry & Harry: Mission Torpedo
87441.description:
User Summary

Mission Torpedo takes place right after the first game of the series. George is going home with the Box of Rajmahal when he is attacked (again!) by two thugs who steal the Box. George must once again investigate, find who is the mysterious Boss of the crime syndicate looking for the Box, seduce a spy, spend an eventful evening at an opera, pursue mysterious foes in the sewers...

The game uses the same engine as the first game: a text parser for player input (all the recognized words are listed in the manual), black and white graphics and is split in several chapters unlocked by a code.

87442.name: Hold-Up
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87442.description:
User Summary

Hold-up is a top-down view arcade game in which the goal is to steal money from an armoured van. The player controls a red car and must explore the town, find and stop the van (by crashing into it), and pick up any money bag left on the road. The player is also chased by several police cars; these can be slowed down by dropping oil on the road. The player must also manage the car's fuel level (there are several gas stations available in town). Once the van has been destroyed and all bags collected, the player moves to the next level.

87443.name: Macadam Bumper
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
UK Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87443.description:
User Summary

Macadam Bumper is a French pinball simulation developed by Remi Herbulot. The game has a single classic pinball table, inspired by vintage 70's machines (no extraball or multiball for example), but includes a machine editor allowing players to create all sorts of alternative tables for the game.

87445.name: Rollespil
87445.description:
Excerpt from the Introduction:

Denne bog henvender sig primært til tre grupper: personer der gerne vil vide mere om rollespil, bibliotekarer og pædagoger, der overvejer at bringe rollespil inden for bibliotekernes eller institutionernes fire vægge, og til undervisere, der mangler undervisningsmaterialer til tema- eller kursusundervisning.


User Translation from Danish:

This book mainly addresses three groups: people who want to know more about RPGs, librarians and social educators who are considering bringing RPGs into the library or institution and educators who lack teaching resources for themes or courses.


Additional User Summary:

A Danish book about RPGs. It includes short reviews of Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (2nd Edition), Call of Cthulhu (2nd - 6th Edition), Drakar och Demoner (1st, 2nd, & 3rd Editions) (Danish edition), Basic Dungeons & Dragons (Danish edition), GURPS (1st & 2nd Editions), Marvel Super Heroes, Middle-earth Role Playing (1st & 2nd Editions), Paranoia (2nd Edition), Star Wars (WEG Original Edition), Viking: Et rollespil om vikingetiden and Warhammer Fantasy Roleplay (1st Edition). It also includes sections on RPG computer games, board games etc.

87446.name: The Dungeoneer (Issue 16, Mar - Apr 1980)
rpgissuearticle: Dungeoneer Depths: The Lair of Krepache the Leper
A New and Radically Different Expertise System
The Mystic: A New Magic-User Sub-Class
87446.description:
The Dungeoneer
Issue #16
March/April 1980

Cover art by Kevin Siembieda and Bob Hadley.

87447.name: Le Passager Du Temps
87447.description:
User Summary

Your uncle, an eccentric inventor, hasn't been seen these last few weeks. Worried, you travel to his villa, only to find the door locked from the inside. Finding how to open this door is the start of an adventure that will see travel in time and space in search of your uncle, marooned somewhere in time...

Le Passager du Temps is a classic graphical text adventure. The game display a view of the current location and a bit of text. The player uses a text interpreter to enter commands. The player is accompanied by a cat, who cracks jokes every now and then and can give tips, provided the player is nice enough with her. She doesn't like curse words and will let you know by blocking the game until the player apologize.

Le Passager Du Temps was developed by Patrick Beaujouan and Alain Bregeon.

87448.name: Micro Sapiens
87448.description:
User Summary

Micro Sapiens is a game with both arcade and word puzzle elements. A game is played in several rounds. Each round begins with an arcade sequence where the player must pick up letters while dodging a monster. When the player has been captured by the monster (or when all the letters have been picked up), the word puzzle start: players have 30 seconds to find the best word possible with the letters they picked up (some letters are worth more points than other). The player with the best scoring word wins the round.

87449.name: Towers
87449.description:
Towers is a game with elements of chess and checkers, played on an 8X8 board

Players start with 15 Towers and one Castellans, with both moving like the chess Rook, and may leap orthogonally over an adjacent piece, landing on the next empty cell.

Castellans may additionally step a single cell diagonally, but not to the goal cell, the corner to a player's left, without capturing.

A player may not enter their own goal cell.


CAPTURE - There are two ways of capture:
Custodian, sandwiching an opponent's piece orthgonally between two of your own pieces, or by Intervention; where a piece steps between two orthogonally placed enemy pieces, it captures them both.

It is possible to move so as to capture in more than one direction at a time.

87453.name: Gauntlet
87453.description:
Played on an 8X8 board, Gauntlet is a game of unequal forces.

White has six pieces centred on last row on one side of board.

Black has six in each adjacent side (2 sides for 12 pieces)

MOVEMENT - All stones move in just one direction one space at a time

The right Black stones move left,
The left Black stones move right,

The White stones move away from their start row.
White runner player moves first!

Stones are captured by jumping enemy stones. Captures are mandatory, but the player may choose between multiple captures.

The two sides have differing goals, white to reach the last rank with one stone.

Black to capture all white stones.

87454.name: Oxphar
87454.description:
User Summary

Oxphar the knight is on a quest to find the blue stone of Savanah, said to bring supreme happiness to whoever finds it. He's accompanied by Gal, a strange and malformed creature who calls itself the Game Master.

Oxphar is a graphical text adventure game. The scenario was developed after a theater play created by the French troup "la Compagnie de la Manicle". As it is, a player can finish the game by following the actions depicted in the play, though there are other ways to succeed implemented in the game. The setting of the game is rather unique, blending fantasy with anachronistic objects and situations (it was described as "poetic and adult" by several reviewers). Gal the Game Master travel with the player and intervenes at several points of the story (often with sarcastic remarks). Gameplay-wise, the game uses a text interpreter for player input (the text parser can learn new words if you teach it a synonym), and a system of icons for managing the player's inventory.

Oxphar was programmed by Philippe Taupin, with graphics by Michel Rho.

87457.name: Street Fighter Collection
87457.description:
Street Fighter Collection is a 1997 fighting game compilation released for the PlayStation and Sega Saturn. It collects the original Super Street Fighter II and its follow-up Super Street Fighter II Turbo, along with an enhanced version of Street Fighter Alpha 2 titled Street Fighter Alpha 2 Gold exclusive to this compilation.

It was followed by a second compilation in 1998 titled Street Fighter Collection 2, also released for the PlayStation and Saturn. This volume features the original Street Fighter II, along with Street Fighter II': Champion Edition and Street Fighter II': Hyper Fighting, essentially releasing the entire Street Fighter II sub-series for the PlayStation and Sega Saturn.

Source: Wikipedia, "Street Fighter Collection," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87459.name: Street Fighter EX
videogamehonor: 1998 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
87459.description:
Street Fighter EX is a head-to-head fighting game with 3D graphics, originally released as a coin-operated arcade game for the Sony ZN hardware in 1996. It is a spin-off of the Street Fighter series co-produced by Capcom with Arika and was the first game in the series to feature polygon graphics. It was followed by an updated arcade version titled Street Fighter EX Plus, as well as a PlayStation-exclusive home version titled Street Fighter EX Plus α, both released in 1997.

Source: Wikipedia, "Street Fighter EX," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87460.name: Street Fighter EX2
87460.description:
Street Fighter EX2 is a 2D head-to-head fighting game with 3D graphics, co-produced by Capcom and Arika originally released in 1998 as a coin operated arcade game for the Sony ZN-2 hardware. It is a sequel to the original Street Fighter EX, a 3D spinoff of the Street Fighter series. An updated version of the game titled Street Fighter EX2 Plus was released in 1999 for the arcades as well and subsequently ported to the PlayStation. It was followed by Street Fighter EX3.

Source: Wikipedia, "Street Fighter EX2," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87461.name: Rochester in a Box
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
87461.description: This is a Monopoly clone based on the city, Rochester, NY. Board Squares are replaced with local businesses & landmarks.

87462.name: Street Fighter EX3
87462.description:
Street Fighter EX3 is the third console installment in the Street Fighter EX series developed by Arika and published by Capcom. The game was released in 2000 for PlayStation 2 in Japan and North America, and subsequently released in Europe in 2001.

Source: Wikipedia, "Street Fighter EX3," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87463.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms 2
87463.description:
Tactical level wargame based on the Chinese historical novel "Romance of the Three Kingdoms". This game covers field combat of the early episodes of the novel, and does not include later episodes siege combat.

Players control warlord forces at the end of the Han dynasty. The purpose of the game is to eliminate enemy troops.

Players organize their units secretly.
Search and leader's ability are the most important elements of the game. Surprise and preemptive attacks occur under search condition.
Leaders' duels are first resolved in battle. Then leaders attack opponent force, and finally force combat is resolved.

NOTE: this game has no direct relation with the same publisher's "Romance of the Three Kingdoms". Both games only share the same background.

87464.name: Wall Ball
87464.description:
User summary:

Wall Ball is mainly a dexterity and aiming game where you control a brightly luminescent rectangle. You are at one end of a large rectangular area, at the other end of which there is a brick wall. The brick wall and the area you are standing on are parallel to each other. There also is a rapidly moving ball between the two ends. You must block the ball as it comes towards you, and aim it towards the brick wall. Based on the angle with which you block the ball, it can go straight towards the brick wall, or bounce off on the hypothetical horizontal walls of the area and reach the brick wall at a different angle. Your aim is to knock out as many bricks of the far wall as possible, earning points for doing so.

87465.name: Souls of the Brave: the Epic of the Alamo
87465.description:
Solitaire wargame, a print and play product, that mixes cards and dice to reproduce the most famous desperate battle of all time: the Alamo.
The player, as the Texans, must try to avoid that the far superior mexican force reaches the walls of the Alamo. The game uses a system reminescent of Butterfield's Raf, using cards for random activation of the Mexican force, while a combat system mutuated by Zulu Wars resolve each different combat situation that may arise during the game.

87466.name: Alles Paletti?!
87466.description: User Summary: This game is designed to help parents communicate and find new ways to think about their relationships with their children. Using a deck of cards, the game has various kinds of techniques to challenge a parent's view, and to help them see the world differently. For example, you might be asked to role-play a scenario, but with a specific attitude alien to your normal thinking. Or the card may ask a moral question, but you have to answer from the view of different ages. There are no 'right' or 'wrong' answers, and gamers may not consider Alles Paletti?! to be a game in the normal sense. But it is designed to use methods of play to bring out changes in people, without accusations and finger-pointing.

87467.name: Checkers Gomoku
87467.description:
The marriage of checkers and Gomoku.

Played on an 8X8 board, with 12 checkers each.

The game is played in two phases.

1) To start the game each player places a piece on an empty space and taking turns continue to do this until all pieces are on the board.

2) Then the second phase begins where they can move one piece each turn. A piece can move to any adjacent empty cell, in all 8 directions.

Players are attempting to create 5-in-a-row of their own colour either orthogonally or diagonally. When they achieve 5-in-a-row the player can remove one of the opponent's pieces.

The goal is to reduce the opponent's piece total to 4.

87468.description:
The dogs have all buried their bones in the yard but they cannot remember where. The players take turns looking through the dirt mounds trying to be the first doggie to find all of his bones.

In doggie bones the players use memory and deduction to locate their bones. There are simple rules for ages 3-5 and regular rules for ages 6+.
87468.name: Doggie Bones

87469.name: Robot Alchemic Drive
87469.description:
From the Back of the Box

Wield a powerful remote control unit and take command of a 120-foot-tall, fully armed transforming Meganite titan. Crush anything in your path and smash your way to victory.

87470.name: For Whom the Whistle Blows: Night Train 2
87470.description:
From the Publisher's website:
The Weird West of Deadlands has never been a particularly safe place, but just how much danger do you think your posse can take? Grab a copy of For Whom the Whistle Blows: Night Train 2 and find out.

Can you stop Baron LaCroix's newly-revitalized terror weapon, or will the West fall to his mad plans to win the Great Rail War? Death rides the rails, and it's up to you to punch its ticket!

For Whom the Whistle Blows: Night Train 2 is an adventure from the dark mind of John "Night Train" Goff for the award-winning Deadlands RPG, and can easily be added to an existing Deadlands campaign, no matter where in the Weird West your cowpokes have wandered

87471.name: Raaapidoo
87471.description:
From the rules:

Content:
5 big leaf shaped double-sided boards
32 smaller leafs with pictures

Goal:
To find 1 unique picture on each board.
Each round winner will receive 1 small pictured card. Get 5 cards to win the game.

Set-Up:
Set all 5 board so everyone could see them.Don't matter how or which way the boards are places, there always are only 1 picture same on each board.
32 smaller cards will remain with the game leader.

Game:
Game leader (older player) has all the 32 cards. He searched the one card that matches the picture on each board and placed it secretly before him. Only he/she knows that animal picture. To make it easier, game leaser may choose the right animal and other 4 animals and mix them and then place then on the table for everyone to see. One of them is the right one. The first one to name the right animal on each board, gets to keep the card. Cards should be hidden from other players.
Each players gets only 1 guess.
This goes until one player has gotten 5 cards.
After each round, game leader collects all board and places them in any order, only making sure that already picked animals would come up again.

Winner:
Game is over when 5th card for someone is collected.

87472.name: A.M.C.
videogameversion: FR/EN/ES/DE/IT Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
Spanish Amstrad CPC floppy disc edition
87472.description:
User Summary

As a member of the elite AMC ("Astro Marine Corps") you've been sent to the planet Dendar. Your goal is to stop the Deathbringers invasion. Once the invasion force is destroyed, use their ship to travel to their own planet and end their threat once and for all.

AMC is a side-scroller action game using Dinamic's "FX Doble Carga" ("FX double charge") system: the game is split in two part, the second part being unlockable by a code given after finishing the first part. Both parts' gameplay is similar (run to the left of the screen while killing enemies and picking up power-ups), only the enemies and power ups available are different. Though the player has an energy bar that diminishes when hit by enemies and that can be refilled by picking the appropriate power-up, there are lots of instant death traps, requiring the player to memorize the sequence of traps and creatures of the level.

Technical note:
The game engine uses Parallax scrolling, a feature many experts said to be impossible to implement on 8 bit machines like the Amstrad CPC.

87473.name: Das Kleine Einmaleins
87473.description:
From the box:
New game from Noris Spiele to help youngsters learn math like never before.
This board game that comes with a cool CD teaches youngsters all kinds of math, from adding to dividing.
But this is not just another boring math game, but this time each players had a mission cards and each time the game is different. Scores can be multiplied if you are smart or divided by your opponent if not careful enough.
Win this game by fulfilling you mission cards first.

87474.name: Vad säger djuren?
87474.description:
From the box:
Game for small children to help them learn about animals and what sound they make.
Each player gets a board with 5 animals on it - sheep, cat, cow, dog and a pig. Each animal has a different colored background.

Then all wooden tiles are shuffled. Each tile has a picture of an animal on one side, a colored circle on the other side. All tiles are shuffled good and placed the colored circle upwards. Now starting with the youngest player, they turn around tiles. When player turns around a red circle and it has a cat on it (which has a blue background), he/she need to do red animals voice (cow) while doing the cat move (sitting straight and doing ears). If that player is successful, he may place that tile on his board, covering that picture (cat).

When player turn around a blue circle tile, with a blue picture (cat), he/she just need to make a sound.

The first player to get all 5 tiles is the winner.

87476.name: The Society for Stacking Things on Top of Other Things
87476.description:
Publisher Blurb: The Society for Stacking Things on Top of Other Things is a small, fast-playing deck building game for 2-4 players.

Players will build a deck by drafting cards from a communal pool. These cards consist of Action cards and Thing cards.

Players take it in turn to play actions which affect how many cards can be drafted into their deck during their turn. After doing so, they may place a thing card on their personal stack. Once this is done there is a cleanup phase. During this phase players replenish their hands to ready themselves for the next turn.
Players attempt to create the biggest stack of Things. Each Thing is worth points. The first player to 1000+ points whom is able to place the Winner Flag on top of his stack is the winner.

87477.name: G.M. Magazine (Issue 13 - Sep1989)
rpgissue: G.M. - The Independent Fantasy Roleplaying Magazine
87477.description:
Contents:

•News
•CJ Cherryh Interview
•Reviews
•The Paint Shop
•GM Competition
•Books by Alan Crump
•Covention Corner
•LRP: Fools and Heroes
•Infernia: A roleplayers Guide by Jon Sutherland & Nigel Gross
•They want out women by Greg Costikyan
•The World of Robotech by Danni Segal
•Tolkein Society
•Comics by Philip Morton
•PBM Update by Wayne
•Readers Short Story
•The Axeman Cometh!
•Contacts
•Critical Hits by David Langford

87478.name: Kinect Adventures
videogamehonor: 2010 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
2011 British Academy Game Awards Best Family/Children's Game of the Year Nominee
87478.description:
From the Microsoft website:

Kinect™ Adventures will get you off the couch and into the game in a whole new way. You and your friends and family will jump, dodge, and kick your way through 20 pulse-pounding adventures set in exotic locations. Work together as you navigate through roaring rapids, challenge obstacle courses or save a leaky underwater laboratory. Show off and share your accomplishments online with Photo Moments and Living Statues. The spirit of adventure awaits!

87479.name: Geopol
87479.description:
From the game box:

Q: Do you know a county like Vietnam?
A: Yes, of course!
Q: Can you show this on the map?
A: .... eee I....wait wait...
Q: Did you know that 87 million people live there?
A: ...OK...

Board game that you are holding is made for getting knowledge about geopolitical in a fun way and to spend time in a great way.
World is full of amazing stuff, look around and compare countries by size, population, economy and power - it makes you think.

You goal is to answer and show correct placement and collect 5 cards from each continent.
Game lasts until one player has collected 5 cards from each continent, or if each country is claimed by someone or is the game gets boring, then the ones who has most cards is the winner.

On your turn you roll two dice. One dice shows which of the continents you have to choose from (6 is free choice) and the other dice shows how many countries you can try for this turn. Then player collects 1 or more cards from the corresponding card pack and sets himself ready. Then 2 minute timer is activated and active players must show with small tokens where each of those selected countries are.

There are many many optional rules for game play.

87482.name: Pacific
videogameversion: French Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
UK Amstrad CPC floppy disk edition
87482.description:
User Summary

Pacific is an arcade adventure game in which players control a sea diver searching for the lost treasures of Atlantis.

The game involves crossing screen after screen, dodging the deadly fauna and going as deep as possible. The player is equipped with a gun with a limited number of ammunition and an oxygen tank which needs periodic refills. There are several useful items scattered around, like ammunition, oxygen pumps, powder kegs that can be used to create holes in the coral reefs, and sextant which display a map of the player's surroundings and the current depth.

The ending of the game changes according to the gender the player has chosen at the beginning of the game.

87483.name: Heimat- und Sachkunde
87483.description:
From the box:
New board game for the children that comes with a great CD to make the experience even better. This game teaches all about your surroundings, about another kids and world. Each player chooses randomly a board and then his goal is to complete the puzzle. Each puzzle needs 6 correct pieces in correct category like dogs or traffic signs. CD teaches and put sounds to the game as well. Winner is the player who is able to complete 3 puzzles.

87484.name: A-10 Attack!
87484.description:
A-10 Attack! is a combat flight simulator for the Apple Macintosh computer released by Parsoft Interactive in 1995. The game features an A-10 Thunderbolt II aircraft that takes part in a variety of missions in West Germany during a hypothetical limited conventional attack by the Warsaw Pact. A-10 boasted one of the most detailed flight models of any game of its era, a physics model that extended to solid-body interactions with the ground and complete aerodynamics for every object in the game, including ordinance.

The game was followed by a sequel named A-10 Cuba!, originally as a stand-alone game on the Mac and Windows-based PC's, but later re-released on the Mac as a plug-in module for the original game. The Mac OS versions were produced by Parsoft, while the PC version of Cuba was a joint production with Activision.

Source: Wikipedia, "A-10 Attack!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87485.name: A-10 Cuba!
87485.description:
A-10 Cuba! is a flight simulator computer game released by Parsoft Interactive in 1996. A-10 Cuba! was the long awaited sequel to the original A-10 Attack! flight simulator.

It features an A-10 Thunderbolt II on a mission to defeat guerrilla forces at Guantánamo Bay, Cuba. As in most war flight simulator games, the main objectives contain defending an airbase, destroying ships, bridges, tanks or buildings and escorting other aircraft.

Source: Wikipedia, "A-10 Cuba!", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87486.name: Hellcats Over the Pacific
87486.description:
Hellcats Over the Pacific is a flight simulator computer game for the Apple Macintosh computer written by Parsoft Interactive and released by Graphic Simulations in 1991. Hellcats was a major release for the Mac platform, one of the first 3D games to be able to drive a 640 x 480 x 8-bit display at reasonable frame rates. The graphics engine was combined with a simple Mac interface, a set of randomized missions and a number of technical features that greatly enhanced the game's playability and made it a lasting favorite into the mid-1990s. The basic Hellcats engine was later adapted to produce a series of games, including A-10 Attack!, A-10 Cuba, the F-18 Hornet series and early versions of Warbirds.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hellcats Over the Pacific", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87487.name: Hellcats: Missions at Leyte Gulf
87487.description:
After Hellcats Over the Pacific shipped, the Parsoft team started work on improving the engine. Tweaks to the graphics engine provided even better performance, allowing more cycles to be spent on other tasks.

These upgrades were released a year later as Hellcats: Missions at Leyte Gulf. Although it was marketed as an upgrade pack, it was actually an entirely new game with its own runnable application. The new version included dramatically improved detail at the airbases, added jeeps and trucks, more detailed ships, the P-38 Lightning and the Ki-84 "Frank", and rockets and torpedoes in addition to the bombs and machine guns.

The rest of the game remained otherwise similar to Hellcats. Both the physics engine and missions system were largely unchanged. The new game included another eight missions, this time with no training. Although they all had considerably more detail and a greater number of in-game targets, they had the same lack of user editability as the original.

Source: Wikipedia, "Hellcats Over the Pacific", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87488.name: Bugdom
87488.description:
Bugdom is a third-person, action, platform computer game developed by Pangea Software for the Macintosh and was included with the iMac DV 2000 and later iBook models, as well as the PC by Gathering of Developers, and later Ideas From the Deep following the acquiring of Gathering via Take-Two Interactive in 2002. However, Take-Two apparently continued publishing illegal copies of Bugdom, prompting Ideas From the Deep to contact the FBI's crime division. Despite this, Take-Two continued to publish copies following the debate. It was released in North America on December 1, 1999.

Bugdom's story centers on the Bugdom, a kingdom inhabited by insects that appears as an outdoors bug environment. Originally, the kingdom was peacefully ruled by the rollie pollies and ladybugs, but not long ago, the kingdom was overthrown by the tyrannic and pompous King Thorax, leader of an evil clan of fire ants, as well as their evil follower bugs recruited prior to the kingdom's downfall. Thorax now rules the kingdom with an iron fist, and the ladybugs have been imprisoned in spider web cages scattered across the environment. The player assumes the role of main protagonist Rollie McFly, who has survived the ambush of the kingdom by taking refuge in the lawn area. Rollie must travel to Thorax's anthill on the distant reaches of the Bugdom, while freeing various trapped ladybugs along the way.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bugdom", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87489.name: Bugdom 2
87489.description:
Bugdom 2 follows the adventure of a grasshopper named Skip as he tries to get his stolen knapsack from Bully Bee throughout the game, Sam the Snail and Sally the Chipmunk assist him. The game is available for Mac OS X and Microsoft Windows. It was released for the iPhone on September 23, 2008.

Source: Wikipedia, "Bugdom 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

87490.name: Barony of Trond
87490.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The small barony of Trond is a vital link in the Low Winterlands’ trade network, yet it is one which enjoys only a fragile existence. Effectively held to ransom by neighboring Cul, resentment is growing at the expanding power of the frostborn. Racial tension simmers just below the surface, but it could soon spill out into open aggression.

87491.name: Totems of the Dead Player's Guide
87491.description:
From the Publisher:

Know, noble reader, that before you lies a savage new world of sword and sorcery like no other.

A terrible new age has dawned upon the Untamed Lands. The shining age of the ancestors is crumbling beneath a rising tide of blood and slaughter. Here lie the civilizations of the Untamed Lands, warring with their neighbors just to survive as their crops and game dwindle. The Skadians with their dragon-prowed ships, the Shenese with their wealth of silk and steel, the Maztlani with their obsidian edged blades and the Tribal Confederacies with the unbreakable strength of many arrows. Ruskar invaders stain the snow crimson while Atlantean war parties ravage the eastern shores. Meanwhile the serpent folk lie coiled to strike the warring human nations.

Hither lies a land in need of heroes.

Gird yourself for adventure and harden your heart against nameless things lurking in shadow. Explore the cliff-side ruins of the ancient Stone Shapers and seek treasures in the abandoned monuments of the Mound Raisers. Face off against vile sorcerers, simian sasquatch, the impervious Uktena serpent and ravenous wendigo or beat back elder horrors reawakened from ages long past. Live, love, slay and celebrate each victory as though it may be your last.

In this the Players Guide to the Untamed Lands, you will find a wealth of information including:

- A plethora of human cultures for you to play
- New weapons and equipment!
- New edges including Legendary edges!
- A magic system fitting for the sword and sorcery genre
- New arcane backgrounds such as the blood mage and rune caster
- New setting rules
- A gazetteer of the Untamed Lands

87492.name: Tobal 2
87492.description:
User Summary.

Sequel to Tobal No.1, Tobal 2 is a 3d fighting game released in Japan in 1997 by Squaresoft and developed by Dream Factory. Tobal 2 improved the graphics, the fighting engine and expanded the RPG elements from it's predecessor and features over 200 playable characters (with about 15 main characters). The character designs were done by Akira Toriyama.

87493.name: Mean Streets Casablanca
87493.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Casablanca, an add-on for Mean Streets. This book contains new material for use with Mean Streets, including new roles, gimmicks, background information, and a full-length adventure. It is intended to enhance noir stories by travelling beyond the shores of America to the exotic locale of Casablanca, as was made popular by the movie of the same name.

87494.name: Starter Pack
87494.description:
From the Packaging:

Add a third dimension to your Weird West game with over 200 Cardstock Cowboys! These heroes, scoundrels, and horror are perfect for use with the Deadlands roleplaying game and the Boomtowns! accessory, or our completely free miniatures rules, High Noon - available on our Weird Website -- www.deadlands.com!

87495.name: Horrors of the Weird West
87495.description:
From the Packaging:

Legions of slavering abominations abound in this macabre menagerie of Weird Western horrors! This set features the best nasties found in Rascals, Varmints, and Critters, as well as Rascals, Varmints, and Critters 2: The Book of Curses! Use 'em in your Deadlands roleplaying game, or with our free miniatures rules -- High Noon -- available on our Weird Website (www.deadlands.com).

87496.name: Infernal Devices
87496.description:
From the Packaging:

Ever dreamed of owning your own warehouse full of maniacal world-conquering devices? Now you can! This set puts everything from awesome steam tanks to flamethrowers in your hands. Use 'em in your Deadlands roleplaying game, or with our free miniatures rules -- High Noon -- available on our Weird Website (www.deadlands.com).

87497.name: Horrors of the Wasted West
87497.description:
From the Packaging:

Dig in to our savory dish of toxic torment! We've carefully blended only the best beasties in Muties, Monsters, and Misfits to add to your gruesome collection of Wasted West woes! We guarantee that it will add zip to your Hell on Earth roleplaying game, or use with our free miniatures rules -- High Noon -- available on our Weird Website (www.deadlands.com).

87498.name: Road Wars!
87498.description:
From the Packaging:

It's time for the demolition derby, baby! Here are over 45 cars, trucks, vans, motorcycles, and tractor trailers for your Wasted West posse to use and abuse! This set is exactly what you need to add a little road rage to your Hell on Earth roleplaying game, or use with our free miniatures rules -- High Noon -- available on our Weird Website (www.deadlands.com).

87500.name: Starter Pack
87500.description:
From the Packaging:

Add a third dimension to your Deadlands: Hell on Earth game! Inside this pack are over 200 wasters, brainers, and abominations awaiting your command! Use them with the Hell on Earth roleplaying game, or with our free miniatures rules--High Noon--available on our Weird Website (www.deadlands.com).
